loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elsa; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de comida en el paradero llamado Sr de Cabildo, ella vende comida desde las 12:00 p.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, su esposo es obrero realiza diferentes obras de construcción en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere tener un restaurant donde pueda preparar las comidas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y también para comprarse una cocina nueva.  
 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Communal Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers), which is located in the District of Santiago, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 51 years old, married, and has four children. Elsa divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food at the Señor de Cabildo bus stop. She sells food between noon and 10pm. Her husband is in construction and works at different sites throughout the city of Cusco. Elsa wants to open a restaurant where she can prepare her meals. The loan she is requesting will be used to acquire ingredients for cooking and to purchase a new stove.

Elsa is grateful to those who made her dream come true and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for cooking & a new stove

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria B. is from the village of Mitacas Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Manan-aw 2.

Gloria is 46 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a clothing business in her local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Rafiqaan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqaan lives in a small city in Pakistan called Jaranwala, which is famous for its agricultural industry. Rafiqaan has been living here with her family for the last 12 years in a 3-room brick house.

She is 40 years old and married to 45 year old G. S. who works in the field. He grows crops like wheat and rice in the fields. He works very hard to put three meals on the table for his family. Rafiqaan supports her family financially by operating a grocery shop adjacent to her home.

She has given birth to three daughters who are still very young and are below 10 years of age. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her grocery business. With the loan, she will buy groceries for her grocery shop and is hopeful that this investment will result in good profit for her and that her family’s financial condition will improve. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Rafiqaan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He sells building materials, like corals blocks, timber, nails, and iron sheets for retail. His potential customers are housing contractors and neighbours. 

Peter faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to open a hardware shop and supply goods for wholesale in the future.  With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase coral blocks, cement, timber, nails, and iron sheets for resale. 

He decided to join Yehu to acquire loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase coral blocks, cement, timber, nails, and iron sheets for resale.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila tiene 28 años D. edad, es casada y tiene un hijo menor D. edad, resiD. junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Ciudad Eten, una zona que se ha hecho conocida por la elaboración artesanal D. sombreros tejidos a base D. junco. El lugar se encuentra situado a media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. cinco años a la comercialización D. pescado fresco en el interior del mercado D. su distrito. Ella adquiere su mercadería diariamente en el terminal pesquero D. la región y luego ofrece su mercadería a los vecinos D. la zona que diariamente recurren a este centro D. abasto para adquirir diversos productos D. uso diario. Los ingresos que ella percibe D. esta actividad son utilizados para ayudar a su esposo, que es obrero D. construcción civil, con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar.

Petronila desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más pescado fresco D. modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes. Adicionalmente desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Petronila es una mujer con mucho carisma y que siempre brinda buen trato a sus clientes. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer bastante responsable y confiable.
texts.en:
Petronila is 28 years old. She is married and has a young child. She lives with her husband in the district of Ciudad Eten, an area which has become known for its production of handmaD. woven straw hats. The area is half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than five years, Petronila has worked selling fresh fish in the market of her district. She acquires her merchandise each day at the region's fishing terminal, and later she offers her products to neighbors in her area, who come to this supply center daily to acquire a range of everyday products. The income she receives from this work is used to help her husband, who is a civil construction laborer, to proviD. the family's economic support. 

Petronila wants to expand her business by purchasing more fresh fish so she can satisfy her customers' demands. In addition, she would like to make some improvements to her home. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles, which will help her achieve her goal. 

Petronila is a woman with great charisma who always provides good service to her customers. People who know her consider her a very responsible and trustworthy woman.

loans.use: Buying fresh fish to expand her business

loans.name: Ne

texts.en:
Mr. Ne L. is 23 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sopha Phal, is 20 years old.  They have been married since 2008 and have one young daughter. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  

Mr. Ne L. produces chairs and vases made of cement. His wife assists her husband in the business. 

Ne hopes to expand his business and to respond to his customer’s needs. So, he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to use for that purpose.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Hilaria's Group

texts.en:
Hilaria R. is from the village of Lingu. She is 47 years old. Hilaria is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Hilaria R..

Hilaria is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately $92 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hilaria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ser

texts.en:
Mr. Ser Y. (shown in the photo) is 40 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Thyda Tep, is 31 years old. They live along national road number six about ten kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two daughters. 

Ser is a mechanic. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to renovate the house where he lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where he lives.

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Hour S., 62, is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.18 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 17 on the other necessary expenses. 

Hour S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase rice to plant and sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell

loans.name: Teacalco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Teacalco y esta ubicado en Morelos, México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la tercera vez que solicita crédito. Reyna G. B. es una de las integrantes del grupo, es casada y tienes 62 años, estudió hasta el tercer grado de secundaria, tiene un total de 4 hijos; 3 varones y una mujer. Ella se dedica a la venta de carne, abarrotes, verduras y quesos negocio que inicio hace 31 años, la señora inicio su negocio para ayudar a su esposo ya que con el salario que gana no es suficiente para solventar los gastos de la familia, solicita el préstamo para comprar mercancía. Sus clientes la prefieren porque siempre encuentran los artículos que necesitan, y además de ser una persona muy amable y bondadosa. Al momento de solicitar el crédito ella se encuentra muy contenta porque va a poder pagar su pedido y comprar insumos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Teacalco” and located in Morelos, Mexico. The group consists of nine members and this is the third time they are requesting a loan.

Reyna G. B. is one of the group members. She is 62 years old, married, and studied through the third year of high school. Reyna has four children, three sons and a daughter. She sells meat, groceries, vegetables, and cheeses in her business that she started 31 years ago. Sra. Reyna started her business in order to help her husband since his salary is insufficient to cover the family expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise. Her customers prefer to buy from her because she always has the items they need. In addition, they find her to be a friendly and caring person. Upon applying for her loan, Reyna felt very happy because she will be able to pay for her orders and acquire supplies.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Mrs. Emely A. is from the village of San Roque, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Emely is married to Victor A., a bus driver, and is blessed with four school age and two adult age children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in snack vending, particularly rice cakes. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for five years already and earns approximately $117 a month from this activity. 

In 2010, Emely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a loan of 10,000 PHP. 

She is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP as her 2nd loan, which will be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially for her basic needs, savings, insurance and possible business expansion.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

location.town: Ozamiz - Baybay Sta. Cruz, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 36 years old and is married, with two children.  For ten years, he has been selling vehicle spare parts.  He has employed two people to help him in his tasks.  He also does poultry farming to boost his income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has developed a culture of saving.  He will be able to reinvest in his business.  He hopes to own real estate in the future.  He has requested  50,000 Kes to buy a gearbox and crank shafts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Lyroche

texts.en:
Lyroche is a 45-year old married woman. She has a 25-year old child. Her husband works as a jeepney dispatcher in their town. (Jeepneys are a popular means of public transportation in the Philippines.) 

Lyroche has been in the business of raising hogs for quite some time now. She plans to use her loan to purchase additional piglets and feed. Lyroche works hard to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Elvira Almazan's Group

texts.en:
Elvira A. is from the village of Sinamar. Elvira is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elvira A.'s Group.
Elvira is 49 years old, married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a canteen near the school. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her tenth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Marcelina, es casada y tiene 44 años de edad,  tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 de ellos es independiente, mientras que los otros tiene (20, 18, 17) años de edad, La socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y la ganadería actualmente ella compra y vende vacas y toros, la socia tiene vacas lecheras, toros, vaquillas, ella vende la leche de sus vacas en las ferias y a pedido, también elabora queso, la socia en esta oportunidad desea el crédito para poder invertir en el alimento de sus ganados, ella dice que debe comprar alimento balanceado, sutuchi de la cervecería y sales minerales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado y vitaminas para sus ganados.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” community bank which is located in the town of Zurite, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Marcelina is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  One of her children lives independently while the others are 20, 18 and 17 years old.  Marcelina's main business activity is farming and livestock raising.  She currently buys and sells cows and bulls.  She owns dairy cows, bulls and heifers.  She sells the milk from her cows in street markets and also to order.  In addition, she makes cheese.  On this occasion, she would like a loan to invest in feed for her animals.  She says that she needs to buy balanced feed, sutuchi from the brewery ('sutuchi' is the final residue from making corn-based drinks which is used as animal feed) and mineral salts.

Marcelina is requesting this loan to invest in buying balanced feed and vitamins for her animals.  She appreciates the loan she has been granted and is grateful for it.  She pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 32 years old and married with three children. Sge works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like milk, candies, groceries, etc. 

Edlyn has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening and retailing gasoline.

Edlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is from the village of Labi, Dikilaan, Iligan City. He is 49 years old. Jose is married with three school-aged children. Jose has a service-based business providing motor or habal-habal services to local community members. He also runs a retail store with his wife. Jose has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jose is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jose from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed to maintain vehicles.

location.town: Labi, Digkilaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 61 years old and a married mother of three adult children. She has been practicing mixed farming for over 30 years in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya. She employs one farmhand and sells her milk, beans, and maize to the local market. Farming has been her main source of income. Evelyn has made her second loan request through Juhudi Kilimo for 60,000 Kes in order to purchase a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help improve her family's living standards. Her primary challenges have been diseases and low market prices for her farm produce. She plans to acquire more dairy cows in future to improve her milk production and earn her more income. She is grateful to Juhudi for these rural-based projects.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tat

texts.en:
Tat is a 54-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband is retired and she has been selling chicken in a small market for 15 years. 

Her family depends on her business as their primary source of income. She would like to take a loan to buy more chickens to sell in the market so that she can earn more money to cover her family's living expenses.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell

loans.name: Judith Maria

texts.es: Judith de 44 años es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 16 a 25 años.  Ella vive en la ciudad e Barraquilla donde emprendió su negocio de peluquería y servicios de bellezas desde el año 2000, una vez se preparó en una academia para este propósito. 	Ella inicialmente prestaba el servicio de mejoramiento de la imagen de sus amigas a través del corte de cabello, manicure, pedicure  y peinados en su propia casa.  Con el tiempo las personas que una vez accedieron a sus servicios empezaron por volver a buscarla y posteriormente y hasta la presente le envían  muchos referidos y por eso ella permanece en actividad todo el tiempo.  Su trabajo es su máxima motivación porque a ella le encanta, especialmente la línea de maquillaje en la que se desempeña muy bien. Sus hijos, ahora profesionales,   trabajan y su esposo siempre están apoyándola en sus gastos, pues  mantienen una excelente unidad familiar.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará un espejo, una silla de peluquería y un lava cabezas, con ello sus clientes se sentirán más confortables y esto es lo que ella busca.  En su negocio maneja un margen de utilidad del 60%, que planea aumentar en la medida en que diversifique su oferta con nuevos servicios que en un futuro planea contratar.
texts.en: Judith, 44, is married and has three children between 16 and 25 years old.  She lives in Barranquilla, where she has had a hairdresser and beauty salon since 2000, when she graduated from a beauty academy.  She initially did haircuts, manicures, pedicures, and styling for her friends from home.  Over time, people began to seek her out, and, through word of mouth, she built up a full-time business. She loves her line of work, especially the make-up, which is her strong point.  Both her children, now working professionals, and her husband always help her with expenses, as they are a close family. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use it to buy a mirror, a barber's chair and a hair-washing basin.  This will make her clients more comfortable.  She has a profit margin of 60%, which she hopes to increase as she diversifies her offerings with new services in the future.

loans.use: to buy a mirror, a barber's chair and a hair washing basin.

loans.name: Sayagie

texts.en:
Sayagie, 36 years old, is married and has three children, all in school. He has been farming on his own piece of land for the last six years.

Sayagie learned about KADET from credit officers. This will be his first loan, which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Sayagie's dream is to do large scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Erlinda Elizabeth

texts.es: Erlinda, una joven de 26 años de edad, nació en la ciudad de León, esta casada, es madre de un niño de un año de edad, ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de calzado en el mercado de la ciudad de León ,lleva 7 años en este negocio. Ella inicio en este negocio a los 18 años con ayuda de sus padres desde entonces hasta hoy en día este ha sido su único negocio y medio de subsistencia, su esposo ayuda en el hogar con el salario que el gana. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar zapatos e invertir en su negocio, pues su anhelo mas grandes es poder expandirse y ofrecer variedad y estilos de zapatos, pues le seria de gran ayuda ya que podrá crecer su negocio , introducir productos nuevos en su tienda ,hacer nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ingresos. Su próxima meta es expandirse un poco mas ofreciendo mejores productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Erlinda, 26, was born in the city of León.  She is married and has a one-year-old son.  Her business is selling shoes in the market in the city of León, where she has been active for seven years.  She began her business when she was 18 with the help of her parents and since then this has been her only source of income.  Her husband uses his salary to help with household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy shoes and invest in her business because she wants to expand and offer a wider variety and different styles of shoes.  This would help her introduce new products at her store, attract more customers and increase her income.  Her goal for the future is to expand a little more and offer better quality products.

loans.use: To buy shoes and invest in her business.

loans.name: Benkadi A Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI A sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32   ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu de commune rurale, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FATOUMATA MADOU la personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en: The ten members of the Benkadi A group are married women, 32 years old on average, who have on average 5 children. Most live in polygamous families in the city of Banco, the administrative center of the rural village, in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in the goal to be able to better organize their businesses for the beginning of winter. They grow, among other things, rice and peanuts. They are on their first collaboration with the institution. With this loan, Fatoumata Madou, the middle person in the row of those standing, plans to buy the resources and small equipment and pay for labor costs to maintain about .5 hectares of rice. The harvest is sold at the Banco market at N’Golobougou to a clientele composed of men and women. They plan to earn on average about 25,000 CFA for each crop cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seed, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Nonvignon Gbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIGNON GBE est composé de vingt sept membres qui se connaissent parce qu’elles habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Célestine, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Célestine est mariée à un agent au Port nommé Gérôme et a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, seulement un est encore à la charge du couple. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Célestine et son mari habitent ensemble avec leur enfant. Célestine n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Célestine mène comme activité depuis trente ans environs, la vente de condiments et de vivres à son domicile. Célestine s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Célestine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON GBE. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group NONVIGNON GBE is composed of 27 members who know each other because they live in the same district in Benin. The president of this group, by the name of Célestine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. With the goal of boosting their businesses in order to cope better with customer demands, the group members are requesting financial support from ALIDé.  

Célestine is married to a Port agent named Gérôme and has five children, who are all in school. Only one of the children is still a dependent. The couple jointly ensures that the various family expenses are met. Célestine and her husband live together with their child. 

Célestine never went to school. To support herself and her family, she has been running a business for 30 years selling condiments and staple foods out of her home. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and further satisfying her customers, Célestine and the other members of the group NONVIGNON GBE are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy condiments and staple foods

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is  30 years old.  He is married and has 3 children, aged 7, 3 and 2.  He has been farming for five years, producing milk and vegetables which he sells to the local market.

Martin has made a loan request of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says this second loan from Juhudi will improve his family's living standards and help him educate his children.  For additional income, Martin also runs a motorcycle business where he is just an employee but hopes to buy his own from the farming proceeds.

Martin says dairy feeds are usually expensive during the dry seasons and remains a persistent challenge in the dairy business.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 47 años es una valiente mujer, pues se separó de su esposo hace un año, ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo cuida a 2 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Bellavista. Fue difícil superar los 20 años de compromiso con su esposo, pero eso no la desanima; al contrario le brinda fuerzas para salir adelante. “Me gusta trabajar en el campo, disfruto de ello”, menciona con alegría. Pues hace 15 años comenzó a sembrar arveja, maíz y habas. En los primeros años alquilaba los terrenos productivos donde sembraba, pero con su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo comprar unos propios. Además recibe el apoyo de su hijo, quien trabaja en el arado de la tierra con los dos toros que posee, ahí le pagan S/. 70 soles diarios, por lo que tiene una ganancia extra. Ahora se concentra en su cosecha de habas, como también en mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Teodosia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el mejoramiento del piso de su casa, asimismo en el techado y cercado de su patio.
texts.en:
47-year-old Teodosia is a courageous woman who separated from her husband a year ago.  The couple have four children and she cares for two of them in her own home which is located in the town of Bellavista.  It was difficult to get over the 20 years of commitment she had with her husband but she is not discouraged.  On the contrary, it gives her the strength to get ahead in life.  "I like working in the fields, I enjoy it", she says cheerfully.  

Teodosia started growing peas, corn and beans 15 years ago.  During the first years, she rented the land where she sowed her crops but, through her work and effort, she was able to buy some land of her own.  She also has the support of her son who works plowing land with two bulls that he owns.  He is paid 70 soles a day and this gives them a little extra income.  Teodosia is currently concentrating on harvesting her beans and improving her quality of life.

This is Teodosia's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support so that she can continue achieving her goals.  She pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  With your support, Teodosia will invest the money she has requested in improving the flooring in her home.  She will also improve her roof and enclose her yard.

loans.use: to buy materials to lay some flooring, improve her roof and enclose her yard

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
This is Eleuteria, 52, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Gabriel, an electronics technician. She is also mother to their three children. Two of her children are already working, while the youngest is still in high school. Eleuteria and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eleuteria operates a business renting gowns and shoes. She buys second-hand gowns and shoes, and then offers them to others who would like to rent them on a daily basis. These gowns are used for special occasions and other formal gatherings. She also sells accessories for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and others in the local community. She earns a minimum of 320 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional gowns and shoes to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Eleuteria hopes her business grows more in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional gowns and shoes

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es:
Hermenegildo, vive con su esposa y seis hijos, él se dedica desde hace muchos años a la siembra de granos básicos: maíz y frijoles, realiza las actividades todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes como herbicidas, semilla y abono, para que sus cosechas sean abundantes y estén libres de plagas dandole mejores cosechas para obtener mejores  ingresos para la familia.
El sueño de Hermenegildo es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que en un futuro sean profesionales  y de esa forma ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo lives with his wife and six children. He has been growing basic staples, such as corn and beans, for many years. Hermenegildo engages in his farming activities every day, Monday through Sunday.

He needs a loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, seeds, and compost so that his harvest will be abundant and free from pests. By improving his harvest, he will generate more income for his family.

Hermenegildo dreams of seeing his children continue their studies so that they can become professionals in the future and help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, seeds, and compost.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 31 years old and married to a primary school teacher.  He has two children who are in school.  To earn a living, he supplies bread and cakes in crates.  He also sells sugarcane to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money and access business loans. 

Alexander hopes to expand his business in five years.  He needs 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of bread and cakes.

loans.use: To add to his stock of bread and cakes.

loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en:
Gulzat is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married to a constructor. With her husband, she brings up a daughter and a son, and both children study at school. 

Gulzat works as a teacher in the local school. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 3000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS), she purchased two farm animals and since that time she has been engaged in livestock breeding. By reselling livestock after fattening, she earns an additional 1500 soms to meet the family's needs. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening, and further reselling.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando de 28 años de edad casado con Reyna de 35 años de edad, aun no tienen hijos. Juntos habitan en el centro poblado de canayre donde tienen su casa alquilada. Rolando cuenta que, cuando era niño siempre tuvo los deseos de superación en cuestiones económicas, es por eso que viene trabajando como vendedor ambulante desde los 17 años de edad. Al termino de su etapa escolar, trabajó en una obra de alcantarillado donde hizo su capital, con ello compró su mercadería y se puso en marcha recorriendo las ferias donde son sus puntos de venta. De esta manera Rolando expende sus productos de la que está orgulloso por las buenas ganancias que le genera. En un futuro cercano desea establecerse en el centro poblado, donde pueda tener su casa propia para poder abrir su tienda y ya no estar viajando de feria en feria ya que tiene muchas desventajas y a veces que los productos se deterioran por el largo viaje que rolando realiza. Este será su primer crédito por el que él está comprometido en efectivizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará más productos variados entre ellos artículos para la casa, para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Rolando, 28, is married to Reyna, 35; they do not yet have children. They live together in the small town of Canayre, where they have a rented house.

Rolando says that when he was a child he always wanted to excel economically, and this is why he has been working as a traveling salesman since he was 17 years old. When he finished school, he worked at a sewage project, which is where he made the capital that he used to buy merchandise and begin traveling among the markets, which are his points of sale. This is how Rolando sells his products, and he is proud of his good earnings. In the near future he wants to establish himself in the town, where he can have his own house and open a store in it. Then he would not be traveling from market to market since that has many disadvantages, and sometimes the products deteriorate because of the long trip Rolando makes.

This will be his first loan, so he is committed to making his payments on time. With the 1,500 new soles, Rolando will buy more varied products, including items for the home, so he can stock his business.

loans.use: to buy household products.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es:
Demetria es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” del centro poblado Poccona, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, está casada y  tiene 5  hijos independientes.  Cuenta con estudios D. educación primaria (incompleta).

Trabaja desD. hace nueve años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. compra y venta D. productos D. la región.

Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, comprará 30 arrobas D. habas para tostar y venderlo molido en la localidad D. Yunguyo en las ferias, su esposo le ayuda en le negocio, también es agricultor.

Su sueño para el futuro es seguir con el negocio y cada vez mejorar sus ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Demetria is a member of the “Candelaria” communal bank in the Poccona settlement, Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 60 years old, married and has five children who are now independent.  She attended elementary school but did not complete it.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for nine years.  She used her first, 300 new sol, loan to invest in her business buying and selling regional products.  She will use this new, 500 new sol, loan to buy 30 arrobas of lima beans to roast and sell ground in the Yunguyo markets; her husband who is also a farmer helps her with the business.  

Her dream for the future is to stay in business improving her profits every time.  What she most likes about her communal bank is the ease of the loan and the savings.

loans.use: to buy thirty arrobas of lima beans.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from pig fattening. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.  Estelita hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Martha Mercedes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 38  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 14, 11, 8 y 7 años de edad, la mayor estudia en colegio y las tres menores en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella hace dos años y con la ayuda del primer crédito que recibió del banco empezó con un negocio, adecuo un local en su casa para surtir una pequeña  tienda de comestibles,  que con el paso del tiempo y con la ayuda de los créditos la ha ido mejorando,  trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Ella ha puesto muchas ganas y amor a su tienda y ahora está recogiendo los frutos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos tiene su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener la mejor tienda de la localidad.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Mar Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by national and foreign tourists.  Most of the residents here fish or otherwise work on the water for a living.

This is where we met Martha.  She is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are 14, 11, 8, and 7 years old.  The eldest is in high school and the three youngest are in primary school.  Her husband fishes for a living.

She started a business two years ago with the help of the first loan she received from her bank.  She converted part of her home to set up a small food market that with time and the help of loans she has been improving.  She works every day with the help of her children and her husband from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. and sometimes later.  She has put a lot of effort and love into her store and now she is reaping the rewards.

She is going to use this loan to supply her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, and detergents, among other essentials.  She has been with her communal bank for two years and she likes it because it is thanks to loans that she has her business.

Her dream is to have the best store in the area.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other essentials

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 29 years old. She is married to a businessman. They have three children between the ages of 1 and 11 years. Only one child goes to school. She has been selling salt and charcoal for 2 years. She has requested the loan to buy more salt and charcoal for selling. In the future, she would like to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more salt and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio de 62 años es un hombre viudo. Tiene 3 hijos: Yolina de 19, Lit de 17 y Sumit de 5 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini, provincia de Chanchamayo. Eugenio es un padre  ejemplar. Su esposa falleció cuando Sumit tenía 8 meses de nacida. Desde entonces se convirtió en padre y madre para sus 3 hijas. Se las ingenió para cuidar se ellas y no descuidar sus actividades.
Él es un agricultor, especialista en el cultivo de plátanos. En sus 3 parcelas cultiva las variedades: seda, isla, largo y bizcochito. Las que comercializa en la ciudad de Yurinaki, para ello tiene que trasladar sus productos con una movilidad motorizada. Así también siembra café en media parcela, pero estos granos son vendidos en su misma comunidad, donde compradores de distintas empresas pagan un precio justo por la producción.
“Mi café es solicitado por que no utilizo abonos de ninguna clase”, menciona orgulloso. Eugenio piensa sembrar más café y plátanos en una parcela que aún no produce. Este plan requiere de trabajo arduo. Sería la primera vez que Eugenio accedería a un préstamo de MFP. Se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contento de pertenecer al banco comunal “Los Caciques de Menkoremón”. De obtener el dinero, podrá comprar mamones de plátanos para iniciar una plantación. Además adquirirá plantas de café.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 62, is a widower. He has 3 children: Yolina, 19; Lit, 17; and Sumit, 5. They all live in a house he owns in his hometown of Pucharini in Chanchamayo province. Eugenio is an outstanding father. His wife died when Sumit was only eight months old. Since that time, he has been both father and mother to his 3 daughters. He has managed to care for them and not neglect his activities.

He is a farmer who specializes in the cultivation of plantains. In his 3 plots of land, he cultivates four varieties of plantains which he sells in the city of Yurinaki. In order to sell them, he has to transport his products by vehicle. He also plants half a plot of coffee, but these beans are sold in his own community where buyers from different companies pay a fair price for their production.

“My coffee is requested because I don’t use any type of fertilizers,” he mentions proudly. Eugenio is thinking of growing more coffee and plantains in a plot that doesn’t produce any more. This plan requires hard work. This will be the first time that Eugenio has obtained a loan from MFP. He takes responsibility for being punctual in his repayments. He feels pleased to belong to the “Los Caciques de Menkoremón” communal bank. When he obtains the money, he will be able to purchase plantain offshoots in order to start a plantation. Also, he will obtain coffee plans.

loans.use: to purchase plantain offshoots and coffee plants.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Elizabeth did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. For the past three years, Elizabeth has been selling plastic containers in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast). As a divorcee with seven children, Elizabeth uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Elizabeth will use this loan to purchase an increased amount of plastic ware, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Elizabeth wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of plastic ware to improve overall sales.

loans.name: Hou's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Hou is aged 50 years and married with seven children. She and her husband earn a living through planting rice and cassava. Having been in this business for several years, she manages to earn about 20,000KHR per day and can save about 4,000KHR each day for the future needs. 
Hou has been with VisionFund for eight cycles and now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Oluwadara Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLUWADARA est composé de trois personnes qui sont de la même famille. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Félicienne (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 43 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Félicienne est mariée a un certain Mathieu. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous a leur charge. Félicienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Félicienne vend divers produits (des savons, du riz, de l'huile végétale) depuis trente ans à son domicile. Félicienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Félicienne ensemble avec les membres du groupe OLUWADARA  sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 59 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 children. 

Her business is selling clothes. She has been in the business for 5 years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of clothes for sale. She will use the profits from expanded business to better her living standards. 

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business from retail to a wholesale.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort would like to expand her animal rearing business. She has 25 grass cutters, a local animal which is used as delicacy and rich in protein source. Comfort has been trained in animal rearing based on KRABAN TEACH program. She wants a KIVA loan amount of $1000 to build a new animal coop and to increase the animal she keeps.

loans.use: Animal Coop

loans.name: Djeyran

texts.en:
Djeyran was born in 1967 in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is married and has one child.

Djeyran breeds cows, calves, and sheep. She has been in this business for 5 years. With this business she meets the basic needs of her family. Now she needs a loan of $500 to buy 10 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Mrs. Dy S. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children who are students in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a small farm growing rice crops and raising ducks. They have to get up in the early morning to collect duck eggs and then sell them to the wholesaler at a market. With this business activity, she can generate an average of around $10/day. Dy S. is requesting a loan of $800 to increase her livestock and to purchase some tractor spare parts, so that her husband can fix it and use it for her farm cultivation. In the future, S. is thinking about being able to expand her animal raising business as well as make her farm wider, which she think she can make additional money for her household.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and  tractor spare parts to run a farm

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
Maria Graciela sells refreshments from a small store she runs from her home in order to contribute to the family income. She is 21 years old and single. She belongs to the group "Jastic 2", together with Mrs. Mariana Hernández Pérez (sale of fruits and vegetables), and Mrs. Lili Cruz Narváez (sale of clothing). With the loan, Maria Graciela plans to expand her store, Mariana will buy a cart to go out and sell her products to nearby neighborhoods, and Lili will buy a large assortment of clothing.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

MARIA GRACIELA se dedica a la venta de refrescos en un pequeño depósito que tiene en su casa y de esta forma contribuye al gasto familiar, es soltera y tiene 21 años. Pertenece la grupo Jastic 2 junto con doña Mariana Hernández Pérez (venta de frutas y verduras) y doña Lili Cruz Narváez (venta de ropa). Con el préstamo Maria Graciela agrandara su local, Mariana comprara un carrito para salir a vender sus productos a las colonias cercanas, y Lili comprara un gran surtido de ropa.

loans.use: Sale of refreshments

loans.name: Ni Nengah Wedi

texts.id:
53 year old Ni Nengah Wedi is wife of Nengah Budiarta. She is still motivated to expand the pig farm that she started 6 months ago. Starting with a simple pen and 2 pigs, Ni Nengah Wedi had gone through 2 slaughter cycles. She farms local pig with "Babi Guling System" (slaughter in 3 months cycle). She earns about $15 per month in profit. With Dinari Loan of $150, Ni Nengah Wedi wants to buy 1 more piglets and 1 more breeding pig so she will have 4 pigs. Rest of the money will be used to buy feed concentrate, rice seeds, and wheat seeds for feeds. In her daily lifeNi Nengah Wedi only lives with her husband as her children are married already. Ni Nengah Wedi is grateful that by farming pigs, she can increase her family income by $2 per day. She expects to increase her retirement savings using the extra profit.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi

Dalam Usia 53 tahun Ni Nengah Wedi istri dari Nengah Budiarta masih semangat dalam mengembangkan usaha ternak babi yang mulai dirintisnya sejak 6 bulan yang lalu. Dengan bermodalkan sebuah kandang sederhana dan dengan 2 ekor ternak peliharaan, Ni Nengah Wedi telah dapat melakukan panen 2 kali, karena ternak yang di pelihara jenis lokal ( Babi Bali ) dan Sistem Babi Guling ( panen tiap 3 bulan ). Keuntungan yang di dapat pun cukup lumayan yaitu Rp. 150.000 / bulan . Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 1.500.000.-, kini Ni Nengah Wedi telah menambah 1 ekor bibit penggemukan dan 1 ekor induk sehinga peliharaanya sekarang menjadi 4 ekor. Sedangkan sisa uangnya di pergunakan untuk membeli pakan berupa Kosentrat , Dedak Padi dan Dedak Gandum. Dalam Keseharianya Ni Nengah Wedi, hanya tinggal berdua saja dengan suaminya karena anak –anaknya telah menikah dan tinggal dengan keluarganya masing – masing. Ni Nengah Wedi merasa bersyukur karena dengan beternak babi ia dapat menambah pendapatan keluarganya. Selain untuk biaya hidup sehari - hari yang mencapai Rp 20.000.- , Ni Nengah Wedi sudah bisa menyisihkan sedikit demi sedikit keuntungan yang di dapat untuk jaminan hari tuanya nanti.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Mrs. Sarah A. is 38 years old, married with 3 children and lives in Papa Ajao in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She sews clothes and also sells cloth.  She has been with LAPO for the past 3 years and in business since 1992.  She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy a sewing machine.  She will also be able to buy clothes to sell with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and clothes to sell

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Blanca Rosa belongs to the communal bank, La Amistad (friendship). She lives in the Jr. Damian Najar C-1 of the Moyabamba district and province, San Martin department. She rents a stand in the central market of Moyabamba in which she sells food, especially beef leg soup and some regional dishes. Thanks to her hard work and to the careful attention she gives to her customers, her sales have increased, which motivates her to strive to improve every day. She decided to start her business because she likes cooking, it is something she enjoys doing. In addition, she also likes having her own income to increase her self-esteem, grow as a person and as a woman, and help out with the expenses necessary to support her children who are still studying.

With this loan for S/. 1,000.00 (US$350 approx.) that will be paid in 4 months, Mrs. Blanca will buy sacks of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, dried legumes, and other ingredients she needs daily in her business, in addition to buying plates, glasses, and flatware to give a better service to her customers who visit her every day.

Mrs. Blanca is 37 years old, lives with her husband and four children, all boys, and is happy in spite of the effort necessary to attend to both her household and business activities. She relies on the support of her husband and children who help with the housework, and she does housework in the afternoons. Her goal is to have her own locale for the business because this will give her more stability.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Blanca Rosa pertenece del Banco comunal La Amistad, vive en el Jr. Damián Najar C-1 del distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín, ella tiene alquilado un puesto en el mercado central de Moyabamba en donde vende comida, especialmente sopa de pata de res y algunas comidas de la región. Gracias a su empeño y buena atención que les brinda a sus clientes sus ventas aumentaron, lo que le motiva a seguir mejorando cada día. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque le gusta cocinar, es algo que disfruta hacer, además le gusta generar sus propios ingresos para alimentar su autoestima, crecer como persona y mujer y apoyar en los gastos que requiere para sacar adelante a sus hijos que aun están estudiando.

Con este préstamo S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en galones, menestras de diferentes variedades y los demás ingredientes que necesita a diario en su negocio, además comprará mas platos, vasos y cubiertos para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes que le visitan a diario.

La señora Blanca tiene 37 años, vive con sus esposo y sus 4 hijos, todos varones, está contenta a pesar del esfuerzo que tiene que hacer para poder atender las actividades de la casa y del negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos quienes le apoyan en las actividades de la casa, ella aprovecha la tarde para realizar las actividades domesticas. Su meta es contar con un puesto propio para su negocio, esto le dará más seguridad.

loans.use: Buying ingredients and tableware (Compra de insumos y vajilla.)

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Ms. Norma belongs to the communal bank “Virgen de la Natividad”, located in Peru Nº 597, district of Callería, department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and she is a mother of 2 children, the youngest still depends on her. Her husband is a civil servant. With the first loan of $100 that she obtained from “Manuela Ramos Microfinancing”, she decided to invest in a small beauty salon at home. Every day, she gets up at 6:00 a.m. to go to the market and to prepare breakfast for her children and husband, then she prepares lunch and later she works at her beauty salon with a lot of dedication. She will buy 2 big bottles of liquids for perms, different hair coloring, lacquers, caps to make highlights, etc with the loan of $850 that will repay in 5 months. Norma is very happy since her business is doing well thanks to god and to the support of Manuela Ramos Microfinancing.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma pertenece al banco comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en Jr. Perú Nº 597, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años y es madre de 2 hijos, uno mayor de edad y un menor que aún depende de ella. Su esposo es empleado público. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en un pequeño salón de belleza en su domicilio. Se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. para ir al mercado y preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y su esposo, luego prepara el almuerzo y después atiende su estética con esmero y dedicación. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 2 botellas grandes de líquidos para peinados permanentes, tintes de diversos colores, lacas, gorros para realizar rayitos, bolondon, etc. Norma está muy feliz pues manifiesta que su negocio le va muy bien gracias a dios y al apoyo que Manuela Ramos le brinda. Su negocio tiene cada vez mas acogida entre sus clientes por el servicio que brinda.

loans.use: Buy supplies for a beauty salon

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng N., who is 36, works with her husband as farmers growing rice, beans, and lettuce on her piece of farmland and collectively make about $10 per day from selling their outputs to a market. Sreng N. has four children who are enrolled in school and she has requested for a loan to purchase farming tools and a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase farming tools and a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation.

loans.name: Marcial Salvador

texts.es:
Marcial P. is 56 year-old retailer. He is married and has five children, all of whom are of legal age and independent. This is a family full of retailers; the children learned the tricks of the trade from their parents and with their support, were able to start their own businesses. Mr. Marcial sells shoes, and his wife sells milk based products, such as cream and cheese. Their children have their own small businesses at the Oriental Market, which is the biggest in the country. This marriage has been dedicated to sells for over 30 years. Mr. Marcial is requesting a loan in order to purchase shoes and increase his inventory, since his dreams are to complete good sales during this month and he currently has low inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer.

Marcial P., es un comerciante de 56 años de edad, casado y con 5 hijos todos ya mayores de edad e independientes. Esta es una familia de comerciantes ya que los hijos aprendieron de sus padres la chispa del negocio y con apoyo de ellos montaron su propio negocio. Don Marcial vende zapatos, su esposa vende productos lácteos como crema y queso y sus hijos tienen sus propios pequeños negocios en el Mercado Oriental que es el mas grande del país. Desde hace más de 30 años este matrimonio se dedican al comercio, solicita Don Marcial un crédito para comprar zapatos y ampliar su inventario ya que tiene muchas expectativas de realizar buenas ventas en este mes y no cuenta con mucho inventario.

loans.use: Purchase shoes for his business

loans.name: Layal

texts.en: Layal is a 21 year old woman. She has 1 child. She works and lives in Aley. This is the first time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to buy new merchandise and jewelry to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise and jewelry

loans.name: Petrolina

texts.es:
Pertronila belongs to the Nativity Virgin Communal Bank, located on Jr. Raymondi 1095 Street, in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and has four children. Her husband is a merchant, but his income, which they depend on, is not enough to sustain the family. For this reason Petronila decided to invest in rooms to rent out with her first loan of 300 soles ($100) from Manuela Ramos.

She is currently building more rooms and is also remodeling. Every day she supervises construction because she wants the rooms to be well-built and ready to rent. With this loan of 700 soles ($275), which she will repay over 4 months, she will purchase wood, cement, tools, door knockers, corrugated iron, and nails.

Petronila attends communal bank meetings regularly, and she enjoys the talks that the promoters give because they motivate her to keep growing her business and she can share the happy moments in the different activities in which her communal bank is involved.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Petronila pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Raymondi 1095, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Petronila con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la construcción de cuartos para alquiler.

En la actualidad esta construyendo mas cuartos, y también esta remodelando. Todos los días supervisa la construcción por que quiere que sus cuartos queden bien terminados y listos para ser alquilados. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: maderas, cemento, fierros, aldabas, calaminas, clavos.

Petronila asiste muy puntual a sus reuniones, le gustan mucho las charlas que siempre dan las promotoras por que la motivan mas a seguir creciendo con su negocio, y comparte momentos alegres en las diferentes actividades que hacen con su banco comunal.

loans.use: Purchase materials to construct rooms to rent

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo is a man who grows potatoes and peas. He leaves his home each morning with the desire to observe the growth of his vegetables and to give them the necessary care so that they can thrive. Through his occupation, he supports his beloved family and his desire to work for the fulfillment of improving the quality and quantity of his production, in order to obtain better earnings and make the dreams of his children a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

REYNALDO, es un hombre dedicado a la producción de papa y arveja, cada mañana abandona su hogar con el deseo de observar el crecimiento de sus vegetales y de otorgarles el cuidado necesario para que puedan crecer muy bien, con su ocupación sostiene a su amada familia y su deseo de colaborar con el cumplimiento de lo que anhelan desea mejorar la calidad y cantidad de su producción para obtener mejores ganancias y hacer el sueño de sus hijos realidad.

loans.use: Capital to improve the quality and quantity of his vegetables

loans.name: La Beneficencia Group

texts.en: Rosa L. Alisander has received two loans from her Esperanza International Bank of Hope, La Beneficencia. With them she has started a market, Colmado Alisander, which is frequented by many members of the community. The store is connected to her house and is the site of La Beneficencia's collection meetings. Rosa and her husband Dalaceo have 6 children, who take up all of Rosa's time outside of the store. Her dreams for the future include an education for her children and a larger store that sells a larger variety of things.

loans.use: Colmado

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is thirty-year-old Salima from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children under the age of fifteen. She is also financially responsible for another child who is a relative. Salima owns and runs a stall from which she sells essential grocery items. The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge.

A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Additionally, Salima has capitalized on Dar es Salaam’s proximity to the Indian Ocean and the fondness of its residents for fish to sell roasted fish at her genge. This helps her earn some extra income. She currently makes US$ 90 per month from sales at her genge.

Salima is requesting a loan of US$ 225 to purchase additional fish, cooking oil, and cooking fuel for her stall. She is hopeful that selling more fish will help her earn higher profits.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client.

The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies in bulk for her grocery store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth G. operates a grocery store in her neighborhood. She started her operation twenty years ago at Obuasi where she lives with her ten children. She is a 41-year-old mother with six of the kids currently in school. She sells products like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk and also sells popcorn, etc.

With the loan, she wants to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice and popcorn maize, canned foods and drinks, and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With an increased stock of different varieties, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She would appreciate very much your assistance. She is a member of the group called "Debora Mma" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, maize, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a binding machine, laminating machine, and stock

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa was born in 1965. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town and she has settled in the Fizuli region, in a Bahmanli village.

Latifa is a mother of three children. She has been in cattle breeding business for six years. Now she needs a loan of 800 AZN (US$1,000) for buying two calves for improving her business.

loans.use: She would like to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Trijidia

texts.es:
Trijidia es comerciante se dedica a la venta D. leche y chocolate, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar y su esposo tiene un taller artesanal.
Vive en la zona D. Alto Obrajes sector sur D. la Ciudad D. la paz.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, las ganas D. superarse e incrementar sus ingresos D. dan la oportunidad D. acceder a este crédito.
El crédito será destinado para la compra D. mercadería (leche, y chocolates)
texts.en:
Trijidia is a businesswoman selling milk and chocolate. She has three school-age children, and her husband has a handicrafts workshop. She lives in the Alto Obrajes district of the city of La Paz. This is the first time she has requested credit, her desire to improve herself and increase her income give her the opportunity to access this loan. The funds are destined to purchase merchandise (milk and chocolates).

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zarela

texts.es: Zarela tiene 34 años, vive con su hijo Mauricio de 3 años de edad. Es una emprendedora madre que se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de ropa en la ciudad de Puno con la esperanza de progresar y forjar un futuro mejor para su pequeño en el cual tiene puestas todas sus esperanzas. Zarela siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora gustándole su trabajo, ya que con él puede ofrecerle bienestar y comodidad a su hijo, es por eso que se dedica tanto a su trabajo, el cual, gracias a su esfuerzo, arroja buenas ganancias. Lo difícil es pasar tanto tiempo vendiendo y no poder pasar todo el tiempo que ella quisiera con su pequeño hijo. Zarela se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para comercializar en estas épocas de fiesta donde la venta es muy buena.
texts.en:
Zarela is 34 years old. She lives with her three-year-old son Mauricio. She is an enterprising mother who has sold clothing for 10 years in the city of Puno. She hopes to progress and forge a better future for her little one, in whom she has put all her hope. Zarela has always been a hardworking woman, enjoying her work. Through her work she is able to offer her son well-being and comfort, and it is because of this she works so hard. Thanks to her effort, she has made good profits. The difficult thing is that she spends so much time selling, she is unable to spend as much time as she would like with her little boy. Zarela is asking for her second loan from Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With the requested money, she will buy more merchandise to sell during the holidays, when sales are very good.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Aubrey

texts.en:
Aubrey V., a hardworking, single, 31-year-old mother of one child, resides in Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental with her mother. In 2004, with initial capital of PHP 50, Aubrey started a business of selling ice to schools and to her neighbors. However, Aubrey was hoping to operate a business that would generate more profits than her current business and that would not cause her to leave her only child at home.

As a result, on December 18, 2008, with some help from her mother, Aubrey opened up a sari-sari store despite the fact that her start-up capital was insufficient to purchase all of the goods needed for her store. Accordingly, Aubrey is seeking a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy all of the goods needed for her store and to be able to properly market her products. In addition, the loan proceeds will be used to sustain and/or expand her ice-making business. Aubrey firmly believes that, by operating businesses such as these, she will be able to raise her child well and to ensure that the child receives a good education.

loans.use: To develop her new business (a sari-sari store) by purchasing materials and marketing her products while sustaining her original business

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat is single. She lives with her parents. Malohat launched her enterprise a year ago with the assistance of her parents.
