She sews clothing herself and sells them to her customers in ADAWLATO. She purchases her supplies in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She works with two employees. Akossiwoa has requested her first loan cycle at WAGES in order to buy pagne cloth.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth

loans.name: María Marleny

texts.es: María Marleny de veinticuatro años de edad habita en casa familiar con su madre y dos pequeñas hijas de 8 y 2 años de edad.  María es una mujer emprendedora  con muchas metas e ideas de negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña  tienda que  ha logrado establecer en su hogar de residencia. Su principal inspiración es su familia ya que su sueño es poder dar a sus hijas el estudio para que un día puedan convertirse en  grandes profesionales y tengan la oportunidad de una mejor calidad de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio y comprar mercadería al por mayor para surtir su tienda de tal manera que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan. Con el crédito tiene pensado comprar artículos como: azúcar, frijoles, arroz, detergente, aceite, golosinas, huevos, y de mas artículos que permitan atraer a mas clientes. Es una mujer con mucha fe y sabe que de esta manera logrará subir su nivel de ventas así como su nivel de ingresos que le permitan accesar a una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 24 years old and lives in her family home with her mother and 2 daughters, aged 8 and 2. She is an enterprising woman with many goals and business ideas. Maria sells products of primary necessity in a little store which she managed to establish in her place of residence.

Maria's principal inspiration is her family. Her dream is to be able to provide her daughters with schooling so that one day they can become great professionals and have the opportunity for a better quality of life.

Maria has decided to solicit a loan through INTEGRAL to invest in her business, buying merchandise at wholesale to restock her store, so that customers will always encounter what they are looking for.

With this loan, Maria intends to buy articles such as sugar, beans, rice, detergent, cooking oil, cookies, eggs, and other articles that will permit her to attract more customers. Maria is a woman with much faith and she knows that in this way, she will manage to increase sales and income, allowing her to achieve a higher quality of life.

loans.use: buy articles such as sugar, beans, rice, detergent, cooking oil, cookies, eggs, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Sughran Mai

texts.en:
Sughran Mai is 44 years old, married and has three sons. Her youngest son is studying in 9th class while the other two sons work to contribute to the family financially. 
Sughran Mai's husband has a livestock business. He has some buffaloes from which he gets milk and sells it to customers in the community for a profit. His rates are very fair and he also believes in selling good quality milk. This is why he has a good number of customers. 
Sughran Mai is a housewife and performs her household duties, but in her spare time she also helps her husband in his business. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s business. He will buy another buffalo with the loan amount. This will help him to increase his business' milk productivity and help him serve more customers and increase profits. He has been operating his business for the past ten years and Sughran Mai is hopeful that, after the loan investment, his business will expand further.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her husband's milk sales business.

loans.name: Un Futuro Brillante Group

texts.es:
La señora Salome tiene la edad de 62 años, estudio la primaria,esta casada con el señor Demetrio que trabaja en el campo, tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya estan casados, ella y su familia viven en region cañera.

Doña Salome nos platica que desde hace  10 años decidio iniciar con propio negocio de venta de zapatos porque  queria sacar adelante a sus hijos y  ayudar a se esposo con los gastos del hogar, ahora que sus hijos son mayores trabaja para tener una mejor vida ella junto a su esposo.

Ella realiza sus venta de zapatos saliendo a caminar casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos pero tambien sale a otras comunidades cercanas a su comunidad, les muestra sus catalogos, levanta pedidos, cuando tiene varios pedidos sale  a compralos, posteriormente los entrega y recibe el pago por sus productos. 

Doña Salome necesita este credito para la compra de catalogos y zapatos para su posterior venta.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio pospere, tambien nos comenta que se encuentra muy contenta por la confianza que fundacion le a otorgado.

Doña Salome pertenece a un grupo conformado por seis personas llamado un futuro brillante, ellos llamaron asi a este grupo porque tienen puestas en sus negocios la espera de prosperar y poder dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias, las demas integrantes son:

Edith y luisa  que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, Abigail Y Maria Adriana a la venta de Zapateria y Angela a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Señora Salome is 62 years old, and studied up to primary-school level.  She is married to Señor Demetrio, who works in the fields.  She has seven children who are all married.  She and her family live in a sugar-cane growing region.

Doña Salome shares with us that 10 years ago, she decided to start her own business selling shoes, because she wanted to move her children ahead in life and support her husband with the household expenses.  Now that her children are grown, she works to provide a better quality of life for herself and her husband.

She sells her shoes door-to-door to her friends and neighbors, but she also goes to other nearby communities where she shows her catalogs and takes orders.  When she has several orders, she goes to buy the items,  She later delivers them and receives payment for her products.

Doña Salome needs this loan to pay for catalogs and shoes for later sale.

She hopes that her business will prosper with this investment.  She also tells us that she is very happy about the trust that the foundation is putting in her.

Doña Salome belongs to a group made of 6 women; it is called "Un Futuro Brillante" ("A Brilliant Future").  They chose this name for the group because they hope for their businesses to prosper, and to be able to provide a better quality of life for their families.

The other members are Edith and Luisa, who sell Mexican snacks; Abigail and Maria Adriana, who sell shoes; and Angela who sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy catalogs and shoes for later sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. Cecilia has a business of selling clothes in Hai gwafa branch in Yei South Sudan She has been in this business for four years.

Cecilia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that with the extra income from this loan she will use it for building a house for her children in future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Boud Nonguelone Group

texts.fr:
Mme Aminata est la représentante du groupe Boud Nonguelone. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 1ans. Quatre(04) de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 07 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de la farine et des gâteaux depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 23 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, homme et les enfants.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de maïs pour la transformation en farine, 01 sac de farine de blé et un bidon d’huile pour la fabrication du gâteau.

Mme économise pour agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation dans leur cours et payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aminata is the representative of the "Boud Nonguelone" group. She is married and the mother of 7 children. The oldest is 28 years old and the youngest is 1 year old. Four of her children go to school. She has seven people dependent on her.

She has been selling flour and cakes for 10 years. She stocks up at the sector 23 market in town. Her customers are women, men and children.

She would like to purchase 2 sacks of corn to make flour, 1 sack of wheat flour and a can of oil to make cakes.

She is saving up to expand her business. Her goal is to build a dwelling place in their yard and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of corn to make flour, 1 sack of wheat flour and a can of oil to make cakes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy blankets, shoes, and refrigerators from South Africa for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single lady who lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Asha has operated a clothes-selling business for the past four years; in addition she also runs a beauty salon. Her potential clients are the local-area women. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase more stocks of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its quality services and good customer care.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nazareno Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Nazareno lo conforman Yudith, Jesenia y María Auxiliadora; tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Yudith de 21 años quien es comerciante de ropa. Este negocio lo aprendió con su mamá  quien se dedicaba a la venta de ropa y luego ella se independizó.
Ella está casada y espera a su primer hijo el cual nacerá el próximo mes. 

Las otras integrantes son Jesenia de 24 años quien vende ropa y productos de belleza, y María Auxiliadora de 62 años quien de lunes a viernes vende gaseosas y golosinas y los fines de semana vende ropa en los balnearios cercanos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Nazareno" is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women: Yudith, Jesenia and María Auxiliadora.  Yudith, 21, is the coordinator of the group, and she has a business selling clothing.  She learned this trade from her mother, who also used to sell clothing.  Later Yudith started to work independently.

Yudith is married and is expecting her first child next month.

The other members of the group are Jesenia, 24, who sells clothing and beauty products, and Maria Auxiliadora, 62, who sells soft drinks and candy during the weekdays and sells clothing on the weekends at nearby resorts.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Basilio Eleodoro

texts.es:
Basilio, es un hombre casado de 69 años de edad,  el se dedica a brindar servicios de mecánica automotriz, eligio este tipo de trabajo por vocación ya que desde muy joven aprendió el arte de planchar el metal de los carros y pintarlos.
Basilio es un hombre luchador, trabajador y muy responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante, Basilio brinda este servicios desde el año  1996 , gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/ 390 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Basilio invertirá este crédito para la compra de materia prima (carburos, planchas, pinturas, etc) . El  sueño del señor Basilio es tener un taller mas sofisticado y con una buena tecnología para que de este modo pueda atender mejor a sus clientes, y dar un servicio de primera, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente y que pagara sus cuotas puntualmente .
Basilio vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
texts.en:
Basilio is a married man of 69 years of age. He is a car mechanic and he chose this kind of work as when very young he learned how to panel beat cars and repaint them and developed a vocation for the work. 

Basilio is a determined, hardworking and very responsible man with a great desire to get ahead. Basilio has been doing this work since 1996. He earns about S/. 390 nuevos soles (PEN) as week. With the loan of S/. 2000 soles (PEN) which he will receive thanks to Kiva, Basilio will invest this loan in buying raw materials (carbudes, plates, paint, etc). Señor Basilio's dream is to have a more sofisticated workshop with good technology so that he can better attend his customers and give a first class service. His counselor thinks he is an excellent member and will make his repayments punctually.

Basilio lives and works in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the member's home and business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (carbides, plates, etc.)

loans.name: Sop Serigne Talla Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe est créé en Avril 2010.il composé de 12 femmes habitant pour la plupart le village. elles font le commerce et l'embouche ovine comme activité.

la responsable, la dame Aida, en écharpe  jaune avec la main levée sur la photo est âgée de 73ans mariée et mère de 03 enfants. elle a en charge aussi un frère et une sœur.

elle fait le commerce de légumes au marché du village et l'embouche ovine comme activité.

avec son prêt , elle va acheter des légumes et un mouton  pour les besoins de son commerce.

des bénéfices générés par son activité , elle va épauler son mari dans les dépenses familiales pour un mieux etre de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in April 2010. It consists of 12 women, most of whom live in the village. Their business activities are retail trading and sheep fattening.

Lady Aida (the group responsible), wearing a yellow scarf and raising her hand in the photo, is 73 years old, married with three children. She also provides support to a brother and a sister.

She retails vegetables at the village market and fattens sheep as business activities.

With the loan she will buy vegetables and a sheep for business purposes.

The profits generated by her activity will enable her to assist her husband in dealing with family expenses, ensuring a better life for her children.

loans.use: buy vegetables and one sheep

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana  es una señora de edad adulta y no por ello es impedimento para realizar algunas actividades, es una mujer emprendedora; con ganas de trabajar y salir adelante. Desde hace diez años inicio un negocio en un cuarto de su casa con el deseo de hacerlo más grande, la señora comenta que empezó con poco capital y con el tiempo las ganancias le permitirán surtir mas su tienda de abarrotes. Ahora ella muy preocupada porque su negocio sea prosperado al igual que ella y su familia quiere invertirle para que así puedan ver más ganancias y seguir con su proyecto. Con este crédito será el 5 crédito el cual agradece ya que le ayudado mucho en su economía familiar. Su esposo es un agricultor de alfalfa que la vende a otras partes de la ciudad y rancherías de por aquí cerca. Juna quiere comprar mercancía como refrescos, botanas, lácteos, abarrote en general, pan, tortillas y más.
texts.en: Señora Juana  is an older woman, but this is not an obstacle for her and she is still involved with several activities. She is a hard-working woman, who wants to work and get ahead. Ten years ago, she started a business in a room of her house, with the desire of expanding the business. Juana comments that she started with very little capital and, over time, her income allowed her to stock her grocery store more. Now she is very concerned because her business has prospered as has she, and her family wants to invest in order to increase income and continue with her project. This will be her fifth loan, which she appreciates because the loans have helped her greatly with her family finances. Her husband is an alfalfa farmer, who sells in different parts of the city and to nearby settlements. Juana wants to purchase merchandise like soft drinks, snacks, dairy products, groceries, bread, tortillas and more.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her business like groceries and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has been a baker at Ayensudu near Elmina for 4 years now. She is a single parent with 4 children.  As a single parent she feeds, clothes and pays the school fees of her children with her income. Mary needs this loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery. With the new profits, Mary would like to give her children the best education.

loans.use: purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Chhneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhneang, 38, is a hard-working mother who has been residing in Krong Siem Reap. She works alongside her husband who is a construction worker from place to place. Sometimes she acts as a cook for the team and sometimes she acts as one of the laborers who is responsible for transporting sand and stone and doing some type of lighter work. She typically earns $2.00 per day, while her husband yields around $5.00. 

With the amount she has requested from HKL, she will buy a stock of rice to keep for her daily food for the entire year. This loan will better her living and keep her family from being hungry. She is grateful for the support.

loans.use: to buy rice for her daily food for the entire year

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from eight to 15 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing and patient. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a strategic place, and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Florence's business goal is to venture into a wholesale shop within five years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan thirty three years old, is a married woman living in Masindi-Uganda. She is a hard working woman and she keeps poultry as he major business though she also engages in agriculture.  She has managed to look after her family though she is challenged by irregularities in the supply for chicken feeds. She has a dream of having a large number of birds so as to get better yields. Susan requests for a loan to construct another house for her poultry. Susan took the photo with her child who could not be left behind.

loans.use: construct another house for her poultry.

loans.name: Ursula Guadalupe

texts.en:
Ursula is married and her husband works as a laborer in a factory. They have two small children of 5 and 8 years of age. With his salary they cannot afford their expenses, which is why she sarted a new business some time ago. She started a new business to generate an extra income. She sells books and encyclopedias. Through this she has been able to help her husband. But today she has a very small stock of merchandise which is why her sales have been declining and her earnings are small.

For all these reasons she requires a loan of $250 which she will invest in the purchase of books and encyclopedias, so as to recover her sales. You can contribute in an important way to the wellbeing of Ursula and her family. Help her continue on in her business. She thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Ursula esta casad y su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica y tienen dos hijos pequeños de 5 y 8 años de edad, pero con el sueldo de él no pueden solventar los gastos, por esta razón, hace tiempo que ella comenzó con una nueva actividad que le genera ingresos extras, se dedica a la venta de libros y enciclopedias. Con esto ella ha podido ayudar a su esposo. Sin embargo actualmente tiene muy poca mercancía en existencia, es por ello que están bajando mucho sus ventas y esta ganando muy poco.

Es por todo esto que ella requiere de un préstamo de $250 dólares, mismos que invertirá en la comprar de libros y enciclopedias para poder recuperar sus ventas. Tú puedes contribuir de manera importante al bienestar de Ursula y su familia, ayúdala a continuar con su proyecto, ella te lo agradece.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy more animal feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a 28 year old married mother of an 8 year old daughter in primary school.  Her husband works at the sheriff center and Hamida started her business in 2001 in order to support her family.  All year she sells tomatoes that she buys from local farmers and in August she sells maize and beans as they are being harvested.  She is the chairwoman of the local community self help group called Yetana (translates as "supporting one another") which educates the locals on poverty eradication. 

Twice a week, Hamida travels over 60 km to sell her produce on the busy route between Busia and Malaba.  With the loan of $ 150 from PEMCI, she plans to increase her tomato stock, and to also buy cereals during this harvest season to sell later. Hamida hopes that with an increase in profit she will be able to purchase a chicken and sheep to feed her family and sell eggs.  She strives to give her daughter a better life than she had, including supporting her through a high level of education.  With her business, she has been able to supply the community with fresh vegetables and also provide for her family. Hamida is a well spoken, friendly business woman who is worthy of the support of Kiva partners.

loans.use: Stock Grocery Shop

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 32 years old. She has 2 children whom she is responsible to support, since her husband was killed in a terrorist attack. She has a sewing business in her home. She has applied to get $1000 to purchase a new sewing machine and more cloth. She want s to develop her business and increase her sales to enhance her living standard .

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn I., age 55, sells flowers at a market in Phnom Penh to earn $3 per day in revenue. Her husband, age 60, is retired. Of their three children, two work in a garment factory. She would like to request this loan to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: Phorn would like to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Helen A.

texts.en: Mrs. Helen A. E. is 35 years old. She is married with 5 childre and lives in Benin City of Edo State. She sells recharge cards and local food (Santana). She has been a LAPO member for the past 5 years. She is soliciting for $250 to enable her to buy more recharge cards and cassava for the preparation of  local food (Santana) for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and recharges card  for sale

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mana A. was born May 16, 1968, and is today married and the mother of 12 children, who have been under her sole care for 10 years, after the death of her husband. She has been a single mother with no aide from anyone else in caring for her large family, which is thinly supported by the revenue from her sales of palm seed oil. Dynamic and honest, she has proven herself responsible in handling loans. She is now applying for a new credit of $1,000 to purchase palm seeds in bulk, as they are necessary for her palm seed oil production, which she stocks and resells in between harvesting seasons when other stocks run low. Financing this project is her only hope to rise a little above her current state of poverty.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame A. Mana est née le 16 mai 1968, mariée et mère de douze (12) enfants qui sont laissés à sa charge, après le décès de son mari depuis 10 ans. Ce qui fait que la charge du foyer repose définitivement sur madame A. qui s’en sort péniblement par les revenus de sa vente d’huile de palme. Dynamique et honnête, elle a fait ses preuves en matière de crédit. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter les noix de palme en grande quantité et les nécessaires pour la production de l’huile qu’elle stocke et revend en période de soudure. Financé ce projet, est son seul espoir de sortir un peu de la paupérisation dont elle est sujet.

loans.use: The purchase of palm seeds for her production of palm seed oil.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
With the goal of supporting her four children and being able to offer them a better future, by offering them the chance to study in university, Martha started looking for a way to obtain an extra income because with what her husband makes as a driver in a lumber yard, it is not enough to pay for their children's school expenses. This is why in October of 2001, Martha Alicia started selling soft drinks and sweets outside of her home. Little by little people started to notice that these type of products were sold in her house, and so she continued to acquire other types of merchandise, such as chips, bread, and so on. After some time, she saved enough money to set up what is now her general store.

However, right now Martha wants to expend her business and this is why she is requesting a loan for US $650, which she is willing to pay in a period of 5 months. "So I can have a better and greater stock of products that allows me to offer proper attention to my customers, so they can always find what they are looking for", she commented. With your help, Martha will be able to increase her business so that all of her children can have the opportunity to go to college.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Con el propósito de sacar a sus 4 hijos adelante, y poderles brindar un mejor futuro, al ofrecerles que estudien una carrera universitaria Martha comenzó a ver la manera de sacar otros ingresos. Puesto que con lo que gana su esposo como chofer de una maderería, no es suficiente como para pagar los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos. Fue por eso que en Octubre del 2001 Martha Alicia comenzó a vender refrescos y dulces fuera de su casa. Poco a poco la gente se fue dando cuenta que en esa casa se vendían este tipo de productos y así fue como siguió adquiriendo otro tipo de mercancía, como botanas, pan, y poco a poco se hizo de mercancía, después juntó un poco de dinero para poder acondicionar la que hoy es su tienda de abarrotes.

Sin embargo Actualmente Martha desea crecer más su empresa es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses. “Para poder tener un mejor y mayor surtido de abarrotes que me permita atender debidamente a mis clientes y siempre encuentren lo que buscan” comentó. Con tu ayuda Martha podrá crecer su negocio para que todos sus hijos puedan tener la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Luzinga East F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Harriet M.. She is currently in the business of running a beauty parlor and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Harriet is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant farmer. She has 2 children aged 8 and 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Harriet makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business. Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Monica N. and Florence M.. Monica N. has a business selling rice and wants to increase her working capital. Florence M. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase more shop items.

loans.use: To boost business

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista R. G. earns a living selling fruits, vegetables and other products out of his home which is located in the Condega municipality of the city of Estelí. He is married and has three children. Mr. R. and his wife work hard to provide their children the education they deserve. Not only do they help them financially but with their school assignments as well.

Since he started his business he has been working tirelessly to improve his financial situation and to break free from the poverty that has been a part of his life for so long. For this reason he has obtained loans with Ceprodel (4 loans) which he has used to purchase merchandise to sell and in this manner he is able to support his family which depends on him.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Juan Bautista R. G. se dedica a la venta de frutas y productos varios (pulpería) en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Es un caballero casado y con 3 hijos que junto con su esposa se esfuerzan para proporcionarles la educación que ellos se merecen apoyándolos tanto financieramente y en la colaboración con las tareas asignadas en su colegio.

Desde que inició su negocio ha venido luchando fuertemente para mejorar su condición económica y salir de la pobreza en que por mucho tiempo ha estado involucrado. Para esto ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel (4 créditos) utilizándolos directamente en la compra de la mercadería para comercializarla y de esta manera obtener el sustento diario de su hogar que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits

loans.name: Flor De Liz 2 Group

texts.es:
María Aide is 37 years old and has three children. She sells glassware and toys. She started the business 3 years ago because her town was very small and did not have any stores where they sold childrens´s toy, dishes or glassware. She buys her goods in San Cristobal de las Casas or Tuxtla Gutierrez, both places located two hours from her town. She belongs to the Flor de Liz 2 solidarity group along with Rosalinda, who sells clothing and Aida Delia, who sells fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA AIDE TIENE 37 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS Y SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CRISTALERIA Y JUGUETES. ESTE NEGOCIO LO INICIO HACE TRES AÑOS A RAIZ DE QUE SU LOCALIDAD ES MUY PEQUEÑA Y NO HAY TIENDAS EN DONDE VENDAN DISTINTOS JUGUETES PARA LOS NIÑOS, PLATOS Y VASOS DE CRISTAL. SU MERCANCIA LO COMPRA EN SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS O TUXTLA GUTIERREZ AMBAS UBICADAS A DOS HORAS DE SU LOCALIDAD. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO FLOR DE LIZ 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA ROSALINDA (VENTA DE ROPA) Y DOÑA AIDA DELIA (VENTA DE TELAS)

loans.use: Purchase toys and glassware.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
Binta Baldé is 34 years old and married. She has 4 children and lives in the Kolda region of Senegal. Binta has been a member of Sinthiang Coundara Village Bank for five years and has significant experience with loans. She used to sell boubous, traditional Senegalese clothing, but then began making and selling peanut butter instead.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy peanuts and containers for the peanut butter. Buy purchasing in bulk she can increase her profits from the business. She hopes to improve the overall lifestyle of her entire family. This loan is for a duration of six months and will be reimbursed with a singe, bulk payment at the end of the term.

loans.use: To buy peanuts and containers for her peanut butter business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Mr. C. works full-time in an insurance agency in Nuevo Laredo. He just purchased his first home through a government program to help Mexican citizens purchase a home. The house is a basic unit that comes without a finished floor and unpainted, though, so Mr. C. is seeking a loan to finish these work items so that he can move in as soon as possible.

What is a Kiva housing loan?

In Mexico, many families are financially unable to purchase a house that is fully built out to meet their needs. Families thus improve their housing in stages in accordance with their resources. For families with limited income, saving up this money can be very difficult and a lack of capital can delay improvements for a long time. Kiva housing loans give families a tool to be able to have access to capital to improve their housing sooner, then pay it back at a pace that they can handle

loans.use: to install a finished floor and paint the interior

loans.name: Lilliam Azucena

texts.es:
Llliam works as a security guard in a commercial center in Managua, for which she is paid a salary insufficient to maintain her family. She is married and her husband is a mechanic who supports the household expenses. She has one son of school age. Seeing the need for greater income, two years ago Lilliam decided to start a business selling jewelry, with a loan from AFODENIC. These parents desire the best for their son and want to give him all the education he needs. For this reason Lilliam requests the loan, so that she can purchase gold and silver jewelry to augment her inventory and generate more sales and obtain more clients.

Lilliam trabaja como guarda se seguridad en un Centro Comercial de Managua, por el que devenga un salario pero que no es suficiente para mantener a su familia. Es casada y su esposo es mecánico y aporta para los gastos del hogar. Tiene un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar. En vista de la necesidad de mayores ingresos, hace 2 años Lilliam decidió empezar el negocio de las ventas de joyas, lo empezó con préstamo otorgado por AFODENIC. Estos padres desean lo mejor para su hijo y dentro de esto está poder darle toda la educación necesaria. Es por eso que Lilliam solicita el préstamo, porque quiere comprar joyas de oro y plata y así poder aumentar su inventario y generar más ventas y captar más clientes.



Translated by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gold and silver jewelry

loans.name: Alberto José

texts.es:
In the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, señor Alberto Melendez is dedicated to his business, the “Espiritu Santo” medical laboratory clinic, which, due to his various efforts, he has managed to maintain and to some extent over time improve little by little. It is necessary to emphasize that, in the year since he started the business, he has managed to improve the conditions of his home.

Due to the fact that he has carried out this economic activity for a year, he has sought a way to bring better attention to the laboratory and for this he has requested a loan from Ceprodel to purchase work instruments and improve the location. With this loan he will benefit greatly and equally his beloved family also benefits.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señorAlberto Melendez se dedica a su negocio delaboratorio clinico “Espiritu Santo” el cual debido a sus multiples esfuerzos ha logrado mantener y a medidida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo lo ha venido mejorando poco a poco. Es necesario destacar que desde hace un año que inició el negocio ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.

Debido a que está iniciando esta actividad economica por lo que lleva un año, ha buscado la manera dbrindar mejor atencion en el laboratorio y para esto ha solicitado un credito en Ceprodel para la compra de instrumentos de trabajo y mejora del local. Con este credito se beneficia grandemente y de igual forma su amada familia tambien es beneficiada

loans.use: To improve his medical clinic and buy instruments for his work.

loans.name: Livestock, Making Food Products, And Trading Goods Group

texts.vi:
Tô Thị Đào: 45 tuổi. Ms : 13.03.0026. Mức vay: 4.704.000. Cô Đào vay vốn về để mua đậu tương làm đậu phụ mang ra chợ bán. Nhà cô vừa làm nghề đậu vừa chăn nuôi lợn. Cô có hai dứa con đang học đại học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô khoảng 100.000 đồng/ ngày. Cô đã lo toan công việc hàng ngày vất vả nhưng cô vẫn tham gia làm trưởng nhóm của chương trình, vì cô rất thích chương trình tạo cho cô có thêm vốn để làm ăn và cách trả cũng phù hợp với gia đình cô. 
Trong đó:
<li> Ngô Thị Miên: 49 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0027. Vay mức: 4.256.000đồng. Cô Miên vay vốn về để làm bún và chăn nuôi.
<li> Trần Thị Mai: 45 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0028. Vay mức: 4.256.000đồng. Chị Mai vay vốn về để chăn nuôi và đi chợ bán hoa quả.
<li> Dương Thị Thuỷ: 38 tuổi. MS: 13.03.0030. Vay : 4.256.000 đồng. Chị Thuỷ vay vốn về để làm bánh đa nem và chăn nuôi.
<li> Trần Thị Loan: 25 tuổi. MS: 13.03.0029. Vay 3.808.000đồng. CHị Loan vay vốn để đi chợ , lúc rảnh rỗi chị phụ chồng đi lam thợ xây.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dao Thi T., 45 years old, is borrowing 4,704,000 VND T. buy soybeans T. make tofu and sell it at the market. Her family also keeps livestock in addition T. the tofu business. She has two children who are in college. The family's average income is about 100,000 VND per day. She has had many difficulties in managing the many daily tasks of the business, but is still participating in the program as a group leader because she really enjoys the opportunities that the loan money has brought her, and also thinks the repayment method is a great fit with the family. Her group includes: Mrs. Mien Thi N., 49 years old, borrowing 4,256,000 VND T. make rice noodles and raise livestock; Mrs. Mai Thi T., 45 years old, is borrowing 4,256,000 VND T. raise livestock and sell fruits; Mrs. Thuy Thi D., 58 years old, borrowing 4,256,000 VND T. make eggroll wrappers and raise livestock; Mrs. Loan Thi T., 25 years old, borrowing 3,808,000 VND T. do business trading goods, in her spare time she also helps her husband in his construction work.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for trading goods, raising livestock, and various food manufacturing activities

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est un vaillant menuisier, depuis 3 ans, à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 45 ans, Komi est marié et père de 5 enfants. Ses œuvres sont de qualité et il est compté parmi les plus réputés de son secteur. Il souhaite par ce crédit redonner de la vivacité à son activité en achetant des planches pour la fabrication des meubles. Komi espère améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille par cette opportunité qui lui est offerte.
texts.en:
Komi A. has been a courageous carpenter for 3 years in Lomé, Togo's capital. Komi is 45 years old, married and the father of 5 children. His work is of quality and he is among the most well-known in his field. He wishes, with this loan, to revitalize his business by buying boards for the making of furniture.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acheter des planches pour la fabrication des meubles.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia es soltera, tiene 27 años de edad, estudió en el Instituto Superior Tecnológico de Juli y vive en el Jr. Arequipa 252, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Desde hace 06 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró bayetas, lana, agujas, crochet, etc para hacer bordados, negocio que decidió empezar a los 22 años de edad  para poder estudiar y al mismo tiempo, en los días de feria en Juli, se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará relojes y/o artículos de limpieza de Desaguadero para el negocio que recién piensa emprender.

Su gran deseo es tener una Farmacia en Juli para dedicarse solamente a ese negocio.
texts.en:
Lilia is single, is 27 years old, studied at the Higher Institute of Technology of Juli and lives at Jr. Arequipa 252, Juli district, province of Chuchito, department of Puno. For 6 years she has been a member of the Communal Bank “Niño San Salvador” of Juli. At the start, with a loan of 300 soles (US $100) she bought rags, wool, needles, crochet, etc to do embroidery, a business that she decided to begin when she was 22 to be able to study and at the same time, on market days in Juli she sells clothes. With this amount of 500 soles (US $175), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy watches and / or cleaning articles from Desaguadero for the business that she has been thinking of undertaking. Her great hope is to have a pharmacy in Juli and devote herself solely to that business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase watches and/or cleaning supplies

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: Demetrio tiene 54 años, es casado y vive solo con su esposa. Él es agricultor por más de 40 años, esta actividad lo acompaña desde muy joven y lo que más le agrada realizar es la siembra de piña, ya que es su fruta preferida, además, por ser  un producto de  bastante demanda en los mercados, pero por temporadas logrando ser un producto más rentable, pues son pocos los que  se dedican al cultivo de piña por su zona. Lo difícil de este cultivo es la cosecha, debido a las espinas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Demetrio tiene pensado seguir invirtiendo en la producción de piña, desea adquirir un pequeño terreno más.
texts.en:
Demetrio is 54 years old, married and lives alone with his wife. He has been a farmer for more than 40 years. What he likes most is to plant of pineapple since it is his favorite fruit and it's a product in considerable demand in the markets, but seasons make a product more profitable. In his area, few people are dedicated to the cultivation of pineapple. The difficult thing about this crop is harvesting because of the thorns. This is his first loan with MFP. Demetrio plans to continue investing in the production of pineapple and hopes to acquire another small plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire land to increase his production.

loans.name: Gullam Mustafa Group

texts.en: This is Ghulam Mustafa, who is 25 years old. He is married, the father of two children and he lives in Angoorbagh in Nangarhar province. He has a tailoring shop in Jalalabad city. Mustafa has decided to make a group loan with four other members. They all work at different trades: Mujeeb operates a Public Call Office, Merwais and Shapooris are  tailors and Samsoor has a retail food shop. They would like to take out a 50000(AF) group loan with a term of 10 months (for each person 10000AF). Mustafa says that he can manage his group and that they can repay the loan on time.  They would like to thank all the lenders from around the world, Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan, for providing this process for loan to the poor countries.

loans.use: Invest in business stock and supplies.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa K. is married and has 1 child. She has attended school through primary level. Theresa sells groceries such as biscuits, andcanned products. She also buys fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama, which she has done for a while now. Her husband is a teacher. Theresa helps support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. She  will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand from her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies and groceries to meet the increase in demand from her costumers.

loans.name: Gulmurat

texts.en:
T. Gulmurat is 37 years old. He is married and has three children who are studying at school. The gentleman is a vegetable producer with more than 10 years of experience. He works all day on the plantations and he is involved in the whole production process, including post-harvest tasks and selling the vegetables.

It is relevant to explain that the production of vegetables requires adequate fertilizer to generate the expected harvest. Nutrients and chemical fertilizers are needed throughout the process. Currently Gulmurat is having difficulties getting into the market with his product because he doesn't have enough organic matter to incorporate into the soil. There isn’t enough fertilizer and the soils are poor in nutrients. It is for these reasons that his harvests aren’t going well. He lacks the capital to be able to correctly prepare the plantations and thereby achieve a successful harvest. He is hoping for your generosity and is very thankful to all of you.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged its already weak economy. 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable--conditions that have resulted in high levels of unemployment and forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to improve his harvest

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 38 años, es soltero, actualmente vive solo en su casa propia. Los trabajos agrícolas fueron y son parte de su vida, de carácter muy noble, siempre tiene la disposición de satisfacer las necesidades de sus hermanos y de los peones que trabajan para él en su afán de dar continuidad de las buenas costumbres y sobre todo que cumplan con su trabajo en sus cultivos. Roberto siembra en la chacra de sus padres, pero hace dos años ha comprado 2 cuadras con plantas frutales, y del mismo modo tiene anhelos se seguir adquiriendo más tierras. En estas chacras siembra café, porque dice ser mucho más rentable que los plátanos, pero la gran ventaja de los plátanos es que no se tiene que estar removiendo la tierra constantemente y estas plantas le duran más de 10 años en plena producción. Por ello que siempre trata de bien mantenerlas mediante el abonado correspondiente. Con el fin de captar mayores recursos tiene pensado trabajar en la ciudad, como chofer o quizás ponga un negocio, aun no lo tiene definido. Pero lo de lo que sí está seguro es que no solo espera tener ingresos económicos de sus cultivos. Roberto está muy feliz por tener la oportunidad de integrar este banco comunal, y más aun sabiendo que hay personas que hacen posible su crédito, hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y lo han nombrado coordinador educativo. El dinero que solicita es para comprar plantitas de café, y la otra parte, espera que le alcance, será para comprar fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Robert is 38 years old, single, and lives in his own house. Agriculture is and has always been a strong part of his life. It sustains his siblings and the laborers who work for him in their eagerness to provide continuity to their customs and above all carry out the work of the land.

Robert plants in his parents’ small farm, but for the past two years he has been buying 2 blocks of fruit trees and would like to acquire more land. In this small farm, he plants coffee because he says it is more profitable than bananas, but the advantage of bananas is that they do not have to be transferred constantly and these plants last more than 10 years in full production. For that reason he always tries to maintain them well by credible means.

With the purpose of acquiring more resources, he is thinking of working in the city as a driver or perhaps setting up a business, even though it is not yet defined. But the one thing he is sure of is that he is not only waiting to have economic income from his crops.

Robert is very happy for having the opportunity to integrate this communal bank, and even more for knowing that there are people who make these loans possible. He is committed to making prompt payments. This is his first loan with MFP, and they have named him educational coordinator. The money he is requesting is to buy small coffee plants, and the other part will be used to buy fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.ru: Гулматов Раджабмурод житель города Яван . Возраст 43года иимеет шестерых  детей.Всю жизнь занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Решил получить кредит для того, чтобы купить молодого бычка. Таким образом он увеличит поголовье скота и сможет развивать бизнес. Погасить кредит планирует в течение шести месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabmurod G. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 43 years old and has six children. He has been involved in animal husbandry all his life. He owns a small farm where he raises cattle. Rajabmurod decided to obtain this loan in order to purchase a young bull. This will allow him to increase his cattle headcount and expand his business. He plans to repay the loan within six months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan S. is a pig farmer. She is 21 years old and still single. She wanted to help her parents and siblings, especially with the family finances. She also helps her parents by doing the chores around the house. She started her business with only one pig bought with the small savings from her previous earnings.

Joan is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more piglets to increase the size of her piggery. The loan will help her earn more for her parents, siblings and her future family as well.

CEVI is reaching more people, especially the poor, to help them start and have their own business. CEVI provide all their clients with credit, training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to increase the size of her piggery

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia H. lives with her family in a peaceful village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Ofelia has a small business of piggery in their backyard that serves as her only source of income. Most of the people in their village are engage in hog raising business as their source of income in order to provide their needs in their daily living. Ofelia works hard to maintain her business and to sustain the daily needs of her family. But she doesn’t have enough capital in order to improve her piggery into a progressive one.

Then, she learned about ASKI, she is now asking to avail a loan amounting to Php6, 000.00. The loan proceeds will be use to buy additional piglets to be raised and also some feeds supply and vitamins to make her pigs healthy, thus it may increase its price if she sells to the buyer. She wants to make her piggery profitable and make it productive. Because she wants to improve their living condition into a more better one. She also dreams to provide good education for her children to have them a brighter future. Ofelia always believes that through her sacrifices and strong faith to God, she can attain all her goals in life.

loans.use: buy more piglets and feeds

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie Q. is from the village of Tuburan Aloran Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old, married, and has a school-aged child. Eddie owns and operates a business manufacturing hollow blocks. Eddie has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Eddie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Eddie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eddie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for equipment repair. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his equipment

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic B. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 33 years old. Marivic is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables & spices. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP (about 150 US dollars) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marivic joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional vegetables & spices. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will also be used to purchase vegetables & spices. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marivic from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family & children's education. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables & spices to sell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Babwirana B Musoke Margaret Group

texts.en: M. Margaret is aged 22 and living with three dependents who go to school. She has dealt in cassava flour for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase cassava in bigger volume, take it for milling and then put it for sale, thus adding capital to her business. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase cassava in bigger volume for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Olamide

texts.en: Olamide is 35 years old and married with two children. She has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 in order to purchase more hair extensions to sell.  She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope D. P. has been selling fried macaroni elbows (kropek), retail and wholesale, for almost one year. Her products are delivered to different villages of Cauayan City. She has two helpers in the business and, with their continuous support, Hope is able to earn around 5,000 PHP net income monthly.

Hope is a good mother to Cyrus, her 5-year-old son. She is married to Wilfredo, who is a tricycle operator in Cauayan City. Hope is 28 years old. Her small family lives in a simple village: Christine Village of Cauayan City. Their place is barely three kilometers away from the city proper. As her name indicates, she is full of hope! In good business partnership with her husband, they will some day win the battle against poverty.

Since Hope is earning a good income from her business, she is asking for the support of Kiva lenders to grow her business even more. She wants to borrow just 8,000 PHP. Hope is patiently maintaining her business, though it is very laborious on her part. She thinks that doing this will benefit her family in the future – especially her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for kropek business

loans.name: Linda

texts.es:
Linda es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros.
Linda es conviviente, tiene 18 años y 1 hijo, Linda junto a su mama tienen un restaurante, actividad que realiza todos los días, además los fines de semana vende comida típica. Linda tiene un carro que realiza transporte de pasajeros a la selva ayacuchana.
Linda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la ampliación de su local.
Los sueños de Linda son educar a sus hijos y que sus negocios mejoren.
texts.en:
Linda is a member of the Communal Bank Lord of Miracles.

Linda has a live-in partner, is 18 years old and has one son. With her mother, she has a restaurant that they run everyday. Additionally, in the weekends she sells traditional food. Linda has a car that transports passengers to the ayacuchana jungle.

Linda needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be used to enlarge her place of business.

Linda’s dreams are to educate her children and that her businesses will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge her place of business.

loans.name: Kuor

texts.en:
Kuor D. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Kuor is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to keep sending her children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Thata

texts.en:
This is Thata M., a small scale businesswoman in the town of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. Thata is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 from Kiva lenders through SMT in order to help her further strengthen her business.

Thata has, earlier on, received Kiva loans as a member of a solidarity group. With the help of those loans, she experienced a vast improvement in her business and personal life. She has been able to support her children in their education, feeding and well being; she has built herself a house with four bedrooms and a parlor and has solved many of her numerous household problems.

Thata is approximately fifty years old. She was born in Kabala town, married a lorry (truck) driver, and they have three children together. Thata sells rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), beans and groundnuts (peanuts). She has been a businesswoman for over twenty-five years now.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Berlisa

texts.en: Berlisa M. is from the village of Mabini, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  She is 51 years old. Berlisa is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Berlisa owns and operates a business venture in retailing. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of variety of goods in the local community. Berlisa has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP net a month for these activities. In 2005, Berlisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Berlisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Berlisa is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used for additional capital of sari-sari store. This loan will be the 3rd cycle loan taken out by Berlisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital of her retail store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 56-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, a majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as their major occupation alongside other trading activities. Sarah is a trader. She trades in cereals, and her primary good is maize. She buys the goods from nearby communities. Sarah treks to procure her supply and sells it at the local market. She has been in the business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet Y. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Juliet is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Juliet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Takoradi. Takoradi is along the coastal area in the Western Region of Ghana where fishing is the major occupation of many dwellers.

Jemima trades in fresh fish. She says she buys from the local fishermen/women. She has a cold store from which she sells and also supplies to food vendors.

Jemima has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn T. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao. She is 33 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Emelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. On March 31st, 2004, Emelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her pig-raising business. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Mrs. Shimorn Som Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Shimorn S. is a village bank president who leads 21 people in the Damnak Sangkae village in Kandal province. All the members will use the loan they obtained for different purposes.

Mrs. Shimorn S. is 50 years old and a farmer who owns a 0.20-hectare field to cultivate rice. In addition to farming, she is a cake seller and her husband, Mr. Bunrith Hun, is a soldier, so they can earn a little income to support her family. This time, Mrs. Shimorn S. wants to expand her cake selling business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make more cake to sell. Mrs. Shimorn S. is a mother of two children who are both students. All the members are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cakes to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita B. is a 41-year-old married woman with a daughter and son. They live in Bhatkepati, Lalitpur. Her husband, Mr. Shyam Krishna Bashnet, is a driver. Both her son and daughter took the SLC (School Leaving Certificate) exam this year.

Mrs. B. started selling milk three years ago. She already owns one cow. She's requesting a loan of 30000.00 Nepalese rupees to buy another young cow to sell milk in the local area. Since they live in a growing neighborhood, she believes that there will be an increase in demand for milk. Nepalese people love to drink cow's milk, so demand for milk is increasing constantly. 

She wishes to spend her income on her children's education.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Mario Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Mario Francisco F., labora como Inspector de Metrología en el Mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua, el tiene tres  hijos a su cargo y dos de ellos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado once créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los cinco créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc,  perlines y mano de obra para el techo de su casa.
Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Mario dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr Mario Francisco F. works as a metrology inspector in the Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua. He is married and has three children, two of them of school age. During the last five years, he has worked with 11 loans through CEPRODEL, and in this time period he has invested the credits in the improvement of his home. He has been an excellent client. Currently, he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, timber, and manual labor for the roof of his house. All of this is for the purpose of providing greater security and a better quality of life to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his house

loans.name: Alejandro Isabel

texts.es: El señor Alejandro O. Gaitán desde hace nueve años instalo una pequeña panadería en su hogar que en un principio solo trabajaban él y su esposa pero como no se daban abasto decidieron contratar a dos personas. Actualmente tienen muchos pedidos e invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materia prima para la producción.
texts.en:
Nine years ago, Alejandro O. Gaitán started a small bread bakery in his home. At the beginning, only he and his wife worked in it, but since they couldn't keep up anymore they decided to hire two people. At present they have a lot of orders and he will invest the loan in the purchase of raw materials for production.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raw materials such as flour, eggs, milk, yeast, cheese, preserves, etc.

loans.name: Luz Del Alba Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de Senkata se encuentra en la periferie de la ciudad de El Alto. Se podría decir que es uno de los más alejados, esta situación dio lugar a que  pudiera acoger a la asociación “Luz del Alba”.   Esta asociación comunal se formó en una Urbanización nueva que aún no cuenta con servicios de luz y agua.  Las socias refieren que otras instituciones no quieren darles crédito, desconfían de ellas y ellas a su vez se ven limitadas por que no pueden capitalizarse e impulsar sus negocios.  

Los negoción que declararon las socias son: costura de polleras y mantas, comercio de dulces, repostería, venta de condimentos, venta de huevos, tienda de barrio y fotocopiadora.

La señora Janett M., casada, con dos hijos pequeños indica que tiene el negocio de elaboración de mantas y polleras. Aprendió ayudándole a su cuñada y actualmente trabaja con ella.  
En su caso elabora las prendas a pedido, indica que generalmente los grupos de personas (llamadas comparsas) le solicitan vestuario para bailar en fechas festivas (aniversarios de  zonas de la ciudad,  sindicatos), entonces ella se encarga desde la compra de la tela, la costura de polleras y mantas  y el macramé de las mantas. Las polleras y mantas tienen que ser iguales para todas las mujeres que bailan en la comparsa y los colores y diseños deben ser diferentes cada año.  Es por eso que cada artesano  se esmera mucho con sus clientes y requiere de un capital importante para elaborar estas prendas.

“Luz del Alba” está conformada  por 9 integrantes, el varón que sale en la foto con el bebé, es esposo de la señora de chompa y pantalón beis (la que se encuentra a su lado).
texts.en:
The Senkata focal center is located in El Alto’s outskirts; one could say that it is one of the furthest. This situation led to it’s being able to take in the “Luz del Alba” (Dawn’s Light) association. This communal association was organized in a new housing area that still does not have electricity or running water. The members have stated that no other financial institution was willing to extend them credit, or to trust them. They, on the other hand, are limited because they are unable to have capital or develop their businesses. The members are in a variety of commercial activities, such as: shirt and skirt making, candy sales, pastry making, sale of spices, egg sales, neighborhood grocery store, and photocopy services. Janett M., married and the mother of two children, tells us that she has a skirt and shirt-making shop. She learned these skills by helping her sister-in-law and they currently work together. She works based on prior orders. She indicates that usually groups called ‘comparsas’ (theater or dance troupe) request traditional costumes to dance at special events (municipal anniversaries, labor union special days, etc.) She then must buy fabric and make the shirts and skirts as well as the macramé trim for the skirts. The shirts and skirts must all be identical for every woman that dances in the troupe and the color and design must be different from year to year. This is why each artisan puts in so much effort for her customers and why a significant amount of capital is required to make these costumes. “Luz del Alba” is made up of 9 members. The man carrying the baby in the photo is the husband of the woman wearing the beige sweater and pants seated next to him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, lining and trims for shirts and skirts.

loans.name: Tas Efi Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Tas Efi' group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are a group of petty traders who have come together to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group in order to boost their businesses.

Ya Fatmata B. is the leader of this group of borrowers. Ya Fatmata who sells plastic bowls, dishes, and gara lappers (locally dyed cloth) is approximately 37 years old. She was born in Mangay Bana village, near Magburaka town. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Ya Fatmata, who has been a businesswoman for many years now, will use her share of the loan to buy dozens of plastic bowls, dishes and gara lapper making materials – inks, caustic soda, powder and the white cotton (called 'brillian').

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy gara lapper making materials – inks, caustic soda, powder and the white cotton and dozens of plastic bowls, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane G. is a married woman who supports her family by selling bread as well as buying and selling livestock. She lives in Brgy. Cabacungan, La Castellana Negros Occidental with her husband and their four children who are between 11 and 25 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living condition with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 16,000.

Mary Jane is borrowing Php 19,500 so that she can continue her bread business and her livestock business. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Mary Jane aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora  María Eugenia  Deleg es socia del banco Comunal  Feria libre ubicado en  la parroquia Ricaurte al noreste del cantón Cuenca. Limita al norte con la parroquia Sidcay; al este la parroquia Llacao, al sur y al oeste la ciudad de Cuenca. Teniendo como atractivo turístico un hermoso mirador que se encuentra en el barrio la Dolorosa junto a la planta de agua potable, en la iglesia parroquial se encuentran cuadros,  imágenes y reliquias muy antiguas que atraen a los visitantes,  aquí se prepara unos exquisitos cuyes, cascaritas y fritada que es lo mejor de la gastronomía de la ciudad.

María  Eugenia tiene 25 años, de estado civil casada concibió dos hijos que se encuentran de 10 años y 9 meses, su hijo mayor estudia en la escuela de la ciudad, su esposo es chofer de transporte urbano, y como no tiene casa propia todavía viven  en casa de su mamá compartiendo todos los gastos.

Nuestra socia estudio costura en una academia durante tres  años y ahora trabaja en un taller propio adecuado en su casa  hace seis  años,  elabora  delantales y muy pocas veces  al arreglo de ropa, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo ya que trabaja según sus obras pero sí de  lunes a sábado. Lleva cinco años en el banco comunal gracias a su suegra que la incentivó a formar parte del mismo, con el dinero del credito solicitado comprará telas, hilos, cierres, encajes para la confección de sus prendas.

Su meta es llegar a tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
María Eugenia Deleg is a member of the "Feria Libre" (Public Market) communal bank, located in the Ricaurte parish in the northeast part of the canton of Cuenca. It is bordered in the north by the Sidcay parish, in the east by the Llacao parish, and on the south and west by the city of Cuenca. A special attraction of the area is its beautiful scenic overlook, located in the Dolorosa neighborhood next to the drinking water plant. The parish church contains paintings, relics and religious images which are very old and attractive to visitors. The people of the region prepare delicious roasted guinea pigs, meat stews and fried pork skin, which are the highlights of the city's gastronomy. María Eugenia is 25 years old and married.
