She has two children who are 10 years and 9 months old. Her older child goes to school in the city. Her husband is a driver in the city transportation system. Since they do not yet have their own house, they live in his mother's house, sharing all of the expenses. María Eugenia has been studying dressmaking in an academy for three years, and she is now working in her own workshop, which was set up in her house six years ago. She makes work uniforms, and every once in a while she does clothing alterations. She does not have fixed working hours, since she works according to the orders she receives, but she works from Monday through Saturday. She has been a member of the communal bank for five years, thanks to her mother-in-law, who encouraged her to join. With the funds from the loan she is requesting, she will buy fabric, thread, zippers and lace for making clothing. Her goal is to be able to have a larger workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics, thread, zippers, lace, etc.

loans.name: Mildred Jaqueline

texts.es: La señora Mildred F. tiene 43 años de edad vive en villa lobos 1 en la ciudad de Guatemala, esta casada con Ernesto Pacheco y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales le ayudan en el negocio. El negocio de doña Mildred es venta de productos de consumo diario, venta de arena y piedrin, toda la familia trabaja en el negocio. Con el prestamo quiere comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener diversidad de productos en su tienda. Ella sueña con tener una ferreteria donde pueda vender todo tipo de materiales de construccion y junto con su esposo darle una mejor vida  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Mildred F. is 43 years old and lives in Villa Lobos 1 in Guatemala City. She is married to Ernesto Pacheco and has three children who help with her business. Doña Mildred sells daily consumers products and also manages a sand and gravel business. Everyone in her family works in the business. With this loan, she wants to buy more merchandise so that she can have a variety of products in her store. Mildred dreams of opening a hardware store where she can sell all types of construction materials so that she and her husband can provide their children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Marie Solange

texts.en:
Marie Solange is 32 years old and is married with one child who is 13 years old. Marie Solange is commonly known in the business of selling a variety of drinks in her pub and this is her fourth successful year in this business. She runs her business from 6 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

Marie Solange is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through adding more drinks and starting to roast goat meat in her pub. With the use of this loan, she will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business and build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of drinks and goat meat for her pub

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, vive junto a su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Zaña, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus danzas y tradiciones de raices afroperuanas, se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la ganadería. Esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo. Ellos crían vacas para extraer la leche que producen y venderla diariamente a los vecinos de la zona. Los animales son criados al aire libre, en unos terrenos de cultivo cercanos a su vivienda. 

Con los ingresos que percibian de esta actividad han venido instalando una pequeña bodega en su vivienda, el negocio está creciendo y cada vez su clientela aumenta más, por ello Luz ha decidido ampliar su bodega comprando mas productos para ofrecérselos a sus clientes. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Luz es una mujer entregada a su familia y a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su menor hijo una buena educación. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos la consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Luz María, 30, is married and has a son; she and her family live in a rural area of Zaña district, known throughout the region for its dances and traditions rooted in Afro-Peruvian culture. It is located forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has raised cattle with her husband for the last 6 years. They raise cows for milk that is sold daily to their neighbors in the area. They raise the animals out in the open in fields near their house. With profits from this activity they have been equipping a small store in their home; this business has been gradually growing and every day they have more customers. Because of this, Luz has decided to expand it buying more stock items to have on hand for her customers. To reach this objective, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first-ever loan in the amount of 500 new soles. Luz is a woman who is dedicated to her family and to her work. Her greatest wish is to provide her son with a good education. Her neighbors consider her to be a level-headed, trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Orgalidia Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros es conviviente y todavía no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus suegros, trabaja en una empresa de transportes, Milagros vende cosméticos por catálogos, de 2 líneas, productos que ofrece a amigos de trabajo, actividad que realiza todos los días en sus tiempos libres.
Milagros es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar y solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes y cremas.
Milagros sueña con construir su casa y tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Milagros lives with her husband but does not have any children. They live in their in-laws’ home and she works for a transportation company. Milagros sells two different lines of cosmetics through catalogs, to her co-workers. She does this every day in her spare time. She is an associate of the “Bienestar” (Well Being) communal bank and is asking for a loan of 1,500 PEN ($550) to invest in perfumes and creams. Milagros hopes to someday have a house built and to start another business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is married and has three children who are ages four, seven and 10 years. Her husband makes a living by providing transportation services on a motorcycle, and shares her pride in having two children in school. Epiphanie contributes to the family's income by selling charcoal, a business she has been in for more than a decade. She is applying for this loan in order to increase her income by buying more charcoal to sell to her customers. She believes that her customers will buy these additional supplies because they know that her charcoal is of good quality and is sold at a reasonable price. Her dream is to open a wholesale business, and she believes she will be able to do this in the future.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina C. is from the village of Burgos, Naguillan. She is 50 years old. Angelina is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Angelina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Angelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional baby livestock to raise & sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Angelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion S. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Malinong, Brgy. Miranda, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a passenger transport business. Her husband, Jose S., who is 50 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living. He also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 17 to 28 years old.

Consolacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Consolacion has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 which she intends to use to buy a tricycle so that she can continue to save for future home repairs and business expansion.

Consolacion S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. (Dungganon is a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable.) Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Maintenance of her motorcycle business

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus M. is a married woman with two children who are four and eight years old. Her husband, Melisio, 31 years old, works as a fisherman to earn a living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They live in Purok Tuway in Barangay Canmoros, located within Binalbagan municipality in Negros Occidental province, Visayas islands. Venus operates two business ventures, a general store and a fishing business.

Venus joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past thirteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Venus has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,200, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.

For this, her 14th loan cycle, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and home repairs. Venus M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sidi

texts.fr: Monsieur sidy D. est  un célibataire sans enfant de 26 ans. Il habite à Bambilor. Il a été  initié  dans l’aviculture depuis qu’il était jeune par son père. Ainsi  Il a opté  pour  cette activité depuis 2 ans. Il est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis avril 2010. C’est sa première demande en financement. Il sollicite un prêt de 250 000f qui sera  destiné  à  l’achat d’aliments de poussins en vue de mieux renforcer son activité.  les revenus qui seront issus de cette opération  lui permettront de faire face aux frais de scolarisation de ses enfants plus particulièrement.
texts.en:
Mr. Sidy D. is 26-year old single man. He lives in Bambilor. Under his father's instruction he started raising chickens from a very young age. He started his business 2 years ago. He has been a member of the community bank Bambilor since April 2010. This is his first request for a loan. He requests a loan in the amount of 250 000 francs that will be invested in the purchase of feed for his chicks as a means of developing his business. The profits from the busienss will allow him to pay for his children's tuition.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda B. is from the village of Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Luzminda is married and has 12 adult children. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a business buying and raising pigs for sale. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Luzminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase pig feed. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Luzminda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Ma-At

texts.en:
Mr. Ma-at E., 39, and his wife, Mrs. Sreyfas Mat, 35, have been married since 1990 and have four children - three sons and one daughter. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 Kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ma-at is a fisherman whose fish are sold by his wife at the village market. Because some of his fishing nets are broken, he is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase new nets and a boat motor so that he can continue his business.

Mr. Ma-at E. was not available for the photo, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing nets and a motor for his fishing boats.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en: 53 year old M. Willy operates his personal products sales business in Jinja central market. He has been running this business for 11 years now and weekly his profit returns add up to shillings 100,000. Willy is married with 4 kids. He also operates a farming business. It is savings from this business that helped him start up. With this loan he says he is going to rejuvenate his business.

loans.use: The rejuvenation of his business

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is thirty-one years old.  He lives in the village of Muy Finca in the district of Morrope, which is northeast of the major city of Chiclayo.  It is a rural region primarily populated by small farmers and families that raise animals.  Orlando shares his home with his wife and their two dependent children.

For more than ten years, Orlando has been in the business of raising animals.  He has significant experience with a variety of domesticated animals and is skilled at raising them in a sustainable and healthy manner.  Orlando sells his animals in local markets once they reach the appropriate size.

The requested loan will be used to purchase roofing for his home.  He finds that the current state of his roof is inappropriate for his family's continued health and, therefore, plans to make this one-time purchase to improve his family’s quality of life.  He expects that the added protection from the elements will improve their health and reduce their stress level.  He hopes that will improve their productivity, happiness and reduce health expenses.

loans.use: To purchase roofing for his home

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dozens of slippers

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent, aged 29 years, is a married man with two children living in Kyenjojo Uganda. 

He has been a butcher and cattle dealer for the last three years. He started with buying and reselling goats and now trades in cows. 

His goal is to have a refrigerator for storing meat and to educate his children. Vincent needs the loan to buy cattle for resale.

loans.use: To buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah J. is 32 years old and married with four children who all attend school. She has been in the farming business for ten years. Her mixed farm, which is located in Kisii town, western Kenya, produces onions, vegetables, maize, beans, bananas and milk, which are all sold locally. She also runs a food kiosk in the same region.

Sarah's major challenges have been diseases and the high cost of veterinary services. She has requested a loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help improve the living standard of her family.  

Sarah aspires to acquire a vehicle in the future that will assist in the transportation of her products to the local market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man and the father of 4 school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He works as a freelance construction agent depending on customer’s demand. He has been involved in this field for twenty years. He is the only financial support for his family. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with payments made on time.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional equipment and tools to improve his business and provide his customers with better service.

loans.use: purchase additional tools to improve his business

loans.name: María Rosaly

texts.es:
En EL Barrio Santa Clara de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América, está situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, ella tiene  24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una preciosa niña de seis años de edad  que está en su primer año de educación básica. Su esposo trabaja en industrias Ales. Ella vivía en Guayaquil pero hace ya 8 años se vino a vivir a esta linda ciudad en la que se caso y ahora es donde tiene su vida hecha.

Trabaja en una peluquería desde hace mucho tiempo atrás, sabe de belleza y arreglo personal, nos cuenta que aquí ha aprendido mas y que también en sus tiempos libres se dedica a realizar trabajos de belleza por su parte, trabajo que lo hace a la par de sus trabajos de venta ya que también se dedica a la venta de bisuterías, las mismas que trae desde Guayaquil, ella espera que en poco tiempo llegar a instalar su propio salón de belleza para lo cual poco a poco está comprando lo necesario para uno de estos días decidirse a abrir su propio local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar una plancha de cabello, una secadora y otros accesorios necesarios en su trabajo. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un gran salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Activas (Active Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in the Santa Clara neighborhood of the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year round by both national and foreign tourists because it’s one of the most important ports of the country and of America located along the shores of the Pacific.

We met María, 24, here.  She’s married and has a beautiful, 6 year old daughter who is in first grade in elementary school.  Her husband works for Ales Industries.  She used to live in Guayaquil but 8 years ago moved to this beautiful city where she got married and now has established her life.

She has worked in a barber shop for a long time.  She knows about beauty and personal care.  She tells us that she has learned more here and during her free time she does free lance beauty work alongside her costume jewelry, which she brings from Guayaquil, sales business.  She hopes to have her own beauty salon shortly so is gradually purchasing everything needed to one day soon open her own salon.

She will use this loan to buy a hair straightening comb, a hair dryer and other accessories needed for her work.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank.  She is the Rules & Regulations Advisor and she likes it because the loans are easy to make.  Her dream is to own a great beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy a hair straightening comb, a hair dryer and other beauty accessories.

loans.name: Shareefan Munir Ahmed's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan lives in Pakpattan, a small city known for its agricultural industry in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives here in a two-roomed brick house with her family in the area of Peerkot. She moved here 30 years ago.
Shareefan is a caring lady who helps her family financially by sewing clothes. She has a good number of customers in her community who trust her work and give her regular orders every month. She learned this skill from her mother and it is of benefit to her in times of need. She is married to M. A. who is involved in a milk-selling business. For this purpose, he has three buffalo and two cows. He never compromises on quality and that’s why he makes good profits from his business every month.
Shareefan has six sons. Her two elder sons are daily wage laborers while the others are studying. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo, which will not only be an asset to him but also improve his income because he will be able to sell a greater quantity of milk every month. He has been involved in this business for ten years and Shareefan is hopeful that he will benefit highly from the loan. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Mary Waithera

texts.en:
Mary Waithera K. has practiced farming in Olkalou for the last 10 years. She is 53 years old, single, and the mother of one child.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by her friend, and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings.

In the future, Mary hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima G. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Gharibjanyan. She is a widow with two sons (37 and 39 years old). She has a positive opinion of the services of microfinance institutions. For the past 20 years she has been working as a farmer. Rima has responsibly sustained her business over the years. She is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and fuel. With this loan she expects her income to increase by 20 percent. Growing her business will be a valuable asset to her sons' families. She is satisfied with her life in Gharibjanyan surrounded by family and friends.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman from San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She is 39 years old and has 3 children. Her oldest child is 13 years old.

Rosita is a farmer. She has been growing rice for 6 years. She earns income by selling her harvest at the market. Rosita also sells fish around her neighborhood. She buys the fish from fishermen in her town.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mahukpego-Kpakpakanmey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MAHUKPEGO-KPAKPAKANMEY  est composé de quatre personnes qui vivent tous dans le même quartier à Kpakpakanmey à Cotonou. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. 
La représentante du groupe, du nom de Clarisse est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Clarisse est née en 1980 à Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Clarisse est mariée à Etienne et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Clarisse et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis près de onze ans, Clarisse vit à Kpakpakanmey avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Clarisse exerce depuis cinq ans environs, comme activité la vente de charbon de bois, qu'elle achète à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Clarisse vend des savons. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Clarisse sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
The Mahukpego-Kpakpakanmey group is a group of four people all living in the same neighborhood of Kpakpakanmey in Cotonou. This is the third time that the group has requested financial support from Alidé, in order to increase its business.

The group’s representative, Clarisse, is pictured in the photo raising her hand.  Clarisse was born in Benin’s political capital of Porto-Novo in 1980.  She is married to Etienne and is a mother of three, all of whom are in school, and two of whom she supports financially.  Clarisse and her husband work together to meet their family’s various needs.  She has been living with her husband and children in Kpakpakanmey for nearly 11 years.  For the last five years, Clarisse has been selling wood coal in order to cover her finances and improve her standard of living. She purchases her supplies in Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital. She also sells soaps on the side.  Driven by her goal of meeting her customers’ needs and increasing income, Clarisse and her group are requesting another loan.

loans.use: to purchase bags of wood coal and boxes of soap

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 56 years old and married with 3 children. Ana Maria works very hard to provide for her family.

Ana Maria runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Ana Maria has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, bread, and soft drinks. 

In the future Ana Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Kanyerere Ii Kyamwasha Bakyara Basheija Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Smith believes that without taking risks, one's odds at business success are minimal. Many people who know Smith describe him as a risk-taking and bold entrepreneur. Smith, who is happily married with 6 kids, has thrived in his food sales business, courtesy of his diligence, resilience and determination. His honesty, too, has been invaluable the last 9 years. Smith mostly sells beans, maize and coffee in food markets in Ntungamo. Weekly he says his business generates him shillings of 250,000 as profit. 

Smith says being a farmer has come in really handy especially during times when there is a  food crisis in Uganda. He says demand for his crops increases and as such he is able to make more sales profit. With this loan, Smith says he is going to purchase high-grade manure for his farming and gardens. He anticipates a betterment in his crop yields with the passage of time.

loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure fertilizer for his farming and gardens.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 38 years old and is a single mother of 3 school-aged children, all of whom attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years in her hometown of Nkubu in eastern Kenya. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans, bananas and milk, which are all sold locally. 

Lucy has made a loan request of 30,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy chickens and chicken feeds and to construct a chicken house. She believes that by venturing into poultry farming her income will increase and she will be able to cater for her family's basic needs. 

Lucy says that her major concern and worry is that she might not have enough funds to buy chicken feeds and this might pose a challenge to her production. She aspires to acquire another piece of land that will enable her to expand her farming business in the future.

loans.use: To puchase chickens & chicken feeds and construct a chicken house

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta, vive con su familia conformada por su esposo y sus 4 hijos D. 14, 13, 12 y 10 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, atienD. el negocio todos los días D. la semana, ya que está instalado en su propia casa, su esposo es agricultor y juntos mantienen el hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. frijol, azúcar, papel higiénico, bebidas y boquitas, este préstamo le ayudara a diversificar la mercadería y ofrecer a sus clientes más productos necesarios en los hogares, con la esperanza que sus ingresos aumenten.
Sus objetivos en el negocio son: fortalecerlo, aumentar su clientela y las ganancias, ya que sus hijos estudian y desea tener la solvencia económica para que estos puedan finalizar una carrera.
texts.en:
Roberta's family includes her husband and their 4 children who are 14-, 13-, 12- and 10-years old, respectively.  She operates a business selling everyday merchandise.  She tends the store, which she operates from her house, every day.  Her husband is a farmer and they support their family with their combined income.  
Roberta is applying for a loan to buy beans, sugar, toilet paper, cold drinks and snacks.  The loan will help her stock a wider range of merchandise so that she can proviD. her customers with the normal things they need from day to day and, in turn, increase her income.  
Roberta's goals for the business are to strengthen it, add new customers and increase her earnings.  She wants a steady income so that she can ensure that all of her children go as far in school as they can.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her general store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman with 3 children. She is 55 years old and runs a business of making coconut wine.

Rosa makes and sells coconut wine to the people in her community. She usually earns about 8,000 PHP per month with her business. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more tools for harvesting coconuts and other wine ingredients.

In the future, she hopes for her business to improve and to be able to sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy more tools for harvesting coconuts and wine ingredients.

loans.name: Meteini

texts.en:
Meteini, 39 years old, is married and has four children. He has been farming on his own piece of land for the last six years.

Meteini learned about KADET from the registered KADET groups. This will be his third loan, which he plans to use to prepare his land for wheat planting. Meteini hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve his children's living standards and education and for business expansion.

Meteini's dream is to prosper in the business of wheat farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare his land for wheat planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients (chicken, oil, beans, cheese and eggs)

loans.name: Joy Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Joy” group from Waterloo, a small town near  Sierra Leone’s capital city, Freetown. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL  4,100,000. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Aminata is the leader of this group. The 43-year-old is married to a businessman and they have five children. Aminata has been a businesswoman for more than 20 years now; she sells locally made soap called “Africana”, palm oil, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of palm oil in order to expand her business.  

(Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of palm oil.

loans.name: Flerida Georgina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Ciudad Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Flerida, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene siete hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido es comerciante. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importante para su negocio.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen un restaurante, allí todas las tardes venden gran variedad de platos para el gusto de sus clientes que acuden al lugar para darse gusto con los platos que prepara nuestra amiga. Trabajan todos los días desde las 16h00 hasta las 20h00, una señora le ayuda con su negocio al igual que su esposo. Lleva más de 30 años con su negocio y  le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sodas, cervezas y víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ciudad Alfaro” (New City of Alfaro) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are known nationally and internationally; it’s the place the famous straw hats come from.

Flerida, 63, lives here.  She’s married and has seven children who are all adults now but one still lives at home.  Her husband’s a merchant.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans are very important for her business.

She and her husband have a restaurant.  They sell a great variety of dishes there in the evening for the pleasure of their customers who come there to enjoy the dishes our friend prepares.  They work daily from 4pm until 8pm.  Another lady helps her with the work as does her husband.  She’s been in business over 30 years and does very well because she has many customers.

She will use this loan to buy soft-drinks, beer and foodstuffs needed to prepare her meals.  Her dreams are to continue forward and to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, beer and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Raut's Group

texts.en:
Raut is very active and caring lady. She does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is the mother of two sons. Both of them are enrolled in school and getting their education. Her husband is a factory worker who earns a reasonable income every month. 

Raut has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law who has a business selling animals. He buys animals from the animal markets and sells to butchers and other customers for a profit. With the loan, he will buy a cow that will allow him to fill the order of his client and earn profit. 
 
Raut is very confident that her brother-in-law’s business will grow in a positive direction after making a loan investment in it.

loans.use: To buy a cow to sell.

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en:
Rodella is 36 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rodella is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rodella has been raising pigs for 24 years, and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business and working as a dealer of beauty products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man with one school-going child. He has a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are for his family and school fees.

He has operated a pharmacy for the past three years; in addition, his wife also contributes in the family expenses. His potential clients are his local area neighbors. His major challenge is finding customers for his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale pharmacy in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenya shilling (KES) loan, he wants to purchase drugs for his pharmacy. He decided to join Yehu because of low loan repayments rate.

loans.use: To purchase drugs for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Nair

texts.es: La señora Nair  es  transportista se dedica a esta actividad hace varios años nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, no es casada pero vive  con el señor Federico que también es transportista,  tienen 1 hijo pequeño. La señora Nair conduce una vagoneta en el tramo Santa Cruz - El Torno ellos con el tiempo quieren comprarse otra vagoneta, ya que ellos los dos trabajan en la  misma actividad y de esta manera  poder tener mas ingresos para terminar de construir su casa ya que este es el deseo de la Sra., Nair el de poder tener su casita terminada y de este modo tener mas comodidad, con el dinero del crédito desea comprar una moto para su esposo ya que también desean trabajar como servicio de moto taxi, la Sra. Nair es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora entrando a una actividad que generalmente es para varones, ella supo salir adelante aunque cuenta que al principio fue difícil para ella.
texts.en: Mrs. Nair was born in the city of Santa Cruz.  She lives with her common-law husband, Federico, and their son.  She and her husband have a transport business.  Nair drives a minivan between Santa Cruz and El Torno.  In the future they would like to buy another minivan since they both are in the same business and this would enable them to increase their income in order to build a house.  Nair's dream is to have her own house for a more comfortable lifestyle.  The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle for her husband so he can provide a motor taxi service.  Nair is a very hard-working entrepreneur who is involved in an activity that is generally occupied by men.  She has been able to get ahead although she says it was difficult at first.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr:
Akuvi est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle a 01 enfant en charge.
Akuvi travaille comme revendeuse de chaussures depuis 2007. Elle vend au marché de HEDZRANAWOE après achat au même lieu.
Akuvi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures pour répondre à la  demande. Elle veut utiliser les profits supplémentaires pour augmenter son stock.
Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer un avenir meilleur à son enfant.
texts.en:
Akuvi is a 35-year-old woman. She has one child to support. She has been working as a retailer of footwear since 2007. She makes her sales at the HEDZRANAWOE market after purchasing her supplies at the same market. 

Akuvi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy shoes in order to meet the demand. She wants to use the extra profit to increase her inventory of goods. She says that, with the profits, she plans on ensuring a better future for her child.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Meiponyi

texts.en:
Meiponyi is 29 years. He is married with two children. He is a farmer with his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last six years.

He learned about KADET LTD from the registered KADET groups. This will be his third loan which he is planning to use to prepare his land for maize and wheat planting. The two crops has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the living standard and education of his children and for business expansion. His dream is to prosper in the business of tomato farming. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for maize and wheat planting

loans.name: Midedji Group

texts.fr: MIDEDJI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Solange (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Simplice. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Solange vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Solange a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une quinzaine d’années, Solange vend de l’avocat, de l’igname et des chaussures de façon ambulante. Solange achète ses produits dans un marché du Togo et dans un village du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Solange et les autres membres du groupe MIDEDJI sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MIDEDJI Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Solange (raising her hand in the photograph) is 43 years old and married to a mechanic named Simplice. The couple has two school-attending children they have to support.

Solange lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the various household expenses together. Solange dropped out of middle school. For about 15 years, she's been selling avocados, yams, and shoes as a traveling saleswoman.

She gets her supplies in a market in Togo and in a village in Benin. For the fourth time, Solange and the other members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their working capital and better meet customer demand.

The first three loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy shoes, yams, and fruits (avocados)

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
La formación D. este comité fue gracias a una D. las miembros quien oyó hablar del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la fundación y comento a sus amigas y vecinas, quienes gustosas aceptaron formar parte D. este programa. Ellas actualmente se encuentran en ciclo doce, con 12 integrantes, todas ellas participan muy activamente en las actividades.
Una D. ellas es la señora Mirtha, quien se dedica a la venta D. quesos. Comenta que sus productos tienen mucha salida por lo que le gustaría poder seguir con el,ya que gracias a eso tiene muy buenos ingresos. Dice que todo el trabajo que ella hace es por darle a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. quesos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to one of the members who heard talk about the Fundación enterprising women program and commented to her friends and neighbors who happily agreed to be part of this program.  They are currently in their 12th cycle with 12 members; they all participate very actively in the activities.

One of them is Mirtha who sells cheese.  She comments that her products sell well so she’d like to continue in business because thanks to it she earns good income.  She says that all the work she does is to give her family everything they need.

She asks for the loan to buy cheeses to stock up and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cheeses for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат умная и добросовестная женщина. Она хочет жить в хороших домах со всеми условиями. Для этого ей надо работать усердно и для этого она начала заниматься купле- продажей скота. Она выбрала данный бизнес, потому что с ранних лет она помогала своим родителям и научилась как ухаживать и откармливать скот. На данный момент она имеет один  крупнорогатый скот и 6 голов овец. Саодат хочет отремонтировать кухню, чтобы создать удобства на кухне. С этой целью Саодат запрашивает займ в размере 2000 Сомони и надеется на вашу поддержку, который позволит ей осуществить её мечту.
texts.en: Saodat is a smart and conscientious woman. She wants to live in a nice house that has new appliances. That is why she works hard raising livestock for meat sales. She chose this type of business because since her childhood Saodat has helped her parents to take care of animals and knows fatten them up. Currently Saodat has one cow and six sheep. She wants to repair her kitchen so that it is easier to work in. For this reason Saodat is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni and hopes you will support her in realizing her dream.

loans.use: to repair the kitchen

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a widow with two children, both of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity and nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia buys fresh fish from the market and fries them to sell at Ayensudo at Elmina. Lydia is married to a driver and has 4 dependents. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  A loan will help buy more fresh fish to fry and sell, and this will result in an increase in sales which will enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Rauben

texts.en:
Rauben is a hardworking forty-one-year-old man with two children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to build a permanent house and save for his wedding. He has been farming for the last seven years and the major challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. His goals are to diversify his farm to include livestock and to buy land to grow more crops.

The purpose of this loan is to pay the workers who are weeding his crops.

loans.use: to pay the workers who weed his crops.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is married and has six children.  Ernestina operates a grocery shop at Asebu Ekroful, Ghana, which she has done for three years.  Her husband is a pensioner.  Ernestina uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. 

Ernestina will use the loan to buy more groceries to offer her customers more variety.  With the new profits from her business, Ernestina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store to bring more variety to her customers.

loans.name: Gneleniton Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe GNELENITON VI sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kolombada, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AMI, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group "GNELENITON VI" are married women averaging 37 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Kolombada, a village in Commune de Guegneka, in Dioïla Prefecture. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of further organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are millet and peanuts. They are on their seventh collaboration with the institution.

With this new loan, AMI, who is the first person sitting from the right in the photo, intends to buy supplies and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to a customer base composed of men and women. 

AMI plans on making an average profit of about 120,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding, and sundry farm equipment

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells the staple Ghanaian food, yams, in the markets in and around Elmina. Esi has been selling  yams for 5 years now. She is married and has five children.  She uses her income to support her husband feed and clothe their children.  Esi  will use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of yams to sell in the market.  Esi  will expand her business sales with the new profit from her influx of capital. She is excited to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of yams to sell in the market.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 49 years old. She is married and they are blessed with 3 children. Her business is food cafe and selling charcoal. She has been in the business for 19 years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of charcoal for sale. She will use the profits from expanded business educate her children and expand her business further.  Her hopes and dreams are to be successful in business.

loans.use: to buy stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his metal work and fabrication business

loans.name: Eltadj

texts.en: 23-year-old Eltadj is single, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region. He settled in Khirdalan settlement. He has sold shoes for 3 years. Having borrowed a loan of $500 he bought shoes for men and women. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to start selling of shoes for children and sports shoes.

loans.use:
To start selling of 
shoes for children and sports shoes

loans.name: Cremilde Justino

texts.en:
Cremilde Justino M. is 47 years old. She was raised in Mancaraje, a Gaza Province, by her maternal grandparents. Since 1984 she has supported his family through his small restaurant. Cremilde was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA though friends. There she learned about the possibility of acquiring credit and requested her first loans. Today her business is thriving and it provides employment for Cremilde, and 2 employees.

With the loan of 13.000,00MT Cremilde plans on expanding her business. Cremilde’s work has appositive impact in her community because it creates employment, and provides lunches for workers and students in the community.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO: Bairro 02 - Boane ACTIVIDADE: Servicos CLIENTE: Cremilde Justino M. VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 13.000,00MT (520.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE: Restaurante INÍCIO: 10/06/2007 FIM: 28/02/2008 Cremilde Justino M. de 47 anos de idade, Natural de Manjacaze Provincia de Gaza, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos avos materno e a situacao financeira da familia criou-lhe oportunidades para estudar . Desde o ano de 1984 vem assumindo na integra a gestao do negocio da familia e possue um estabelecimento tipo restaurante. Apartir do ano 2006, por indicacao de amigas e vizinhos teve conhecimento da existencia da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA tendo aproximado e solicitado o primeiro emprestimo para ampliacao do seu negocio desde entao, a sua actividade conheceu outra dinamica tendo solicitado varios outros emprestimos. Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego a duas raparigas e suporta os encargos familiares.

Com o emprestimo de 13.000,00MT pretende aumentar o volume de negocio. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a ela propria mas outras duas pessoas, confeciona alimentos para trabalhadores e estudantes do bairro.

loans.use: To buy stock for her business

loans.name: Elsida

texts.en:
Elsida L. has lived in this house for the past eight years. She has had three children and is presently pregnant. Her business consists of cooking the traditional Dominican plates, such as rice and beans, chicken and goat meat. She sells these plates to laborers who have no other immediate source of food while working around the community. She tells us that business is good. Now she's looking to make her business larger.

Elsida buys the food ingredients in the local market. She wishes to be able to buy more in order to have a lower overall cost per unit of product that she uses.

With the new child, it's going to be five people that she will be supporting. This is obviously no small task, especially considering her husband is not around to help her. He works sporadically as a mason. She is placing her hopes very high, intending to send all of her children to the university in the capital city of Santo Domingo, some 45 kms. away from their home.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Rohanah

texts.id:
Rohanah (35) is an active Yamida client. She started trading since 5 year ago. Until now, Rohanah still helps her husband to support the household by selling snacks and soft drinks from a kiosk in front of her home. She earns about $9 per day from the kiosk, quite sufficient to help her husband, Aminudin (37) who works as a contract farmer with $5 daily income. Rohanah also has 1 child to support. Rohanah needs $125 loan to purchase more goods to be sold from her kiosk. The loan will be paid back in 12 months through monthly installments. Rohanah hopes with the loan, her income would increase.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Rohanah (35) salah satu Client Yamida yang aktif, Dia Mulai berjualan sejak 5 tahun lalu , sampai sekarang Rohanah masih membantu suaminya mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya , Dia berjualan di warung tepat didepan rumahnya untuk berjualan makanan ringan, minuman dan masakan. dari usahanya tersebut Rohanah mendapat penghasilan $ 9 perhari, lumayan cukup untuk membantu suaminya Aminudin (37) yang bekerja sebagai petani dengan pendapatan $ 5 perhari dan dengan tanggungan 1 anak yang masih sekolah. Rohanah memerlukan pinjaman $ 125 untuk tambahan modal membeli barang-barang , makanan dan minuman di warungnya dan akan dibayar selama 12 bulan di angsur setiap bulan. Rohanah berharap dengan mendapatkan pinjaman, usahanya dapat meningkat.

loans.use: To Increase her kiosk's working capital

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris A. is 46 years old, married with 5 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells provisions and drinks to people. She has been in this business since 2005 and needs a $475 loan to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks for sales. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Fiti

texts.en: Fiti has 5 children. She is a hard-working woman who has made a committed effort to the loan program. She is always trying to improve her small business. She would like to manage the weed problem better and increase the productivity and profitability of her plantation. She would use the loan to buy herbicides for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy herbicides for her plantation

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria began her business, selling clothing, 8 years ago as a way to increase her family's income. She's carried on working because the business has allowed her to help her husband provide for their two children.

Maria is asking for a loan of US$550, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can buy seasonal clothing and offer her customers a wider range of merchandise. With your help, Maria will be able to better help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María inició su negocio hace 8 años con el fin de aprovechar una venta de ropa de oportunidad para revender y con ello ayudar a la economía familiar. Se ha mantenido trabajando hasta hoy en esta actividad ya que con este trabajo a podido ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.

María Elizabeth está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar ropa de temporada para poder tener más variedad en su negocio y así los clientes le compren a ella. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Nakulyaku East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of coffee selling and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Sarah is 38 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Catherine S. and Aidah N.. Catherine S. has a business selling sugar wax and wants to add to the business. Aidah N. is currently operating a business selling spare parts and wants a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To add to coffee business

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia is a humble and hard-working mother whose perseverance has led her to overcome many difficult times and financial hardships. She is a native of the Macará district, and for 20 years has lived in the city of Ayaviri. Along with all her family, she makes a living selling red meats and wool (sheep and alpaca). These activities, which they carry out as a team, generate good financial profits that allow her to cover the school expenses of her 4 loving children. This hard-working and dedicated family acquires their goods from the different communities of the city of Ayaviri. After acquiring a substantial amount, they ship it to be sold in the city of Cuzco. Now that they see its demand in the market, they are planning on acquiring a vehicle to speed up and facilitate their work. With that goal in mind, they turn to you to request a loan that will help them attain the wish housed in their hearts.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucia, es una humilde y hacendosa madre, su constancia la ha llevado a superar muchos momentos difíciles y de crisis económica, es natural del distrito de Macará, y hace 20 años radica en la ciudad de Ayaviri. Junto a toda su familia está dedicada a la comercialización de carnes rojas, lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca, estas actividades que desempeñan en equipo les viene generando muy buena rentabilidad económica y así cubrir los estudios superiores de sus 4 queridos hijos.Esta laboriosa y dedicada familia adquiere su mercadería en las diferentes comunidades de la ciudad de Ayaviri, luego de reunir una buena cantidad los despachan para su comercialización a la ciudad del Cuzco, ahora viendo la demanda del mercado tienen pensado adquirir una movilidad para agilizar y facilitar su trabajo, con ese fin recurren a ti para solicitarte un préstamo a fin de cumplir el anhelo que albergan en su corazón.

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle that will allow for faster transportation of their merchandise.

loans.name: Juana Yadira

texts.es:
Juana is 40 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte, her and her husband maintain their own home. However, in order to help her husband with expenses has taken a job as a cook.

From her salary she hopes to pay back the loan requested to put up a wall in her home. Their 17 and 20 year old kids help them around the house. She wishes for them to live in a safer home. She hopes the wall is just the beginning for more small projects to come. She hopes to make this a reality through the loans she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana de 40 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es casada y su esposo mantiene la casa de su trabajo, sin embargo ella para apoyar la carga de su marido en los tiempos difíciles trabaja como cocinera. De su salario pretende pagar un crédito que solicita para hacer una pared en su casa, sus hijos de 17 y 20 años de edad, le apoyan en las quehaceres del hogar, y quiere que ellos habitan en una casa mas segura por lo que poco a poco empezando con esta pared quiere ir avanzando en mejorar su casa con sus créditos.

loans.use: Put up a wall in her bedroom

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 36-year-old married man who owns and drives a boda-boda (motorbike taxi) for a living. He started this business five years ago with a bicycle taxi. After a few years, he sold the bicycle and bought a small motorbike. He has since sold that motorbike and now owns a bigger mortorbike. Eventually, Richard hopes to buy another motorbike and rent it to a driver to use as a taxi.

Richard also has a plot of land in his village where he cultivates maize, cassava and beans. He employs two workers to tend the land and sell the vegetables they harvest. Richard visits his plot in the village every three months to check on it.

Richard is seeking a loan to buy a small cow for $118 and seeds with the remainder of the money. His plan is to sell the cow's milk in his village and to plant the seeds on his plot.

Richard's wife works full-time at a tailoring factory. They have no children.

loans.use: To buy  a small cow  for $118 and seeds with the remainder of the money

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Maria Juana started her shoe business in order to help her husband with the family expenses. Her husband had barely started working at that time, and did not earn that much income, so his family underwent financial hardships. She decided to start a business that would generate income for her, so she started selling shoes to her friends and family a year ago. Now, her client base has increased considerably.

She is requesting a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, in order to purchase merchandise. This is graduation season, which is optimum for her because she has received several shoe orders. With your help, Maria will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Juana inició el negocio de la venta de calzado para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Su esposo tenia muy poco tiempo de haber comenzado a trabajar y estaba ganando muy poco de sueldo, por lo que su familia se veia en aprietos economicos. Ella decicido emprender un negocio que le generara ingresos por lo que comenzó hace poco mas de 1 año vendiendo zapatos a sus amigas y familiares, actualmente su numero de clientes se ha incrementado considerablemente.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia ya que esta proxima la temporada de graduaciones y es muy buena para ella ya que tiene varios pedidos de calzado. Con tu apoyo Maria saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Doña Teodocia is 55 years old, a widow with four children who are independent. She owns her home which has electricity, water, latrine, and is located in Patascahi, District of Ollaraya, Province of Yunguyo. For the past 20 years, she has been selling potatoes, “chuño” (a Peruvian kind of potato), and “tarwi” (pulses) as well as making “aguayos” (a kind of woven shawl) and blankets. She is a member of “Banco Comunal Unicahi, and with a previous loan of S/.300 she bought different colored wool; 100 hanks, to make blankets. With the requested loan of S/.1,500, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy “chuño”, potatoes as well as cheese to be sent to her daughter in Lima who will sell it and send back the money via a bank. At the present she is collecting “tarwi” and potatoes. As a member of the bank she learned to get ahead to support her children, and it is her dream that her children have a better life than she has had, better homes and more material properties. She is very thankful for the loans as they enable her to help her children en Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teodocia tiene 55 años D. edad , su estado civil es V., tiene cuatro hijos , quienes ya son independientes. Su domicilio es propio, cuenta con luz, agua, letrina y esta ubicado en Patascahi, Distrito D. Ollaraya, Provincia D. Yunguyo. Se dedica a la a venta D. papa, chuño, tarwi, desD. hace 20 años atrás, también elabora aguayos y frazadas. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Unicahi, inició con S/. 300.00 con lo que compró lana D. diferentes colores, la cantidad D. 100 madejas, para elaborar frazadas. Con este crédito D. S/. 1,500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará chuño, papa , además comprará queso que será enviado a Lima a su hija y ella se encargará D. venderlo y enviar el dinero vía banco. Por esta fechas ella esta recogiendo la producción D. tarwi y papa . Perteneciendo al banco aprendió a salir adelante para que pueda apoyar a sus hijos, sueña que sus hijos vivan mejor que ella, que tengan sus casas y adquieran más bienes. Está muy agradecida por los préstamos, porque D. esa manera también ayuda a sus hijos que se encuentran en Lima.

loans.use: Purchase "chuño", potatoes and cheese to increase sales.

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi X. - 41 years old - joined the TYM Fund in 1998. Her family's financial situation has completely changed during the last ten years of their participation in the fund. Her family has experienced good results from their investment into rearing livestock and they have been able to save up to build a house with four rooms which are quite spacious.

Today, in addition to their livestock rearing, she and her husband gather and sell scraps which provides an income of 1,000,000 VND per day. Her family hopes to expand their breeding facilities and purchase more pigs to raise.

For this loan, she seeks 12,000,000 VND to renovate the breeding facilities and purchase more livestock. Their average income was 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Xuân 41 tuổi, tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 1998. Trải qua 10 năm tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã thay đổi rõ dệt. Từ việc đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi đem lại hiệu quả cao gia đình chị đã tích lũy được số tiền tiết kiệm và chị đã xây được 1 ngôi nhà 4 gian khá khang trang. Hiện nay ngoài công việc chăn nuôi vợ chồng chị còn đầu tư vốn đi thu mua phế liệu về bán thu nhập 100.0000đ/ ngày. Với mong muốn của gia đình chị là đầu tư mở rộng chuồng trại và mua giống lợn với số lượng lớn về chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay.12.000.000đ sửa sang chuồng trại và mua giống lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Le Thi N. is 35 years old. Joining TYM in 1997, she borrowed her first loan worth VND 500,000 to buy pigs and fruit trees for her agricultural business. After 10 years in TYM, her family's economy is more stable. In their free time, her husband works for other people and she buys and sells rice. With a stable income of VND 2 million per month ($125 USD), her family's living conditions have improved and they can pay for their children's education. For the next loan cycle, she is asking for VND 10 million ($625 USD) to invest in livestock.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Tedy Magoha Peace Group

texts.en:
Tedy M., age 40, is married with four children (ages 16, 13, 9 and 6). She has a business selling chapatti and pork from her house. She started the chapatti business 4 years ago but only recently started selling pork. She works daily from 6am until 11am. Tedy is able to earn about $125 per month from the chapatti and $333 from the pork.

This will be Tedy's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she is excited to get started! She intends to use the loan to increase her pork selling business by buying more pigs.

Tedy will share this loan with her loan group, Peace. The group has 18 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Tedy is squatting in the front, second from the left in a white shirt.

loans.use: These women would each like to improve their own businesses.

loans.name: Armida Elena

texts.es:
La señora Armida Elena H. Rodríguez tiene 22 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras y vive en la calle Desamparados 792 en el Balneario Buenos Aires Norte del distrito Víctor Larco de la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento d La Libertad Perú.
Estudió auxiliar de contabilidad en un instituto tecnológico, pero no pudo continuar por falta de medios económicos. Es madre soltera de un lindo bebe.
Es vendedora ambulante, empezó vendiendo las golosinas  y fruta en baldes grandes, gracias a su esfuerzo y a los prestamos de Manuela pudo completar para comprar un triciclo. Ahora va por las calles vendiendo, golosinas y fruta, llegada la tarde, mas o menos las 4 de la tarde hace mini parrilla que le llaman parrillita en una pequeña parrilla.
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles pagados en 4 cuotas, amplió su negocio vendiendo raspadilla porque fue en tiempo de verano.
Con este crédito de 750 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas piensa terminar de pagar un segundo triciclo y pintarlo para que tenga presencia, manifiesta.
Elena sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Armida Elena H. Rodríguez is 22 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” and lives at Desamparados Street 792 in the resort community North Buenos Aires in Victor Larco district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She studied accounting assistant in a technical institute, but she couldn’t continue because she lacked economic means. She is a single mother of a beautiful baby. She is a street vendor, she began selling candy and fruit in large buckets. Thanks to the loans from Manuela she was able to save enough to buy a tricycle. Today on the street she sells candy and fruit, and in the afternoon around 4 she sets up a mini grill. Her first loan for 300 soles was repaid in 3 payments and she expanded her business to include selling shaved ice because it was summer. With this loan for 750 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she is planning to pay for a second tricycle and paint it so that is has a noticeable presence. Elena dreams of having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase a tricycle

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Mrs. Uch V., age 65, makes a living by raising female pigs to make piglets to sell for her clients who live near her house or in the area of her Commune. She has five children, four of whom are married, and her son is employed as a fruit seller. Her husband, Mr. Phat Phorn, 58, is a farmer who lives in Koktlokle Commune in Siem Reap Province. V. needs her son to run a new store for repairing motorcycles. Hence, she applied for a loan to purchase motorcycle materials for her son to work.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle materials

loans.name: Hein

texts.en:
Mr. Hein M. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. He is a construction worker. Since his work place is far from the house, he usually pays a lot of money for a motorbike taxi for transportation. He now is requesting for a loan to buy a motorbike so he can go to work himself and reduce his expenses.

His wife, Mrs. Len Yoen, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Mr. Hein M. is 48 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife is near him on the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to go to work and reduce his expenses.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana María es una mujer que vive sola ,  que ha demostrado que luchando 14 horas de trabajo diarias se puede salir adelante y lograr tener una vida mas cómoda, a la señora le acaban de entregar su casita 
Pero le están haciendo falta las protecciones , es por ello que ella esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Maria is a woman who lives by herself. She has proven that 14-hour work days can make you a successful person and will give you a more comfortable life. She has just received her new home but needs some kind of protection.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Security for her house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. is currently in the business of selling drugs at the pharmacy. Grace is twenty years old and a widow. She has one child, who is in school. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her pharmaceutical business.

loans.name: Peniel 2 Group

texts.en:
Brigida S. and her group (Group 2 from the Peniel Bank of Hope) are starting their fourth loan cycle through Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. Brigida has four grown-up children; three female and one male. The females are all Esperanza clients through microloans.

Brigida has a small cafeteria at a local school. Right now she is facing a problem: She doesn’t have anything to keep the drinks she sells cold, so she has to buy ice blocks for this purpose. Sometimes the kids at the school don’t want to buy the water, juices and soft drinks she sells because they’re not cold, which is necessary in a tropical country like the Dominican Republic. So Brigida will use this loan to buy a freezer where she can store the drinks. She has already seen one that is on sale for a good price, she says.

When the school is closed, Brigida sells fried Johnny cakes and drinks at her house. In time, she would like to have her own colmado (convenience/grocery store) so she can sell in the same place permanently.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Buy a freezer for school cafeteria

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 51 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells chickens wholesale and retail to her customers. She hopes to expand this business.She needs the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more chickens to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Caren Adoyo

texts.en: Caren Adoyo O. is a 55-year-old mother of three children and two grandchildren. She takes care of the two grandchildren because their parents died a long time ago. She lives in Dunga, a small fishing village outside of Kisumu where she sells vegetables like tomatoes and onions. She is asking for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to help her pay school fees and to increase her food stock. She lives alone and is responsible for all the children. Caren told us that she has so many problems right now it is hard for her to see any good.

loans.use: To pay tuition and buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo strives to earn income through his tricycle transport business while his wife, Adelaida, maintains a hog raising business (like most housewives in their village do). He is 48-years old and blessed with six children: Eva – 28, college graduate; Freddie – 26, college graduate; Anamarie - 24 years old and also a college graduate; Adelyne – 19, first year college; Mario - 14 years old, sophomore in high school and John Paul - 3-years old. Pablo and his wife hope that they will be able to support their younger children, who have ambitions to finish college someday.

Pablo doesn’t have enough capital to improve his tricycle. Thus, he wants to borrow 5,000 PHP to be used for motorcycle maintenance. He wants to improve his motorcycle's running condition, to make sure that his passengers are always safe. With this strategy, Pablo believes that he will be able to increase his daily income from his transportation service, and provide his children with allowances, and his wife with money to maintain her hog raising business.
