Pablo is getting older but, as long as he is strong enough, he will continue to do his best to satisfy his family's daily needs.

loans.use: For motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Davlat

texts.ru: Пулотов Давлат Рофиевич 1977 год рождения ,национальность таджик  ,серия паспорта А 3809817 ,выдан ОВД г. Истаравшан 02,09,05 . Образование средне –техническое .Женат имеет 4 детей .Жена Пулотова Хуршеда .Место жительства г. Истаравшан к. Обджувоз .Клиент сварщик занимается изготовлением железных ворот ,решётки и т.д дома . Клиент хочет взять кредит на материалы и сырьё ,железные трубы ,металлический жест .Имеет электросварочный аппарат.Клиент берёт заем 1600 сом. на 5 мес.
texts.en:
P. Davlat Rofievich was born in 1977, is Tajik by nationality. He has a secondary-technical education. He is married and has 4 children. His wife is Pulotova Khursheda. He is a resident of the city of Istaravshan, village of Obdzhuvoz. The client is a welder who makes metal gates, lattices, etc. at home. The client would like to take out a loan for raw materials (metal pipes, tinplate). He has a welding instrument. The client is taking out a 1600 somoni loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.pt:
Laurinda J.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Comercio – Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade  
Montante de Empréstimo: 25,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Laurinda de 40 anos nasceu no distrito de Guijá, Província de Gaza, estudou até segunda classe. Solteira e mãe de um filho de 16 anos de idade, ainda na fase escolar e sustenta 3 sobrinhos que vivem sobre responsabilidade dela por serem órfãos.
Nasceu em Guijá porque o pai encontrava se naquele distrito em missão de serviço e a mãe numa das visitas ao pai acabou dando parto naquele distrito de Gaza, mas sempre a residência deles foi no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo.
Vive na casa própria, é comerciante a 20 anos e nunca trabalhou para outrem. Tem como rendimento mensal 3,500.00MT.
É quinto empréstimo com a Hluvuku e sempre foi pediu empréstimo para mesma actividade. Com o valor de 25,000.00MT, pretende reforçar o stock de modo a satisfazer a demanda da sua clientela.
No futuro sonha ampliar o seu estabelecimento comercial
texts.en:
Laurinda is 40 years old and was born in the district of Guijá in the Province of Gaza. She went to school until the 2nd grade. She is a single mother of a 16 year old son, who is still in school, and she supports 3 nephews that are her responsibility because they were orphans. She was born in Guijá because her father found himself in that district on a service mission, and her mother, on one of her visits to her father, ended up giving birth in the district of Gaza. But they always had a home in the district of Boane in the Province of Maputo. She lives in her own home and has been a trader for 20 years. She has never worked for anyone. She has a monthly income of 3,500MT. This is her 5th loan with Hluvuku, and they are always used for the same activity. With a value of 25,000MT she intends to increase her stocks so she can satisfy the demand of her clientele. In the future she dreams of expanding her commercial establishment.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her stocks

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom has a small business selling clothing. She is married with three children and has been in business for four years. Dilorom is an energetic, enthusiastic entrepreneur who operates her business simply but wisely. When she has needed to purchase new clothing inventory, she has paid other clothing vendors to buy for her so that she can stay and keep her business open rather than close her business to travel herself to buy inventory.

Dilorom has requested a loan to help renew her supply of clothing inventory. This loan will help her purchase a good supply of inventory so she can maximize her profits and continue working to develop her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women for the summer season.

loans.name: Marta Chavela

texts.pt:
Marta Chavela D. N. nasceu em Changalane uma Localidade que dista 38 km da vila do Município da Namaacha. Tem 40 anos de idade e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreenD. entre os 5 aos 18 anos de idade. todos eles encontram se a estudar.

Marta inicia o seu próprio negócio apos a morte do seu sogro, este que era proprietário de uma grande loja que dista 7 km da vila do Município da Namaacha em Macuacua porque era a única nora casada oficialmente foi cedida para explorar aquele estabelecimento. Seu marido que e proprietário de um tractor iniciam com trabalhos de lavoura nas machambas onde conseguiu juntar um fundo para dar a sua mulher iniciar com o negócio, anos depois houve um conflito entre familiares na disputa de bens do seu falecido sogro e ela fica na beira da falência. Numa conversa com sua prima que e nossa cliente falam lê acerca dos nossos serviços e ela aproxima se solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para reforçar o seu negocio e ela consegue levar avante, tem viajado uma vez por mês devido à localização da sua loja que se encontra perto da fronteira e a maior parte dos consumidores fazem as compras na vizinha suazilândia, ela tem como melhor produto (açúcar, arroz e bebiD.). Consegue de lucro um valor de 4.000.00MT e consegue poupar 1.000.00MT, pois conta com ajuda de 2 empregados e com ajuda do seu esposo que é criador e proprietário de 32 cabeças de gado bovino, para alem dos seus filhos marta responsabiliza se pela sua mãe enviando lhe 1.000.00MT em cada 3 meses.


Este e o segundo empréstimo de Marta na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro usou para reforçar o seu negócio, pois encontrava se na beira da falência, Estes 20.000.00MT serviram para aumentar o volume do seu stock. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para expandir mais ainda o seu negocio e vender a grosso.
texts.en:
Marta Chavela D. N. was born in Changalane, a community 38 km from the town of Namaacha. She is 40 years old and has three children between the ages of 5 and 18. All of them are still in school. Marta started her own business after her father-in-law's death. He owned a large store 7 km from Namaacha in Macuacua. Because she was the only daughter-in-law who was legally married, it was left to her to care. Her husband owned a tractor and worked on small farms to earn money to help his wife with her business. Years later there was a family dispute over the distribution of the deceased's assets, and she was on the verge of bankruptcy. A cousin told our client about our services, and she came to us to request a loan in the amount of 10,000 meticals to improve her business. She has been successful. Because of her store's location near the border with Swaziland, most consumers do their shopping in the neighboring country. She travels once a month and has the best products (sugar, rice, and beverages). She makes 4000 meticals profit each month and saves 1000 meticals, since she has the help of two employees and of her husband, who raises cattle and owns 32 head. In addition to her children, Marta takes care of her mother, sending her 1000 meticals every three months. This is Marta's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. She used to first to improve her business, since she was near bankruptcy. This 20,000 metical loan will be used to increase the volume of her stock. She is confident that she will pay off the loan early and request a new one to continue expanding her business and start selling wholesale.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Mansuma

texts.en:
Mansuma (her husband is pictured) is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, settled in the Mahmudlu-1 village.

Mansuma was born in 1971. She is a mother of 2 children. Three years ago, this family started a cattle-breeding business.

Now this family needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 calves to expand their cattle-breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 5 calves

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Cécile vend de piment en détail et en gros. En effet, Cécile vend le piment en gros sur commande aux restaurateurs, aux gérants de maquis et aux vendeurs en détail. Pour ses ventes en détail, Cécile expose le piment devant sa maison dans une baraque. Cécile a déjà bénéficié d’un premier crédit de la part de ALIDé pour cette activité. Cécile a bien remboursé ce crédit et sollicite un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son capitale en vue de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Cécile is married and the mother of 4 children. She sells hot peppers, both retail and wholesale. In fact, Cécile sells the hot peppers wholesale on order to restaurant owners, managers of chop bars, and to retailers. For her own retail sales, Cécile displays the hot peppers in a shed in front of her house. Cécile has already received a first loan from ALIDé for this business. Cécile has reimbursed this loan correctly and is asking for a second loan to bolster her working capital so as to respond appropriately to the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 6 sacks of hot peppers

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar P. R., tiene  60 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene tres hijos ya mayores de edad. El señor Julio posee un negocio de compra-venta de ropa nueva, esta la compra en el mercado oriental de Managua y luego las entrega. Sus ventas son en su mayoría por encargo y a crédito, a recuperarse en plazos no mayores de dos meses. Don Julio P. dio inicio a su negocio hace  13 años con muy poca clientela y muy poco inventario, ya que tenia la necesidad de buscar un medio para sustentar a su familia. El crédito será invertido en la compra de ropa variada ya que con la llegada de las fiestas patronales tiene bastantes pedidos. Su sueño con respecto al negocio es llegar a tener un negocio formal, establecido en el mercado y que ya no tenga que realizar las ventas de forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio is 60 years old, married and has three grown children. Mr. Julio owns a new clothing business. It is located in the oriental market in Managua. He delivers his clothes to this market. His wholesale sales are on request and on credit. The loans he offers are paid on time and over no more than two months. Mr. Julio began this business thirteen years ago with a small client base and a small inventory, as he needed a means to support his family. The loan will be used to buy a variety of clothing. The upcoming national holidays cause a lot of requests for clothing. His dreams in respect to his business are to have an established presence in the market and to not have to sell his clothes in an ambulatory manner.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
Jennifer is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 39 years old and married with six children, the eldest being eighteen years old and in Secondary Six. She also takes care of other orphans.

Jennifer is a business woman involved in the sale of agricultural products. She also raises animals and poultry. Her main challenge is her lack of sufficient feed for her poultry, which results in their poor growth.

Jennifer is requesting a loan to help buy more feed for her poultry. With a loan she will be able to raise quality chickens and agricultural products, resulting in increased sales. Jennifer dreams of sending all of her children through school so that they can become self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy more feed for her poultry

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene  51 años, vive con su hijo, su anciana madre y un tío, también anciano, en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, pero desde hace 3 años decidió intensificar su actividad ganadera comprando vacas de raza criolla que luego dieron crías. Ahora Natividad vende diariamente leche que ordeña de sus vacas y vende los becerros que son machos, para ello, diariamente corta el pasto para su alimentación y tiene mucho cuidado en pastorearlas, pues anteriormente por un accidente perdió a una de sus vacas.  El deseo a futuro de Natividad es de incrementar sus cabezas de ganado para que aumentaran su capital de trabajo. 
Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una de las socias más puntuales en la devolución de sus pagos en su banco comunal y con este préstamo renueva su compromiso de responsabilidad. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semilla para sembrar alfalfa, con la que asegurará el alimento de sus vacas.

loans.use: Compra de semilla y abono

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita E. is from the village of Baliangao, Calamba,  Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Angelita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Angelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 4500 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Angelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jesus Lives Group

texts.en:
Eric is a 34-year-old married father of two children who are currently in school. Eric is a petty trader who sells foodstuffs like spices, vegetables, canned tomato paste, cocoa drink, etc. He gets his supplies from Accra and his vegetables from surrounding villages. He requests a loan to buy stock in bulk. He dreams of building his own house and to educate his children to the university level.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Jesus Lives’. He is the one in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like spices, vegetables, canned tomato paste, cocoa drink, etc.

loans.name: Fabrice

texts.en:
Fabrice is 26 years old, single, and he lives in the western province of Rwanda which is approximately three hours' drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. It is here that Fabrice operates his shop selling a variety of goods in his community. His shop has only been open since 2008 but it is doing well for a new business. A hard worker, trying to ensure his success, Fabrice starts his work day at 5 AM and finishes at 9 PM, every day except Sunday.

Fabrice is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his shop through purchasing some additional goods and inventory for sale. Fabrice hopes that with the additional goods, he will attract more customers to his shop, as there seems to be demand for these items he plans to purchase. If successful, Fabrice will reinvest any profits from this strategy into his business which he is trying build stronger in order to build a more secure future for himself and the family he hopes to have (someday!)

loans.use: More variety of goods/inventory for sale

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El señor Ramiro P. F. es una persona grande de edad que desde hace varios años fue pensionado del seguro social, donde percibe cada mes su dinero, aparte sus hijos que viven en Estados unidos lo apoyan económicamente. Ahora el tiene un proyecto en mente, al ver que se viene esta época navideña donde se reúne toda la familia, desea reparar las paredes de la cocina de su casa, por ser un  lugar muy importante por que es donde se hace la cena y conviven todos en armonía. Ramiro esta muy agradecido con esta institución por apoyarle en cada proyecto que tiene; con este préstamo seria el tercero en el cual ha demostrado ser un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Ramiro P. F. is a senior citizen who retired several years ago and receives his social securit pension monthly. In addition, his children that live in the United States help him economically. He has a project in mind. Seeing that the Christmas season, when the entire family gets together, is approaching, he'd like to repair his kitchen's walls because this is a very important space where the dinner is prepared and where everyone mingles together in harmony. Ramiro is very grateful to this institution for helping him with each project he has. This would be his third loan and he has proven to be a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his kitchen walls.

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar M. is 52-year-old farmer who breeds and sells cattle in the central livestock bazaar. He is a retired doctor, but his pension is not even enough to cover basic family needs. Yashar is married and has 3 children. He started animal breeding 15 years ago as an additional source of income but now this business is the main source of income for his family. Yashar applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase more cattle and increase his general income. Yashar thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Medy's Group

texts.en:
Medy L. is from the village of Santos. She is 29 years old. Medy is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI, one of Kiva's field partners. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Medy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Medy plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. Medy has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $66 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Medy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Medy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita D. is a tailor in the village of Thecho. She makes different types of ladies dresses which are very famous among Nepali women, like kurta-sulwal, blouses, etc. Before starting her own shop, she took six months of training for tailoring work. Sarita D. uses her income to help her husband with fulfilling household expenses.

Sarita D. is requesting a 20000.00 Nepalese rupee loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

Mrs. Sarita D. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Rajiv D., is a driver and her son is studying in primary school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A. is from the village of Santo Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 28 years old. Ruth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling Nipa (woven palm leaf) products and she also sells fire wood to local businesses and community members. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ruth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. GDMPC About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nohemí De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Nohemí tiene una pulpería en el departamento de León donde ofertar sus productos tales como granaos básicos, galletas, golosinas, mantequilla y otros. También vende papel higienico, pastas dentales y otros productos de uso personal. 

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido directamente en la compra de granos básicos tales como: azúcar, maíz, trigo, aceite, frijoles, y otros para continuar ofertandolos en su pulpería.  

Cabe mencionar que la señora Nohemí trabaja arduamente en su tramo para darle una mejor forma de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Nohemí has a store front in the León market where she sells her products like basic grains, crackers, candies, butter and other things. She also sells toilet paper, tooth paste and other personal hygiene products. She is currently requesting this loan to invest directly in food stuffs like sugar, corn, wheat, olive oil, beans and other products to be sold at her storefront. Ms. Nohemí works very hard at her job to be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains like rice, corn, beans; cooking oil, sugar, toilet paper, soap, shampoo, Nido brand milk, and others.

loans.name: María Maura

texts.es:
La Señora María Maura A., es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega  se desempeña como operaria de limpieza, Habita en la Colonia Roberto González, es Acompañada tiene 4 hijos  pero solo 2 dependen de ella y están en edad escolar.

La María Maura A., solicito crédito  para reparar su vivienda ya que se acerca el invierno y necesita acondicionarla para que no se le pase el agua.
texts.en:
María works as a cleaning lady in the Chinandega city hall and lives in Colonia Roberto González. She has four children, but only two are school-aged and still depend on her for support. She requested this loan in order to make repairs to her home, now that winter is approaching. She needs to seal it so that it will not leak.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 38-year-old married man who has four children in school. He earns a living by renting out his houses and selling water. Besides these businesses, he is employed and also earns extra income from farming. He has been a member of Faulu Kenya and had previously taken out a loan of KES 20,000, which he used to start his water distribution business. He hopes to open up many other water points in his residential area. He has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to install water for sale in his rental houses. He sees himself having his own borehole to enable him to distribute water more efficiently in the future.

loans.use: To install water for sale.

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Determined and hardworking, M. Shem is vibrant-sounding in terms of his business and agricultural enterprises in Murumba village. He deals in poultry farming, supplying trays of eggs to hotels and shop vendors and also owns a banana plantation. All that generates income for his family.

Shem’s main drawback has been lack of funding to purchase feeds for his poultry and mulches for his plantations which has reduced his yields. Therefore this loan will help him improve his yields in terms of milk, eggs and bananas thus enabling him to meet his customers’ high demand. It will also increase his sales revenue, hence making him more able to meet his family’s requirements in terms of his children’s tuition fees and other needs and enable him to live a more self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feeds and mulches

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha Irene tiene 47 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de gaseosa y comedor.  Martha se dedica a este negocio desde hace 7 años, pues cuando dio inicio no tenía mucho capital, pues siempre busca la manera de generar ingresos para su familia. Pues anteriormente ella se dedicaba a docencia, anteriormente pues no le ajustaba para sufragar los gastos del hogar. Pues siempre había tenido las ideas de tener su propio local que le proporcionara ganancias fijas fue así como obtuvo. Este financiamiento será invertido en la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es tener su propio medio de transporte para comprar sus productos.
texts.en:
Martha Irene is 47 years old. She sells sodas and manages a diner. Martha has been in this business for seven years and had very little capital when she started. She always looks for ways to generate income for her family. Martha previously worked as a teacher, but this job was not enough to cover her household expenses. She always had ideas of opening her own business so that she could obtain a steady source of income.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies. Her wish is to have her own form of transportation so that she can go buy products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Sikoe Ole

texts.en:
Sikoe Ole N. is 35 years old. He is married to Merinyo N., and he is the father of four children.

Sikoe is a farmer. He farms his own piece of land. He has been doing this for the last ten years.

Sikoe learned about KADET through a marketing awareness campaign conducted by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the money to cultivate his eight acres on which he has planted maize and beans. With the proceeds he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to lease additional land for farming in order to increase his maize and beans production.

Sikoe's hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and to have his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To cultivate the eight acres on which he has planted maize and beans

loans.name: Immacule

texts.en:
Immacule is 57 years old, married with three children, and she takes care of four dependents. She lives by selling a variety of goods in her shop and the hours of her business are from 6 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

Although Immacule has been in this business for about eight years, her capital is still too low to earn enough profits. To solve this problem, she would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her shop through adding a variety of foodstuffs including rice, beans, peas, Irish potatoes, etc.

With these additional goods for sale in her shop, Immacule will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business and start saving for her future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of foodstuffs for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es separada y tiene 10 hijos de los cuales 5 viven con ella, desde la fecha de su separación es el único sustento de su hogar, Rosa vende moliente (bebida caliente con semillas de lino con propiedades curativas) de manera ambulatoria en un lugar concurrido, para lo cual cuenta con un carreta que por el uso ya esta deteriorada, por lo que el préstamo que solicita será para la compra de una nueva carreta.
Rosa sueña con construir su casa con material noble porque la que tiene es de  material rustico y brindar una buena educación a los últimos hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is separated and has 10 children, 5 of whom live with her. Since the day of her separation she has been the only breadwinner for the home. Rosa sells moliente (a hot drink with flax seeds, with healing properties) in a crowded street market. For this, she has a cart which has deteriorated from use; so the requested loan is for the purchase of a new cart. Rosa dreams of: building her home out of good material, as the material that she has is rustic; and to offer her youngest children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of a new cart

loans.name: Ikhbol

texts.en:
S. Ikhbol is a happy mother of 3 children. She is 44 years old and she is married.

Ikhbol has been running her own grocery business for the last 5 years. Her wish is to increase her business, offering various types of foodstuffs to her customers who pass through her market. She works with one aim in mind - to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children. Her children are the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts.

With this opportunity and with the immense love Ikhbol feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of $2,000 USD. She will use the loan to increase the range of goods she sells. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Ikhbol.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad B. is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 42 years old. Felicidad is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Felicidad owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felicidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felicidad from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Zussette

texts.en:
Zussette G. is from the village of Salay Angadanan, Isabela. She is 30 years old and single. To make a living, Zussette runs a general store selling both food and daily-use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns 3000 Php monthly.

In 2008, Zussette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI which was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Zussette from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bulgan

texts.en:
Bulgan J. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and four year old son in Hovd province of western Mongolia. She and her family live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her son attends a local kindergarten and her husband works as a teacher in a local school. She has been operating a shoes trading business in the local trade center since 2009. She started her business by selling boots with white soles. Since then her business has expanded and she increased her product line. She provides a variety of shoes to satisfy her customer's needs. She is a very careful and hardworking person who says "It is difficult to get a job in my profession and so I decided to start my own business. In the future, I plan to establish a big shoestore." 

Bulgan is requesting a 3,825,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more shoes, at wholesale prices, from the neighboring province, Uvs, and to build a yard around their ger.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Kelly Natali

texts.es:
Kelly de 28 años, es vendedora de productos Avon (empresa de cosméticos vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras), vive en una zona periurbana caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra en el Fortín de Guayaquil. 

Hace un año comenzó a vender productos por catalogo Avon poco a poco con esfuerzo y la motivación de ser madre soltera pudo surtir su mercadería y hacer esta actividad la parte sostenible de su economía. Vende todo tipo de productos como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y ahora ropa. 

Con el préstamo quiere surtir la mercadería comprando ropa, perfumes y cremas para la venta. En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio y tener su propia boutique.
texts.en:
Kelly is 28 years old and a sales representative of Avon (a cosmetics company that helps women entrepreneurs sell products at a low cost). She lives in a periurban area called Fortín in Guayaquil which is known for its dirt roads.

Kelly started selling Avon products through catalogs a year ago. With a little bit of effort and her motivation as a single mother, she was able to stock up on merchandise and create a financially sustainable business. She sells all types of products including perfumes, crèmes, deodorants, and now clothing.

With this loan, Kelly wants to stock up on merchandise to sell such as clothing, perfumes, and crèmes. In the future, she wants to continue with her business and open her own boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, perfumes, and crèmes

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Battsetseg is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All three kids go to the local secondary school. Mrs. Battsetseg rents a basement room under an apartment block and runs a variety store. She has been running this business for three years. 

In Mongolia, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local residents. Her store is located nearby to her rented basement apartment, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local residents. Her store is in a good location and it is close to all amenities.

Her husband Boldbaatar has a family car and uses it for delivering goods from wholesale points to the store. Their future dream is to have their own family house and to give a proper education to their kids.

The loan they are requesting will be used to replace their old family car with a newer one in better condition.

loans.use: to replace their old family car with a newer one in better condition

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Al empezar una nueva vida como casada Carmen vio la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo en la economía del hogar, ella quería vender algo pero no sabía que cosa, es así que por medio de sus sobrinas a quienes siempre observaba que compraban accesorios como ganchos, correas, vinchas. se le dio la idea de empezar a vender dichos productos, primero los ofrecía a sus conocidos  compraba y vendía toda clase de accesorios para jovencitas, también se las ingeniaba para copiar modelos de catálogos y venderlos mas baratos con mucho trabajo pudo consolidar su negocio ahora cuenta con mucha clientela y gracias a esto ha podido tener algunas comodidades como comprar algunos artefactos que hacían falta en su casa, pero lo que considera mas importante es ayudar en la educación de sus hijos, ahora esta pensando en dedicarse a la confección de ropa para mascotas ya que otras de sus pasiones es el tejido a mano ella confecciona ponchos, chalinas y ropas de baño, hace poco tejió algunas muestras,  un familiar lo llevo a los EEUU  ahora esta recibiendo pedidos es por eso que piensa incursionar en este nuevo negocio para lo que usara el  préstamo que EDAPROSPO le ha otorgado  piensa comprar hilos para dedicarse a este negocio que recién empieza y sabe que tendrá un buen futuro.

*La Sra. Carmen esta en medio de todas.
texts.en:
When starting out as a newlywed, Carmen recognized the need to help her husband financially in order to meet their household expenses.  She wanted to sell something, but wasn’t sure what.  By observing her nieces, who were always buying accessories such as pins, belts and barrettes, she got the idea to start selling these types of products.  She first started selling to her acquaintances, offering all types of accessories for young girls.  She also devised the idea to copy styles out of catalogs, and sell them at lower prices.  With a great deal of hard work, she was able to strengthen her business.  She now has a large customer base, and this has allowed her to buy some items that she needed for her house.  

However, she considers educating her children to be of utmost importance.  She is now thinking about making pet’s clothing, since another passion of hers is knitting.  She makes ponchos, scarves, and swimsuits.  Not long ago she knitted some samples that were taken to the U.S. by a relative, and she is now receiving orders for some of her items.  For this reason, she is thinking about starting this type of new business.  She plans to use the loan from EDAPROSPO to buy thread so she can dedicate herself to this business that she is just starting, and knows she has a bright future ahead.

* Carmen is in the middle of the group.

loans.use: To purchase thread to make pet's clothing.

loans.name: Sabine

texts.en:
Sabine Y. is 38 years old  and a mother to two boys. She is married to Joseph Ojwang,  who repairs watches for a living.  They live in the town of  Migori.

Sabine has a greengrocery that she has been running for nine years. She sells bananas, vegetables, fish, eggs and other goods. She is applying for her fifth loan from Kadet Ltd, where she has established a good credit history. Sabine will use the money to buy more fish, vegetables and crates of eggs to add to her stock. The profits made will be used to support her family's needs.

Her desire is to educate her children up to the university level and to grow her business to great heights.

loans.use: To buy more fish, vegetables and other goods

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en:
Lonh M., 32, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. 

M. is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 6 per day. His wife is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. M. has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 15 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. M. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows to help plow rice field

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more supplies of dishes

loans.name: Tang

texts.en:
Tang E. earns a living by raising pigs behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. Her husband is a firewood seller in Kompong Tom Province. The couple has eight children, six of whom are single and the other two, married. 

One of her children sells products such as fast food, soft drinks, cooking ingredients, and plastic products. She always shares her profits with Tang E..
 
Tang E.’s child is doing well, and she wishes to invest in her selling business. To do that, Tang E. has requested a loan of $1,200 to help her child to buy essential inventory for selling, and also to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: To buy  inventory for her daughter's business and to buy feed for her own pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty K. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced and has 1 child, who attends school. Retsy also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother) and works 6 days out of every week. Resty sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. She also generates additional income through selling pay phone air time and a telephone booth.

Resty has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more newspaper. The main business challenges for Resty include rainy season and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a newspaper agent and also educating her children up to university. Resty lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers

loans.name: Maria Jeanete

texts.es: Maria Jeanete tiene 39 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos y compra y venta de ganado. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado este medio de vida y lo ha obtenido por su familia que le enseño este medio de vida para que pudiera salir adelante con sus 2 hijos que son menores de edad. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de vacas, terneros y ciertos productos como leche, crema, queso y cuajada.
texts.en:
María Jeanete, 39, sells dairy products and is a cattle merchant.  She’s had this business for over two years because she’s always liked this way of life which she got from her family that taught her this way of making a living to get ahead with her two minor children.

The reason for the loan is to buy cows, calves and certain products like milk, cream, cheese and cottage cheese.

loans.use: To buy cows, calves and certain products like milk, cream, cheese and cottage cheese.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe R. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 53 years old and widowed. She had 5 children, but one passed away. Maria Fe struggled but she is determined to sustain her family. She says that, by God's grace, she was able to move on.

Maria Fe is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to her community. Maria Fe works hard for her family. 

Maria Fe joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Maria Fe is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pay for labor.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 36-year-old married man.  He is blessed with three children who go to school.  For a living, he sells shoes.  He has been in the business for almost four years.  He has witnessed a lot of growth in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He also dreams of opening other outlets for his business.  He has requested 30,000 KES to add to his stock of shoes.

loans.use: To add to his stock of shoes

loans.name: Sarana

texts.en:
Sarana A. is a loving mother with a great desire to get ahead in life. Her great spirit, strong will and hard work have allowed her to improve the quality of her life and life of her family.  

Sarana is an internally displaced woman who suffered and lost everything in 1993 during the war. She had to create everything from nothing in a new place and new land. After she was dislocated to Bilasuvar city (her present place of living) she decided to continue the work of her life, which is raising sheep and cattle. 

For the past 30 years, this persevering woman has been working very hard at raising and selling sheep and lambs, and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her beloved daughter, who is her greatest joy. 

Sarana asks for a loan of 1,000 AZN  in order to buy more young sheep to sell later when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en: Eduard M. lives with his wife and two children in Stepanavan. Eduard and his wife are engaged in agriculture and horticulture. Eduard’s sons help their parents. The produce satisfies their family needs; they sell the excess. Eduard has applied for a loan to purchase cattle food.

loans.use: to purchase cattle food

loans.name: Choquinom Group

texts.es:
Doña Isabel P. T., es una persona D. 37 años D. edad, no tuvo a oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 7 hijos y todos estan estudiando, se dedica a oficios domésticos, como también a la agricultura, siembra D. verduras u hortalizas, lleva 5 años D. experiencia con este oficio, inicio sembrando solo una cuerda D. terreno, y actualmente quiere aumentar su producción.

DeciD. entonces, organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que servirá como capital D. trabajo para preparar el terreno para el cultivo y la compra D. semillas y asi aumentar la producción D. verduras, ella cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a la agricultura y una D. ellas se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno. Esperan con la inversión que hacen, aumentar sus ganacias y mejorar su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Isabel P. T., age 37, did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She has seven children, and they all attend school.  She devotes herself to domestic chores and also to farming.  She grows vegetables, and she has five years of experience in this field.  She started planting only one “cuerda” (approximately 70 meters) of land.  She currently wants to increase her production.

Therefore she decided to organize a group to request a loan.  The loan will be used as working capital to prepare the land for cultivation and to buy seeds.  This will increase the vegetable production.  Her husband, a farmer, helps her.

The members of this group devote themselves to farming.  One of them raises cattle.  With the investment they are making they hope to increase their earnings and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and to prepare the land

loans.name: C4913 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Evariste is 45 years old. He is married with three children between the ages  4 and 9 years old. Evariste works hard in order to provide all that is needed for his children. Evariste  is a businessman from 6 am until 9 pm every day. Evariste sells beans, Irish potatoes etc. He is the group representative of the "Tuzamurane" Group, which consists of seven members (three women and four men). Each member has the same  business. 

Evariste and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more Irish potatoes, bananas, sorghum and beans. With this profits, Evariste and his group will be able to reinvest in their business and to save money for their family.

loans.use: To purchase more products like  beans, Irish potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед житель района Кубадиян. Ему 29 лет. Он женат, имеет одного ребенка. У него средне - специальное образование, строитель. Он уже 4 года как занимается строительными работами по найму. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством и садоводством. При доме у него имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи. А также у него имеется сад, где он сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, топлива и семян арбуза.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in the Qubadiyon area. He is 29 years old, married, and has one child. He has a vocational education in construction.  For four years he has been working as a day laborer doing construction.  He also farms. At his house he has a plot of land where he grows vegetables. He also has an orchard where he grows fruit trees. He has been doing this for six years. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer, fuel, and watermelon seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer, fuel, and watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a single woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 5 years, Faith has been operating a beauty salon business.  She works in a shop, providing services to her neighbours and passersby.  The main challenges she faces in her business are high costs of transportation and seasonality.  She dreams of expanding her beauty salon business in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 40,000, Faith wants to purchase hair chemicals, cosmetics, weaves and wigs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase hair chemicals, cosmetics, weaves and wigs

loans.name: Ytamar

texts.es:
Ytamar de 64 años de edad, tiene su casa propia donde vive con su esposo, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Saqa que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

La actividad que desarrolla Ytamar es la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras y chivos), desde hace algunos años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales en la parte posterior de la casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Esto le permite obtener mayores ganacias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias.  

Ytamar solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento para sus animales y mejorar su corral, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para venderlos a un mejor precio. Ytamar  es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque es una persona que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos y trata de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ytamar, 64 years of age, has her own house where she lives with her husband.  The house only has electrical service, and is located in a rural zone in the Saga district of the province of Chiclayo.  These areas dedicate themselves to farming and raising livestock.

Ytamar has carried out the activity of raising and selling goats for some years.  She keeps them behind her house, gives them balanced feed and natural grasses and, once they are the right size and weight, she offers them at the different markets since she has her own customers in the city of Chiclayo.  This allows her to obtain more profits to cover her daily necessities.

Ytama requests a loan of 1500 new Peruvian Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy feed for her animals and improve her corral.  This will allow her to keep her animals well fed to sell them at better prices.  Ytamar is a person who is well known where she lives because she always preoccupies herself with the well being of her family and tries to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy balanced feed and repair her corral.

loans.name: Chhong

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhong is a 31-year-old married woman and mother of four children, who still attend school locally.

She earns money by selling a few fresh fish, which she gets from her husband fishing on the local river, or other local fisherman. She resells the fish in and around her village, the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. On average, she is able to make about $1.50 (U.S. dollars) per day, which helps with the family's expenses. 

She always uses her old bicycle to deliver her fish to sell. Her bicycle is too old and it moves very slowly. She really wants a used motorcycle but she doesn't have sufficient cash to buy one. That is why Mrs. Chhong is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle, which will she will use to transport her fresh fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport her fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Fargana

texts.en: Fargana is a  27-year-old woman who is married with two children. Since her husband is unemployed, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle since 2009. Currently, she has two cows and one cattle. She has land that she cultivates for fattening her cattle. Now Fargana wants to expand her business, and since her children are grown up, she thinks that she will be able to look after more cattle with their help. Therefore, she is asking for 1,000 AZN in order to purchase more animals. Fargana expresses her gratitude for everyone who is supporting her and she promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 42 years old and married. Her two children are 4 and 8 years old. She is a professor at a local university in Cusco. 

Eufemia is asking for a loan in order to invest in her husband's carpentry business. She plans to purchase tools such as levels and saws. She and her husband wish to improve his carpentry business and make it very successful. Eufemia is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Ozyuma

texts.en: She has six children, four of whom are in school. She is a married woman. Ozyuma sells shoes and charcoal. She has been in this business for two years now. She borrowed a loan from BRAC South Sudan with hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit for her business and to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and shoes to sell

loans.name: Luis Hugo

texts.es: El Sr. Luis es casado, tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, el Sr. Luis se dedica a prestar el servicio de mecánica y a su vez alquila una moto taxi; el Sr. Luis tiene deseos de progresar por ello solicitó el crédito para la compra de equipos y herramientas de mecánica y también para dar mantenimiento a su moto taxi; su sueño del Sr. Luis es tener una mejor calidad de vida y tener su propio taller de mecánica automotriz. El  Sr. Luis está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Luis is married and has a 2-year-old daughter. He provides auto mechanic services and also rents out a motorcycle taxi. He wishes to make progress, so he requested the loan in order to purchase auto repair equipment and tools, and also to provide maintenance for his motorcycle taxi. His dream is to have a better quality of life and to own his own auto repair shop. Luis is very thankful for the loan he received.

loans.use: to purchase auto repair equipment and tools.

loans.name: Badmaa

texts.en:
Badmaa is 38 years old and lives with her daugther and husband in a Ger (Mongolian yurt) in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver and his monthly salary is 450,000 MNT. Badmaa operates flour and rice selling business. She buying flour and rice from the factories and selling them at retail prices, since 2003. She is continuously managing the business. She pays 78,000 MNT in rent for the commercial space. Her daily sales income is 150,000 MNT while her monthly profit is between 400,000 MNT to 500,000 MNT. She has gained much business experience and skills in her field. 

She is a diligent and nice woman who says, "I think people learn by doing and making mistakes." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase 185 bags of flour.

loans.use: To purchase 185 bags of flour to sell

loans.name: Abduchabbor

texts.ru: Абдучаббор проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 32 года. Она замужем. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей на рынке. Имеет торговую точку, где продает хозяйственные товары. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 15 лет. Целью получения кредита является приобретение нового товара для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en: Abduchabbor lives in the town of Isfara.  He is 32 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He is involved in sales at the market.  Abduchabbor has a retail outlet, where he sells household goods.  He has been in this business for 15 years.  The goal of obtaining this loan is a purchase of new merchandise to expand assortment.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise and expand goods assortment

loans.name: Evalin

texts.en:
Evalin is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school.  She has a business selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa in Yei county, South Sudan.she has been in this business for three years.

Evalin requested this loan through BRAC in South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”ATIPAY”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Srta. Ingrid; La socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es soltera , la socia estudia derecho en la universidad, la socia también se dedica  a la compra y venta de zapatos, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de zapatos al por mayor para vender a sus colegas en la institución en la cual la socia labora. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de zapatos.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Ingrid, 32, is a member of the “Atipay” communal bank which is located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.  She is single and is studying Law at the university.  She’s also a shoe merchant.  On this occasion she wants to use the loan to buy shoes at wholesale to sell to her coworkers at the firm where she’s employed.  She’s requesting the loan to buy shoes.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is married with one child who is three years old. Her husband works at a storage warehouse. She sells used clothes in a store that she has been running for seven years. She would like a loan in order to increase her inventory of clothes. 

Vestine will use the profits to support her family and reinvest in her business. Her dream for her business is to have a prosperous clothing store with many choices for her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Nkuyata

texts.en:
Nkuyata has been farming in Narok for the last seven years. He is 32 years old, single and supports his parents.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer and be rich.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alegría lo conforman  tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Rosa quien desde hace 13 años vende comida y refrescos. Ella inicio el negocio con la venta de repocheta y tacos y luego fue aumentándolo.
El crédito lo invertirá en materia prima (granos básicos, carne, tomate y repollo)
La otras integrantes son Nora del socorro quien se dedica al destace de cerdo y venta de nacatamales, chicharrón y frito, y Carolina tiene una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
The “Alegria” (Happiness) Group is made up of 3 hard-working and enterprising women. One member is Rosa who for nearly 13 years, has sold meals and soft drinks. She began her business selling 'repocheta' (Nicaraguan appetizers similar to quesadillas) and tacos, then later, expanded her offerings.

The loan will be invested in primary goods (basic grains, meat, tomatoes, and cabbage). The other members of the group are Nora del Socorro who butchers hogs and sells 'nacatamales' (maiz, meat, and rice wrapped in banana leaf), fried pork skins, and fried potato chips; and Carolina who has a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, tomatoes and cabbage for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Martires is the coordinator of her group, Cristo es la esperanza 1 & 2 (Christ is the hope). All the members of this group are Haitians and they are located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to recover the payment when she gives credit to her clients.

Martires is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around 16 years, starting with a small amount of capital that she saved. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy some sugar, rice, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, plantain, flour, etc. She operates a Colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally those colmados are in the same neighborhood, just a short walk from any home. With her business profits she has been improving her business

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, plantain, flour, etc

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been operating a butchery shop for the last four years and earns a monthly profit of KES. 9,900. He 49 years old, married to Elena, and they have two children who are over 18 years.

He has applied for his third loan of   KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan amount to renovate and paint the butchery and also buy goat meat for sale.

He will save some of the anticipated profits and provide basic needs for his family. Joseph hopes to grow his business and ensure that he can sell about 50kg of meat per day.

loans.use: to renovate and paint the butchery and also buy goat meat for sale.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi 28, is a married man with two children, ages four years and one year old. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Saidi has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. He dreams of accessing more loans to boost his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase coffee for making tea and wheat flour for making Chapati(flat bread). He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase coffee for making tea and wheat flour for making Chapati(flat bread).

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en: Muniratu operates a chop bar (a place where people come to eat diffent kinds of food) at Ayensudo near Elmina. Behind Muniratu in the photo are sacks of maize she uses in preparing the food. She cooks food like banku, fufu, rice balls and other items. She is married and has four children. She wants to expand her business. A loan from Kiva will be invested into the cooking business (buying ingredients) for further expansion.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Dulamdorj

texts.en:
Dulamdorj is a 47-year-old woman who has three children, age 13 to 24, and lives with her family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, without basic infrastructure. Her two daughters attend local high school while her son and his spouse work as a machinist and a builder. 

Since 1995, she has been operating a clothing sales business in the second largest outdoor market of Mongolia. She a sells wide range of clothes imported from Beijing and Ereen, a border city of China, where she travels once or twice in a month. 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell for the upcoming season in order to increase her current working capital.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte produces charcoal for sale at Asebu Ekroful. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a trader. 

Charlotte has been selling charcoal for six years. She will use her loan to purchase more firewood for the production of her charcoal to sell. 

She hopes to use the new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood for the production of her charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Joy Ii Group

texts.en:
Musa is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. (Also pictured to the right of the photo is loan officer Edward, who is posing with the borrowers.) To earn a living, he sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloths).

With the help of this loan, he and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. He plans on using his share of the loan proceeds (800,000 SLL) to buy gara lapper-making materials, such as ink, caustic soda, powder, and white cotton cloths in order to produce a larger quantity of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing additional materials

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg 5F Group

texts.en:
Jamuna, standing right in the photo, hails from Koraput district, Odisha. She is currently working at a local factory near her home and bring home an average income of 3,000 INR per month. She has found that her current income, from which she also save diligently, is not enough to provide a quality life for her family and children, let alone cover costs for her daily needs.

Determined to provide for a better life for her children, Jamuna and group decided to seek a loan to start their own micro-enterprise. Jamuna, along with Suryamani seeks a loan of 36,000 INR for the group, from which Jamuna's loan will assist her to buy raw materials and seek training. Jamuna will start her business while continuing her work at the factory allowing her to repay the loan smoothly. Your loan will enable Jamuna to start a garment business. Your loan will empower these women to provide a better life for themselves and their families. Your loan will support not only these women, but also their families, to continue to stay determined and fight for a better tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk to resell

loans.name: Oelbosen Tubuhue Group

texts.en:
Oelbosen is a group 5 women and led by Maria (who is standing in the middle) a 45 year old woman. All members are neighbor who live close to one another. All of them have run businesses such as: selling cakes, kiosk, and mostly are doing weaving.

Maria is married to Alosius a 55 year old man who works as farmer. They have been blessed with 5 children. Maria is a weaver and she generates additional income from running that business. In order to increase the amount of woven cloth that she is selling, and also to expand the business of her friends, Maria and  her friends formed this group and requested a loan from TLM totaling IDR 8.750.000. This loan would help Maria to pay for more stocks of yarn in various color based costumers' requests.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of yarn in various color because there are many request from her costumers

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. Khalid is 29 years old. He married and has 2 children. He is the only breadwinner in family. He has an ability to buy the best perfumery. He is very polite with all his clients. Khalid decided to apply for a loan $300 in order to busy with retail trade. 
He applies for the loan $600 to open his own perfumery and to increase the range of goods.

loans.use: To open his own perfumery and to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy increase her stock of African attire

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: M. Bayram  is a very young and energetic person. He is 20 and recently got married. Before he got married, he purchased a cow, but now his family consists of two persons. He applied for a loan for $1200 for one cow and one calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung B. T. is a 54 year old widow living in Kampong Cham Province with her 4 children.  She works selling Khmer noodles to local villagers, and also raises pigs to eventually sell to the market.  Through these businesses she makes about $1.5 per day on average.  Her children work as translators and hair-dressers, and they each earn around $5 per day.  This loan will be used to purchase more pigs to raise, a business that Mrs. Kung B. T. is comfortable with and would like to expand.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Mirjamal

texts.en: Mr. Mirjamal is a low income vulnerable person. He is 49, married with five children, and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in  the Caucasus region. 20 years ago he started his butchery business and has run it very successfully since then.  His children are growing up and Mirjamal can hardly meet his family’s food and important consumption needs. He has to buy more animals to sell more beef and earn more money. Therefore, he finally applied for  a $500 loan with the Normicro Saatli branch. Now he is waiting for funding so that he can make some improvements to his business.

loans.use: To expand the volume of business

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Mrs. Beauty A. is 55 years old, a widow with 6 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells shoes, bags and creams. She learned her business for a year and then opened on her own in 1973. She is requesting for a $400 loan to enable her to buy more shoes, bags and creams for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, bags and creams for sale

loans.name: Tafagamanu

texts.en: Tafagamanu is a hard-working woman of 40 years of age. She does hard labour on the farm that supports her family. She has five children. She repays her debt well and is always trying to improve her small business. She is an upstanding client and she could be an asset to the local economy.

loans.use: To buy a lawnmower and pesticides

loans.name: Kamuli A4 (I) Group

texts.en:
Eva is a 45 year old widow with two children. She has a brick laying business. With the extra profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children and start up a poultry business. Jalia and Faith have a canteen business and want to increase their stock with the loan. Jane has a beauty salon while Annet sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Kadiba Central D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joyce N.. She is currently in the business of selling sugar and is requesting a loan to boost business. Joyce is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a shop attendant. She has 2 children aged 5 and 10 and both go to school. Each week, Joyce makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to to support her children and sustain herself. Joyce has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Joyce is joined in her small group by Leya K., Jennifer K. and Jalia N.. Leya K. has a business selling new shoes and wants to purchase more shoes for sale. Jennifer K. is currently operating a local brewing business and wants a loan to expand business. Jalia N. operates a grocery store business and wants to add more capital.

loans.use: To add to sugar business

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
This is Edith, an enterprising young woman of 22. At her young age she is responsible for an ice cream parlour, a family business established by her parents many years ago. With this business they were able to educate their dear children, who are now on the verge of becoming professionals. Edith is the youngest of 5 brothers and sisters. Her parents, on seeing her interest and how responsible she was, decided to leave her in charge of the family business.

She is making a go of the business with hard work and dedication and enjoying the fruits of what her parents started.
