This enterprising and exemplary young woman offered work to 2 of her cousins, who make a perfect team for this business. They all work daily from 8:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night. They would like to turn this ice cream parlour into one of the biggest distributors in the city of Juliaca. With this goal, they try hard to give the best of themselves, seeing an opportunity in the market demand. Edith now finds that she needs to buy another ice cream blender and for this, she turns to you. Your important support will help this young, enterprising young woman solidify her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ella es Edith, joven emprendedora de 22 años. A su corta edad es responsable de la heladería, negocio familiar que establecieron sus padres desde hace ya varios años, con esta labor es que lograron educar a sus queridos hijos que ahora se encuentran a puertas de ser profesionales.Edith es la menor de 5 hermanos, sus padres al ver el interés y responsabilidad que ponía en su actividad decidieron dejarle el negocio familiar.

Actualmente con mucho empeño y dedicación viene sacando adelante y disfrutando las cosechas que un día sus padres sembraron; ésta emprendedora y ejemplar muchacha ofrece trabajo a 2 de sus primos, quienes forman un equipo perfecto para este negocio, todos trabajan diariamente desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche, desean convertir esta heladería en una de las distribuidoras más grandes de la ciudad de Juliaca, con ese fin se esfuerzan y ponen lo mejor de sí, en esta oportunidad viendo la demanda del mercado Edith se ve en la necesidad de comprar otra licuadora para helados, con ese propósito recurre a ti.Tu importante aporte permitirá concretar los sueños de ésta joven emprendedora.

loans.use: Buy a blender for making ice cream.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
Mamlakat R. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 46 years old. Her husband has passed away and she is left with five children. She is a housewife and also sells milk. She has a milking cow which brings about 10 liters of milk. She also buys milk from the neighbors at a lower price and then takes to Dushanbe where she resells it wholesale. Mamkalat wants to buy another milk cow which will bring another 10 liters. It will help increase her income which the family needs so much. For this she needs a loan and with pay it off within 12 months. In spite of the harsh conditions, she is very happy and does not lose hope.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахимова Мамлакат жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 46 лет . Муж умер и у нее осталось 5 детей. Домохозяйка, занимается продажей молока. Имеет корову, которая дает около 10 литров молока, а так же скупает у соседей по более низкой цене и вывозит молоко в город Душанбе. Продаетоптом и возвращается домой. Сейчас хочет купить еще одну корову . которая даст возможность получать дополнительные 10 литров. Это поможет ей увеличить доход, который необходим для семьи. Для этого ей необходимо получить кредит, а погасить его она сможет в течении 12 месяцев. Не смотря на тяжелые условия , она очень жизнерадостна и никогда не унывает.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
Señora Claudina belongs to the Communal Bank of Women with a Future, located at Asentamiento Humano, Pedro Portillo Mz. M Lt. 13, of the Yarina Cocha District in the Ucayali Department. She is 49 years old, and is a single mother of 5 children. The income that she has do not meet the family needs, and therefore Claudina decided to invest her first loan from Manuela Ramos in the sale of local fruits.

Now she gets up very early in order to go sell fruits in the door of her house, and there is a lot of demand in her area. With the help of her children they get the household tasks done. Some of her children are independent but they are always asking her for support.

With this loan of S/. 1,700, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy fruits like: papaya, plantains, coconuts, mandarins, oranges, corn, etc. Claudina feels that to work with this communal bank is a great help for all the working women like herself.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Claudina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano. Pedro Portillo Mz. M Lt. 13, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años, es madre de 5 hijos, es separada, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Claudina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de frutas regionales. En la actualidad ella se levanta muy temprano para salir a vender sus frutas en la puerta de su casa, ya que tienen mucha demanda en nuestra región, con la ayuda de sus hijos realizan los que haceres domésticos, algunos ya son independientes pero siempre están pendientes de ella. Con este préstamo de S/.1, 700 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará frutas como: papayas, plátanos, coconas, mandarina, naranjas, maíz, etc. Claudina siente que trabajar con su banco comunal es un apoyo mas para todas las mujeres trabajadoras como ella.

loans.use: With this loan Claudina will buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nueva Ilusion Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank Nueva Ilusión is a new bank that just began with 18 members, who after weeks of working and learning are beginning to be very happy. Many of them were invited by members of other big Village Banks.

The members have different businesses such as the sale of clothing, artisan work, vegetables, groceries, construction materials, candy and sweets, cereals, food, cosmetics, and the agriculture of vegetables.

Each member has a different history – such as Raquel who lives in the community of Totorilla. With her family she is committed to agriculture and growing vegetables which she sells in the Nery Garcia market – and she uses the income from these sales to pay for her studies. Another bank member, Lucia, sells sweets at the door of the San Ramon school. She says that at first they would push her away, but because of her consistency she has now established her place there.

The members need varying loan amounts totaling 8,400 soles. The loans will be invested in the purchase of shirts, sweaters, sugar, rice, meat, wheat, barley, cookies, candies, cosmetics, seeds and abono (fertilizer).

The dreams of the women are that their businesses are prosperous and their children become professional and that they one day own their own homes.

loans.use: To buy shirts, sweaters, sugar, rice, meat, wheat, barley, cookies, candies, cosmetics, seeds and abono.

loans.name: Leyda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Leyda is 21 years old and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is married and has a young daughter who attends pre school. Her husband's work helps cover their household expenses. Leyda works selling cosmetics from her house, as well as door to door. She's been working in this business for 5 years, starting it on her own.

With the loan she is requesting, she would like to invest in her business by purchasing a variety of cosmetics to help her expand her customer base, increase her income and be able to pay for an education for her daughter.

Leyda tiene 21 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, es casada y tiene una niña en preescolar, su esposo es comerciante y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Leyda se dedica a la venta de cosmétcios en su casa de habitación y también ambulante, tiene cinco años de experiencias, inició con esfuerzos propios. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para invertir más en el negocio y así captar más clientes, comprará variedad de cosméticos. Para un futuro quiere diversificar sus productos y obtener mejores ingresos, y educar a su hija.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER COSMETICS BUSINESS, INCREASE HER CUSTOMER BASE AND INCOME, AND BE ABLE TO PROVIDE  A GOOD EDUCATION FOR HER DAUGHTER.

loans.name: Mrs. Duch Thoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-one members founded a Village Bank which is located in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Duch T. was born in 1971.  She has three children who are all attending school; they are 14, 10 and 8 years old.  Mrs. Duch T. and her husband, Mr. Keo Ra, are fishermen. They gather fish in the local lake but they now do not have enough fishing equipment.  Therefore Mrs. Duch T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fish nets in order to gather fish.

loans.use: To buy fish nets in order to gather fish.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Бобоев Музафар житель Вахшского района. Занимается бизнесом. Имеет мясную лавку на центральном  рынке.Скупает молодых , здоровых бычков и реализует мясом. Хочет получить кредит , чтобы увеличить товарооборот , путем покупки молодого бычка. Это поможет ему заработать больше в сезон свадеб. Погасить кредит планнирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muzaffar B. lives in Vakhsh. He works in business. He has a butcher's shop in the central market. He buys young, healthy calves and turns them into meat. He wants to take out a loan to increase sales by buying a calf. This will help him earn more in the wedding season. He plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.es:
Emmanuel G. C. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Emmanuel G. C. quiere poner techo de concreto en su casa y piso firme como pueden ver la construcción aun no esta terminada. El tiene dos hijos por los cuales piensa darles un hogar y su espacio. Emmanuel vive en la casa de su mama pero el cree que es necesario hacer su propio patrimonio para darle a sus hijos y una casa a su esposa. Solicita la cantidad $975 dólares.

El señor G. trabaja en fabrica y su esposa de secretaria en una oficina con estos ingresos el podría pagar el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Emmanuel G. C. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Emmanuel G. C. wants to put a concrete roof on in his house and a solid floor. As you can see, the construction is still not finished. He has two children for whom he wants to give a home and space. Emmanuel lives in the house of his mother, but he believes that it is necessary to build his own inheritance to give to his children and a house for his wife. He requests the amount of 975 dollars.

Señor G. works in a factory and his wife is a secretary in an office. With these incomes they would be able to pay the loan offered.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a concrete roof and solid floor on his house.

loans.name: Laing

texts.en: Mrs. Laing L., 29, is a farmer who has worked on the land with her husband, Mr. Chomroeun Leyfor, the last 14 years. They live in Koktlokler Commune in Siem Reap Province and have two children, both of whom help out on the farm.  Mrs. Laing is applying for a $600 loan to buy oxen to help her plow her land and increase the size of her rice crop.

loans.use: To purchase oxen

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Simorn S., 48, is a widow with three children: two sons and a daughter. One of them is married and lives outside the family house and the other two children study in a local school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Simorn has been selling vegetables and chickens for one year. She bought them from her fellow villagers for sale at Ta Khmao market. She is requesting a loan of US$1200 to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables and chickens for sale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and chicken for sale.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong S. is a group leader joined by three members. She identified three eligible members and requested the loan from Kiva. S. is 50 years old and makes Khmer traditional baskets to sell. She has been in the business since 1998 and earns around $2 per day. She is widowed and cares for one elderly mother. Her business is going well and has a lot of clients who buy her products. She has one child whom she supports and pays the school's fee. Now, S. lacks money to repair her house's ladder. Hence, she would like to request a loan.

The other two members are: Chean C., 37, a widowed Khmer traditional basket maker. She needs a loan for making more baskets to sell. Luot L., 36, is a widowed fish seller. She needs a loan to purchase more fish to sell. All of these borrowers live in Boeung Village in the Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: to repair her house's ladder, so she can continue to make her baskets.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan M., 35, the married mother of three children, two of whom are students and one a preschooler, lives with her husband in Bati District, Takeo Province. Since 2001, she has been working as a professional tailor, earning about $2 each day, while her husband sells a variety of vegetables in a busy market, earning about $5 a day.

Chan is requesting a loan of $500 to increase the number of vegetables her husband sells in the market.

loans.use: To increase the number of vegetables her husband sells.

loans.name: Jeannette Akuwa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, madame Jeannette Akuwa D. est née à Kpalimé au Togo et est agée de 35 ans. Elle vit actuellement à Aného avec son époux et ses deux enfants. Commerçante de charbons de bois depuis cinq ans (05), elle a actuellement des difficultés pour trouver des fonds nécessaires afin de relancer son activité. Son atout principal est qu’elle maîtrise très bien son activité. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s'approvisionner en gros. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter son bénéfice et faire face à l’éducation de ces enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Jeannette Akuwa D. was born in Kpalimé in Togo and is 35 years old. She married, the mother of two, and currently lives in Aného with her spouse and two children. A charcoal merchant for five years, she presently has difficulty finding the funds necessary for revitalizing her business. Her main advantage is that she has quite the mastery of her work. She is requesting this loan for supplies in bulk, which will enable her to increase her profit and to address the education of these children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth P. grows rice in her farm. She is 42 years old and has 7 children. She has been a CEVI client for 2 years now. She owns and tills 7-hectare of land which she uses to feed and clothe her family. She dreamed of having all her children to college so that, when they are older, they will get better jobs to support their future family. CEVI helps her sustains her business more.

She is asking a loan of Php 9,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. The loan will truly help her improve her yield. In this way, she can offer better support for the whole family. She is also interested in looking for some other line of business to augment their income still more. CEVI helps people start up and run their own business. Through CEVI, more and more people are able to access easy credit to support their businesses. CEVI also gives their clients training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana vive en casa propia con su esposo e hija en la calle Manuel Jofre de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, el esposo trabaja con un minibus de su propiedad, ella se dedica a la costura de enaguas (ropa interior de mujer) las cuales las acomoda cada semana en la calle Garita de Lima, lugar comercial donde se vende todo tipo de prendas de vestir de gente de pollera.

El crédito que solicita es para reparar su movilidad y que su esposo siga trabajando y le ayude con los gastos de la casa.

No es cliente de Impro pero por la actividad y el flujo de caja la califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own home with her husband and daughter on Manuel Jofre street in the Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz. Her husband drives a minibus that he owns, and she makes a living sewing women's underwear, which she displays every week on Garita de Lima street, a commercial center where all kinds of clothing items are sold. The loan she is requesting will be used to repair the minibus so her husband can keep working and help with household expenses. She is not a client of Kiva partner Impro but her business activity and capital flow qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain and repair a minibus owned by her and her husband so he can keep working transporting passengers

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 34 years old and married with three children. She has a salon where she makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions and cream to her customers.

Tina hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Kele Amia Grace Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Grace A. is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She has three boys and one girl and also cares for four orphans. All the children are in school.

Grace has been selling beans for over seven years. She will use this loan to purchase beans in bulk. She is active and her dream is to construct a house and educate her kids.

loans.use: To purchase beans in bulk.

loans.name: Suzana Muchanga

texts.pt:
Susana Muchanga M. é natural de Gaza uma das províncias do sul de Moçambique, tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos, sendo primeiro com 25 anos de idade e o segundo com 21 anos de idade, ambos não estudam.

Susana estudou até 4ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, em 1980 mudou se da província de Gaza para Maputo na companhia dos pais devido que o pai trabalhava na cidade de Maputo, em 1981 casou se em 1997 inicia actividade comercial qual desenvolve até data hoje.

Susana solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez e pretende aumentar o seu volume de negocio, actualmente tem um rendimento mensal de 20000,00mt a 25000,00mt e consegue poupar algum. Diz ela que apenas procura manter o seu nível económico e social dado que se sente estável e luta por apoiar os seus filhos.
texts.en:
Susana Muchanga M. is a native of Gaza, one of the provinces in the south of Mozambique. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. The first is 25 years old, and the second is 21 years old. Neither one is in school. Susana went to school until the 4th grade and stopped because of poor conditions. In 1980 she moved from the province of Gaza to Maputo in the company of her parents because her father worked in the city of Maputo. In 1981 she got married, and in 1997 she began her commercial activities which have developed until today. Susana is soliciting a loan through Hluvuku and Kiva for the first time, and she intends to increase the volume of her business. She currently has monthly earnings of 20,000MT to 25,000MT, and she is able to save a little. She says that she is only looking to maintain her economic and social level given that she feels stable and is trying to support her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha M. is currently in the business of selling paste and maize flour and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Asha is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has seven children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Serapio

texts.en:
Serapio, who is now a widower, is engaged in a hog-raising business. He is requesting a second loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 for the maintenance of his business. He is 53 years old and lives with his adopted son in the peaceful village of Binarzang, Quirino, Isabela. 

Serapio claims that his adopted child is his main source of inspiration to work harder and become progressive in his business since his three children already have their own families and live separately and far from him.

According to Serapio, his previous loan has been of big help, not only in maintaining his hog-raising business, but also in providing for their daily needs and the allowances of his adopted son. Serapio hopes that his business will survive and continuously be maintained so that he is able to have a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Omolabake

texts.en: Omolabake sells hair extensions and she is also a stylist. She is 46 years old and married with four children. Omolabake lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business for the past 23 years. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. She has been faithful to LAPO in her repayments. Omolabake is hoping for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty sells foodstuffs and sachet water (water in plastic bags). She has been in the business for the past six years and she has been with LAPO for the past two years. Betty is 47 years old and is married with a child.

Betty is very happy with LAPO-Kiva for the financial assistance rendered to her. She is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
K. Mahbuba is 44 years old. She is married, and uses all the money she makes to care for her three children and provide for their education. Mahbuba has an experience of 10 years preparing and selling dried apricots. She always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today Mahbuba requests 3000 Somoni for purchasing apricots with the purpose of drying and processing them in order increase the range of her selling goods. Mahbuba expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the apricots in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en: Born in 1989, Kanan is an unmarried young man who lives in Baku in the Surakhani region. For two years he has been building houses. He is applying now for a loan of 2000 AZN to buy those items necessary to upgrade his trade and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy items necessary to upgrade his trade

loans.name: Mamyata

texts.en:
Mamyata J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to increase her stock.  Mamyata is 43-years-old and is married to a policeman. She has six children, all of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.  BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo Ángel, de 31 años, y con sus 2 hijos, en su modesta vivienda ubicada en un balneario al norte de Lima. Hace 8 años tiene una tienda de productos comestibles, al principio sólo ayudaba a su suegra, pues el negocio era de ella. Pero después de un tiempo, como la señora ya no podía atender su tienda debido a su avanzada edad, Marleni decidió tomar la posta. A ella le gusta mucho atender su tienda, ya que es su propia jefa en el negocio y lo considera rentable por la variedad de comestibles que puede ofrecer a su clientela. Su principal dificultad es en el momento que debe ir a comprar más mercadería, ya que debe cerrar porque no hay otra persona quien se quede. Para el futuro piensa incrementar los productos su tienda para poder satisfacer las múltiples necesidades de sus clientes. 
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y sabe que debe ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que los miembros de su banco comunal lo son y no piensa defraudarlos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de más mercadería para mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina S. is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Sina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Sina has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately $550 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Sina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sina has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  Sina is now requesting a new loan of $1500 WST which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Sina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

Sina is not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09. 

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, salt, maize flour and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Leticia Dennise

texts.es: La señora Leticia es una cliente nueva en la institución, es hermana de una cliente que trabaja en Banco de emprendimiento. La señora Leticia se dedica principalmente a la reparación de celulares y también a la venta de accesorios para celulares desde hace dos años. Su esposo, el señor Freddy, es empleado en una fábrica de textiles que queda en la zona de Villa Fátima. Ellos tienen dos pequeños hijos a los cuales crían con mucho cariño y dedicación. Viven en una casa de alquiler en  la Avenida Cuidad del Niño de la zona de Pampahasi. La señora Leticia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vitrina nueva, y otros accesorios para celulares. Uno de los principales anhelos de la señora Leticia es poder ampliar su negocio y así con el tiempo poder ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs Leticia is a new client to the institution, she is the sister of a client who works at the Bank of entrepreneurship. For two years doña Leticia has been repairing and selling accessories for mobile phones for a living. Her husband, don Freddy, is an employee at the textile mill in the area of Villa Fátima. They have two young children who they care for with love and dedication. They live in a rented house in Avenida Ciudad del Niño, in the area of Pampahasi. Mrs. Leticia requests the loan to buy a new showcase and other accessories for the cell phones. One of her main goals is to be able to expand her business and with time be able to save enough to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of showcase, chargers, batteries, frames, and flash memories

loans.name: Lyna

texts.en:
Lyna D. is from the village of Mitan-ag Bonifacio Misamis Occ. She is 32 years old. Lyna is married and has 3 infant children.

To make a living, Lyna makes and sells rice cakes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lyna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month..

In 2007, Lyna joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lyna successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lyna is requesting her second loan, for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients.

She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 38 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia.
Desde hace un año tiene un taller que implementó en su vivienda, donde realiza todo tipo de trabajos de carpintería metálica. Cada día, él tiene varios clientes que le hacen pedidos, y Roberto cumple con mucha responsabilidad, aunque tenga que sacrificar horas de sueño para ello. Es por ello que sus clientes retornan en busca de sus servicios y lo recomiendan con otras personas.
Por el momento, Roberto sólo cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, pero sus planes son de mejorar su taller comprando más herramientas, y posteriormente contratar a otras personas para incrementar la producción.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy contento de acceder a este préstamo, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus trabajos en cerrajería; tales como fierros y electrodos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own home. For the past year, he has had a workshop that he set up in his home where he does all kinds of metalwork jobs. Every day, he attends to various customers who place orders with him. Although he has to sacrifice many hours of sleep, Roberto carries out these jobs with a great sense of responsibility. For that reason, his customers return to do business with him and recommend him to other people Presently, Roberto only has support from his wife, but he plans to improve his workshop by buying more tools and later by hiring more people to increase production. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very happy to receive this loan, and he promises to be on time with his payments. He will use the money that he has asked for to buy materials for his work in locksmithing, such as tools and electrodes.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Morry

texts.en:
Morry L. S., 43, is a mother who cares greatly for her family. Married to Ramon S., a driver and a coconut vendor, they are blessed with four children. She helps her husband earn their income so that their family can have a better life.  She and Ramon have been selling coconuts for 11 years.

Morry has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than five years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow several times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used all the money she borrowed to buy more coconuts for her business. Her business lets her earn a profit PHP 8,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital in expanding her business by buying more coconuts.

She dreams that her business will grow so that they will have enough finances for their children's schooling. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of coconuts.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida B., 40, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Emilio B., a coconut vendor, she is blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Both of them have been selling coconuts as their business for seven years.

Nida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 12 times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to buy more coconuts from wholesalers. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 5,600 per month.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 17,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, allowing her to buy more coconuts, seasoning and sugar.

She dreams that her business will eventually make her a coconut wholesaler someday so that they can earn more for their family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more coconuts, seasoning and sugar

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio Ampontas, Jr. is from the village of  Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 59 years old. Dionesio has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Dionesio provides "trisikad" transportation services to local community members. A trisikad is a bicycle attached to a passenger coach. It is used to transport passengers in the village. Dionesio has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Dionesio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesio is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand his business. This will be Dionesio's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Jilda Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Jilda es asistente de relaciones públicas de la Alcaldía, un día de trabajo para ella es de movilizarse en los diferentes lugares de león para obtener información.

El crédito que ha solicitado es para la realización de exámenes médicos la cual era de gran importancia.

 Cabe mencionar que este es su segundo crédito con nuestra institución, el primero fue para mejoras de vivienda ya que fue de gran ayuda para tener mejores condiciones en su hogar para su familia.
texts.en:
Jilda is a public relations assistant for City Hall. A typical work day for her involves going to various places in León to gather information. She will use the loan to pay for some medical exams that are of great importance. It is worth mentioning that this is her second loan with our institution. The first one was for home improvements and it was a great help to her to be able to improve her family's home conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For medical expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic footwear

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia N. is single and has received senior high education. Afia bakes bread and sells fried fish at Jukwa. Afia, at the time of our visit, had already dispatched the bread she had baked to her sellers and is shown standing by her fish to sell. She uses her income to pay for her rent and other expenses. Afia will add the loan to her initial capital to purchase bags of flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake, and boxes of fish to fry for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, she plans to save to build a house of her own.

loans.use: Afia will add the loan to her initial capital to purchase bags of flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake, and boxes of fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: A-Z Group

texts.en:
Baccus T. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called A-Z. He is 25 years old, single and has a 4 year old child. He also cares for two brothers. He is a high school graduate. Baccus is running a mini cinema business at EDD field in the New Georgia community, Monrovia, Liberia. He has been doing this business for four years. He started with 10,000 Liberia dollars as a working capital that he had saved from working .
He approaches his customers in a nice manner and has got a lot of new movies to attract them.

Baccus plans to use his 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 44,000.00 Liberian dollar group loan to buy a satellite dish, petroleum products for his power generator and more video discs. His goal is to build a new cinema and to import new video discs to improve his business, to educate his child and to build a house for his family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Baccus is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy a satellite dish, petroleum products for his power generator and more video discs.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar de 30 años de edad habita en la comaca El Jicaro de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Damaris Figueroa, y sus 3 hijos menores de edad, los cuales estudian primaria en la comarca. Julio desarrolla la actividad ganadera desde hace 10 años, logrando tener su propio inventario ganadero, ademas se dedica a la  venta de productos lacteos, comercialización de la producción de granos básico y venta de semoviente durante el año donde obtiene ingresos que le permiten el sosten familiar.  

Esta solicitando su 1er crédito para realizar la construción de una galera y corral, de esta menera desarrollar un ordeño limpio en condiciones de higiene, para vender un producto limpio y saludable para los consumidores. 

Su mayor sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su finca, así  brindar mejores condiciones del manejo de su hato gandero, pues con esta mejora su finca seria de mayor valor y a su familia le dejaria un buen patrimonio cuando el falte.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 30 and lives in the town of El Jicaro de Nueva Guinea with his wife Damaris Figueroa, and their 3 children who study in primary school. Julio has worked raising cattle for the past ten years, and maintains a prosperous herd. He also sells milk products, basic grains and other agricultural products which allows him to sustain his family. Julio seeks his first microcredit loan to constuct a cattle pen and corral, in order to develop a milking station with adequate hygienic conditions for the production of clean and healthy products. His goal is to improve his production infrastructure to add value to his farm and expand his family's economic assets.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of cattle pens and corral

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of hair dryers and other equipment for hairdressing

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose U. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock maize flour and dried fish as well. Rose is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has two children and one of her children goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house that she can rent out. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock maize flour and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Prisca

texts.es:
La socia Prisca, tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijos y es natural de Ccatca provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es fabricar tejas de arcilla con la ayuda de su esposo. Ellos empiezan a trabajar a las 3 de la mañana hasta las 12 de la tarde todos los días. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y les va muy bien. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ramas de árboles que traen de las ciudades de Huancarani y de Urcos que utilizan para quemar, y así de esa forma hacen secar las tejas.

Ellos venden las tejas en su domicilio a la personas que vienen de las ciudades Abancay, Calca y Urubamba. Su actividad económica complementaria es llevar productos como por ejemplo papa, chuño, carne y habas a la ciudad de Huancarni donde vende, otra de sus actividades es administrar una pequeña tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad com o por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.

Prisca se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member Prisca is 34 years old. She has two children and is from Ccatca province of Quispicanchis, of the department Cuzco. Her main economic activity is making clay roof tiles with her husband's help. They start working at 3 in the morning and continue until 12 in the afternoon every day. They have had this business for 15 years and it is going well for them. She needs the loan to buy tree branches brought from the cities of Huancarani and Urcos and are burned to dry out their tiles. They sell the tiles in their home to people who come from the cities of Abancay, Calca and Urubamba. Her additional economic activity is bringing products, for example potatoes, potato flour, beef and beans, to the city of Huancarni where she sells them. Another of her activities is running a small store where she sells basic items such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. Prisca is thankful for the opportunity offered through this program and she is also committed to making the corresponding payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tree branches.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida, de 40 años, es una mujer emprendedora que vive con su pareja Luis de 41 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos, esta familia vive en una casa alquilada en la localidad  de Huaricolca. Todos los días sale desde muy temprano a trabajar en campos agrícolas, ya que al medio día es calor es insoportable y le es más difícil trabajar. Los productos que siembra es: olluco, papa, habas y avena, de esa manera ha logrado trabajar durante 17 años. Asimismo cría animales como carnero, cerdos y asnos, éste último le ayuda a transportar las herramientas agrícolas que utilizará durante el día. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, más cuando comercializa lo que cosecha, siendo luego trasladados a la ciudad de la Oroya, donde tiene comerciantes mayoristas conocidos que le compran sus productos, en su vehículo que logró comprarse gracias a los ahorros que tuvo. Por tanto espera en el futuro comprarse otro carro más moderno y espacioso, que le ayuda en la distribución de sus cosechas. Este es su décimo primer crédito con MFP, y  se muestra contenta de continuar laborando junto a los integrantes de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, contratará operarios para que le ayuden a mantener limpios sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Adelaida, age 40, is an enterprising woman who lives with her partner Luis, age 41, and their four children. She and her family live in a rented house in the town of Huaricolca. Every day she leaves early to work in her fields because the midday heat is unbearable, thereby making it more difficult to work. The crops she grows are ulluco, potatoes, beans, and oats. Adelaida has been working in this manner for 17 years. She also raises animals such as sheep, pigs, and donkeys. The donkeys help to transport the farming tools that she uses during the day. She greatly enjoys her work, especially when she sells the harvested crops that she brings to the city of Oroya where the better known wholesalers buy her products. With her savings, she was able to purchase a vehicle. In the future she hopes to buy another car that is more modern and spacious to help with distributing her products.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP. Adelaida is happy to continue working with the members of her Communal Bank. The loan she requested will be used to hire workers to help keep her fields clean.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire workers to clear her fields

loans.name: Havasmoh

texts.ru: Рахматуллоева Хавасмох проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж не работает. Сама Хавасмох занимается торговлей детской и подростковой одежды. Имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере. Товар привозит из города Душанбе. Ей помогает ее дочь. Этот бизнес приносит доход. Она одна обеспечивает семью. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Так как начинается школьный сезон, она намерена привезти школьную одежду.
texts.en:
Havasmoh R. lives in Yavan. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband does not work. Havasmoh works selling clothes for children and teenagers. She has vast experience with this. She brings her goods from the city of Dushanbe. Her daughter helps her. This business brings in income. She alone provides for her family. She is taking out a loan to increase sales. She intends to bring in school clothes for the beginning of the school year.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold C. is from the village of Manaoag. He is 50 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Arnold owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Arnold joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Arnold is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his 8th from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Carlos Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. C. S. Carlos Cesar tiene 43 años de edad. Vive con su esposa e hijo. Tiene casa propia, la cual se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrero de campo y en algunas oportunidades como albañil. Su esposa es empleada del Hogar. El Sr. Carlos es una persona muy emprendedora que a logrado salir adelante construyendo parte de su vivienda. Requiere el crédito para poder terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño, según nos comenta es terminar de construir dicha vivienda, para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. C. está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Señor C. S. Carlos Cesar is 43 years old and lives with his wife and son. He has his own house, which is located in the Santiago district. He works as a farm labourer, and when the opportunity arises, as a bricklayer. His wife looks after their home. Carlos is a very emterprising person and he has succeeded in building part of their home. He needs the loan to be able to finish the construction. His dream, he tells us, is to finish building said dwelling, to be able to give his family a better quality of life. He is very grateful for the support we can offer him through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz B. is from the village of Cabisera 15. She is 53 years old and is married with three adult children. Beatriz owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Monte Horeb Solidarity Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO MONTE HOREB




MARIA JOSEFINA C. G. .

Tiene 59 años, es originaria de San Juan Comalapa del Departamento de Chimaltenango, tiene 7 hijos todos ya grandes la ultima hija tiene 18 años, ella se dedica a elaborar tejidos a mano, desde hace 30 años se dedica a esa actividad, ella dice que necesita el préstamo para poder comprar mas hilo para elaborar sus tejidos típicos, porque ya viene la época de fin de año y es cuando mas se venden los güipiles.

CRISTY CAROLINA C.. 

Ella tiene 41 años de edad es originaria de San Juan Comalapa tiene dos hijos uno ya graduado y la otra que esta estudiando 4to magisterio, ella se dedica a la elaboración de güipiles a mano ella necesita el préstamo para aumentar su negocio, necesita el dinero para pode comprar mas materia prima para poder tejer mas productos, porque ya viene la época en que hay negocio, que es Diciembre.


RUTH ANABELLA C. C..

Ella tiene 30 años desde hace diez años ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de güipiles a mano, ella tiene a dos muchachas que la ayudan a sacar sus telas y ella es la que los vende, Pero necesita el préstamo para obtener mas materia prima porque le hacen pedidos pero por falta de materia prima a veces no se compromete y también para poder pagar a las muchachas que la ayudan, ella se siente feliz porque puede ayudar a otras personas a la elaboración de tejidos y güipiles, le da gracias a Dios y a FAPE porque ha logrado tener clientes que le hacen pedidos de güipiles.
texts.en:
MOUNT HOREB SOLIDARITY GROUP

Maria Josefina C. G. is 59 years old and originally from San Juan Comalapa in the Department of Chimaltenango. She has seven grown children, with her youngest daughter being 18 years old. Maria has been producing hand-woven items for 30 years. She says she needs a loan to buy more thread for making traditional weavings because the end of the year is approaching, which is when she sells more blouses.

Cristy Carolina C. is 41 years old and originally from San Juan Comalpa. She has two children, one of whom has already graduated while the other in the fourth year of study toward getting a teaching certificate. Cristy produces blouses by hand and needs a loan to increase her business. The money is needed to buy more materials to make her hand-woven products. December is when she has more business and the end of the year is approaching.

Ruth Anabella C. C. is 30 years old. She earns her living by producing and selling handmade blouses. She has two ladies who help her produce the fabrics and then she sells them. Ruth needs a loan to acquire more materials because she lacks the supplies needed to complete the orders she promised. She also needs to pay her assistants. Ruth is pleased that she can help other people produce weavings and blouses. She gives thanks to God and to FAFE because she has a customer base that place orders for blouses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Sreyroth

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyroth S. (in the photo), is 23 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sophak Pho, is 23 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, They were married in 2004 and have two young daughters. 

Mrs. Sreyroth S. has been a garment factory worker. Her husband is a driver. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to add to her own money to purchase neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.use: To use along with the savings to purchase neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.name: Aina's Group

texts.en:
Aina A. has the status of group’s leader. She is 41, married, and her family has 3 children; the eldest son is a student, the other 2 are school pupils. The family runs their own business, which is cattle breeding and dairy product sales. Eight years ago, they sold sugar and out of the profits bought a cow. Due to the business over the years, Aina has managed to give her son a university education and to increase cattle stock. The loan purpose is to purchase hay for cattle feed. In future, the family wants to arrange for the son’s wedding and to obtain a car.

Djoldoshbek M., 56, is married. His wife has a profession of medical assistant. The couple has 5 children. The family is engaged in cattle breeding and dairy product sales. The loan purpose is to purchase coal for winter.

Elmira K., 41, is married to a tractor driver. The couple has 6 children. The family has been breeding cattle and selling dairy products for 16 years. Their loan purpose is to purchase cattle to develop the business. 

Saule E., 41, is married. Her husband works in Bishkek, where he sells meat in the market. The couple is raising 3 children. With her husband’s and son’s help, Saule breeds cattle. With money received from the loan she wants to improve her living conditions and purchase a washing machine. 

Zainudin A., 36, is married. Her husband supports the family by working as a school teacher. The couple is raising a daughter. The family make their living by cattle breeding. The loan purpose is to purchase calves for resale. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase hay for cattle.

loans.name: Mary Efua Mesima

texts.en: Mary Efua Mesima M. sells provisions and foodstuffs at Asenadze near Abura. Mary has been through junior high school. She is a single parent taking care of four children. She sees to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She hopes to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old lady with a one-year-old child.  For a living, she operates a grocery shop.  She was previously selling handbags.  She has engaged in this business for three years and she hopes to employ people in the future.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused in her business.  She sees herself opening other outlets for her business.  Through Faulu Kenya, she is able to save her money and access financial resources easily.  She has requested 40,000 KES to buy onions, cabbages, kale and cauliflower to sell.

loans.use: To buy onions, cabbages, kale and cauliflower.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 53-year-old married woman with one son. She is the owner of a grocery store in Bint Jbeil. Zeinab’s store is her major source of income and she works hard on improving it. 

Zeinab is requesting  a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her capital, which will lead to an increase in her income. She hopes to provide a secure and good living for her family and to expand her business through opening a wider store.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Dalia Rubio Group

texts.en:
Dalia R. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Dalia is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Dalia R. Group.

Dalia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Dalia plants and harvests fruits and vegetables to sell. Dalia has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 6400 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Dalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Dalia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Dalia's eighth loan  from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her farming business

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El Sr.  Félix oriundo de la Zona de Valle grande Santa Cruz hace 5 años se dedica al transporte publico vive junto con su esposa quien es ama de casa y sus 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, cuenta con una línea (acciones) y un microbús el dinero que solicita es para hacer repara el motor de su microbús la cual es su única fuente de ingresos cuenta con deuda en otra institución pero ha demostrado ser un buen cliente. El sr Félix junto a su familia viven en alquiler y mas adelante desean tener su propia casa en la cual puedan vivir tranquilos y con comodidad es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre velando por el bienestar de sus hijos y de su esposa, esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Félix is from Valle Grande district, in Santa Cruz.  For the past 5 years he has been providing public transport services.  He lives together with his wife, who is a housewife, and his two children who are studying.  Félix has a route (shares) and a minibus.  He is requesting this loan to repair his minibus engine as it is his only source of income.  He has a debt with another institution but he has shown himself to be a good client.

Félix and his family rent their house and, in the future, they would like to own their own home in which they could live peacefully and comfortably.  Félix is a very hard-working person who is always looking out for the well-being of his children and his wife.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To repair his minibus engine

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M., a senior high school graduate, is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. They live in Abura.

Juliana cooks waakye, a stew of beans cooked with rice, to sell. She has been doing so for ten years. Juliana uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Juliana will use her loan to purchase ingredients to cook more waakye so as to meet the demands of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to educate her dependents.

In the photo, Juliana is dishing out some waakye into a polythene bag.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for waakye

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal El Amanecer.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sonia, ella tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 10, 8 y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el muelle.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que decidió realizar este crédito para ayudar a su esposo en su negocio ya que de este depende el sustento de toda la familia, el esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 11h00 o hasta las 12h00 dependiendo de cómo estén las ventas, su forma de trabajo es esperar que lleguen las embarcaciones hasta el muelle y allí comprar el fruto de la pesca para luego revenderlo a comerciantes que llegan desde otras ciudades para llevarlos a distribuir a sus clientes. Esto lo realiza dia a dia desde hace  12 años, nos cuenta que gracias a Dios le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para que su esposo compre pescado y que tenga para la venta. Este es el primer crédito en el Banco Comunal y espera realizar muchos más, le gusta por la facilidad para obtener los créditos. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the Nueva Esperanza district of the city of Manta, there are beautiful beaches that are visited year round. It is here that the Communal Bank “El Amanecer” (The Dawn) meets every fifteen days.

This is where one can find Sra. Sonia. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children (ages 10, 8, and 2). The two older children are in school. Her husband works on a pier.

Sonia is a good housewife and decided to take this loan in order to help her husband with his business since it provides income to support her entire family. Her husband buys and sells fish and works every day between 5am and 11am, and sometimes to 12pm depending on the level of his sales. His method of working involves waiting for the fishing boats to arrive at the pier. From there he purchases the fish that he later sells to merchants who come from other cities so that they can distribute to their customers. This is how he has worked day after day for twelve years. Sonia and her husband give thanks to God that they have done well.

The loan will be used by her husband so that he can acquire fish to sell. This is Sonia’s first loan with the Communal Bank and she hopes to receive many more. She enjoys the convenience by which she was able to obtain the loans. Her dreams include providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: Purchase fish for her husband to sell

loans.name: Charish

texts.en:
Charish L. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 23 years old. Charish is married and has 2 young kids. To make a living, Charish owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Charish works hard to sustain her family and be able to save for her children's future.

Charish joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charish has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Charish is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is 34 years old, married and a father of one.  For four years, he has been selling roasted maize.  Previously, he farmed.  He joined Double Vision group in Faulu Kenya after being introduced by a friend.  Since then, he has improved his business and living standards.  He has been guaranteed a loan of 20,000 kes by his group members.  With the loan, he will buy additional maize for roasting.

loans.use: To buy more maize for roasting

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Jacinta G., quien se dedica a la venta de comida, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, ahora son 15 mujeres que se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 3° ciclo.
La sra. Jacinta solicita el préstamo de los inversionistas mediante Kiva, para la compra de los insumos necesarios para preparar comidas (panificados, carnes, condimentos, cereales, fideos, arroz, etc.), pues solo proveyéndose de comestibles podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y ayudar a su familia y a ella misma a superar la pobreza en la que viven.
texts.en:
This superb group of women is called 'La Esperanza' (Hope).  The group was formed in the city of Ita by the current Director General, Jacinta González, whose business is selling meals.  She contacted the advisor during a weekly meeting that she had in the area to find out how the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) works.  The group now has 15 female members who are very happily working on their third loan cycle.  

Jacinta is requesting this loan through Kiva to buy the supplies she needs to prepare her meals (baked goods, meat, condiments, cereals, noodles, rice, etc.) as these food products are necessary in order to meet her customers' needs and to help herself and her family climb out of the poverty in which they currently live.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing meals (baked goods, condiments, cereals, noodles, rice and meat)

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with one child who attends school. They live at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling as retail to his neighbours and passersby. Salim faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in his area of operation. He dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice, sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and fats for resale. He decided to join Yehu after witnessing other members benefiting from the program.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, rice, sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and fats

loans.name: Edma Clarisa

texts.es: Edma Clarisa tiene 88 años. Se dedica desde hace más de 46 años a la venta de mercadería en general,  su negocio goza de muy buena acogida gracias al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes. Por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de renovar su negocio, Edma desea captar más clientes para poder percibir más ingresos y salir adelante, pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse el dinero de una manera humilde y responsable. Ella sueña con poseer una mini tienda que ofrezca una gran variedad de productos. El financiamiento es para la compra de ropa, calzado, bolsos, toallas, cosméticos y cremas.
texts.en: Edma Clarissa is 88 years old. For the past 46 years she has been selling general merchandise. Her business has been well-received thanks to the good treatment her customers receive. She is always looking for a way to renovate her business. Edma desires to gain more customers in order to increase her earnings and progress. She has always enjoyed working and earning money in a humble and responsible way. Her dream is to have a mini-mart that offers a large variety of products. With this loan she will buy clothes, shoes, bags, towels, cosmetics and cream

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, bags, towels, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, reside en Delicias de Concepción, departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 21 años de edad, él se dedica a la apicultura, que es el manejo de las abejas en sus colmenas, lleva 30 años dedicándose a este trabajo,  su hijo le ayuda al manejo del apiario.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para producir las colmenas, como marcos, fondos, tapadera y cajas.  Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar el apiario y con todos estos materiales completos aumentaran sus ingresos ya que contara con una mejor producción.
Su aspiración es tener un apiario de 60 que tiene capacidad para tener hasta 200 colmenas.
texts.en:
Jose resides in Delicias de Concepción, department of Morazán, where he lives with his wife and 21 year old son. He dedicates himself to apiculture, which is the management of bees in their beehives. He has been carrying out this work for 30 years; his son also helps manage the apiary.

He is requesting a loan to purchase materials to build the beehives, such as frames, bottoms, lids, and boxes. This investment will help him expand the apiary, and with all these materials complete his income will increase given that he will be able to count on an improved production.

His dream is to have an apiary of 60, which has the capacity to hold up to 200 beehives.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build beehives, such as frames, bottoms, lids, and boxes.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam est âgée de 25 ans,  mariée  et mère de 2 enfants.  Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Pelengana de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mariam a laissé  l’école en classe de 8ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour mener le commerce de condiments alimentaires. Elle débuta cette activité  à  côté de sa mère qui vendait du poisson, après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de cette dernière, elle maîtrise bien les rouages du commerce. De nos jours, Mariam en plus des condiments, fait également du poisson séché, au marché Château. Elle mène cette activité depuis 7 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation et clientèle. 
Afin d’augmenter son fonds dans le double souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de renforcer son commerce, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 24 mois. Après 2 prêts individuels correctement remboursés. Elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 3 cartons de concentrée de tomate, des paquets d’oignons séchés, des feuilles de baobab etc, elle s’approvisionne à Siribala et Niono. Mariam vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes   majoritairement.  Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA, qui servira à prendre en charge certaines dépenses familiales. Son ambition est d’avoir une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam is 25 years old, married and the mother of two. She lives in a traditional family in the Pelnengana district in Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). Mariam has dropped out of school in the eighth grade (within Mali's educational system) in order to work as a vendor of food condiments. She started working together with her mother, who used to sell fish. After several years of apprenticeship, she has learned the ropes of her trade. At present she sells condiments as well as dried fish, at the Chateau market. She has been in this business for seven years, and enjoys a good business reputation and customer following. 

In order to increase her working capital with the double goal of meeting customer demand and bolstering her business, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso, and has now been a member for 24 months. After two individual loans, duly reimbursed, she is now on her third individual loan she plans to use to buy three boxes of tomato concentrate, packs of  drued onions, baobab leaves etc. She stocks up in Siribala and Niono.
