Mariam sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly benefit of 100,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover some family expenses. Her goal is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is 30 years old.  She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom go to school.  Joice sells rice and sorghum and has borrowed a loan to stock more rice and sorghum to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more rice and sorghum

loans.name: Eduin Alberto

texts.es:
Eduin Alberto es un joven campesino de 32 años de edad que acompañado por su esposa se ha dedicado a la producción agropecuaria, cultivo de árboles frutales, así como la cría de peces y pollos, lo que se ha convertido en la fuente de sustento para su familia. 

En el futuro, este emprendedor espera tener su propio terreno para realizar dichas labores, pues en el que actualmente trabaja es arrendado, por ahora y mientras trabaja incansablemente para lograrlo, necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos para sus cultivos, concentrado para pollos y concentrado para peces lo que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de su producción y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Eduin Alberto is a young agricultural worker of 32 who, together with his wife, works in the farming business.  He grows fruit trees and also raises fish and chickens.  He has turned this into a source of support for his family.

In the future, this entrepreneur hopes to own his own plot of land on which to carry out his work as he currently works on land which he rents.  Right now, while he works tirelessly to achieve his goal, he needs a loan to buy supplies for his crops and feed concentrate for his chickens and fish.  This will enable him to improve the quality of his production and thereby make more income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops and feed concentrate for his chickens and fish

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Batmunh is 41 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in the Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. His daughter, aged 9, attends the local secondary school. 

He manages a clothes and household goods trading business, with the help of his wife, from a container at a local market. He started his business in 2000. At first he used to rent a stall. He switched to a container in 2005. His business was quite successful which allowed him to buy a truck. He is a hardworking man who is planning to expand his business. He says, "I want to have better living conditions for my family. Therefore, I am doing my best to make my business flourish." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more stock to sell this coming spring.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Shaymaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 32 years old, married and has three children.

Shaymaa has been a tailor since 2002. She makes and repairs women’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, a good reputation and she is well known in her area.
 
She is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy a generator and a tailoring machine. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Elvia María

texts.es:
La Señora. Elvia es socia del banco comunal Prod Natura, vive por la parroquia de  Santa Ana, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes áreas de trabajo.
 
Doña Elvia tiene 49 años, es casada y su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tiene hijos, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad. 

Nuestra socia hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca TIENS (vitaminas, adelgazantes, suplementos nutricionales, productos de belleza, etc.). También trabaja cocinando de lunes a viernes.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos naturales para incrementar su negocio.
 
Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Elvia is a member of the Prod Natura community bank. She lives in the parrish of Santa Ana. This place has cold weather. Its people are dedicated to livestock and farming. Many work in the city of Cuenca in different areas of work.

Elvia is 49 years old, is married and her husband works as a security guard. She does not have children. The house in which they live is their property.

Our member has been dedicated to selling TIENS brandname natural products (vitamins, slimming products, nutritional supplements, beauty products, etc.) for one year. She also works as a cook from Monday to Friday.

This is her first loan with the community bank, to which she was invited by a friend. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of natural products to increase the business. Her goal is to grow the business.

loans.use: to purchase natural products like vitamins, slimming products, nutritional supplements, beauty products, etc.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman with one child who is too young to go to school. She lives in a house she rents that has electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past two years, she has made a living by running a food-vending business, selling various items from her home to neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is that her business is seasonal, but she hopes to someday overcome that by opening a restaurant.  Jackline is applying for a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She joined Yehu to secure loans like this one which will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: 3 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Phương is 38 years old and married. She has two children. Phương is the group leader of the 3 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Phương has a retail business selling general household commodities. She is requesting a loan to purchase household commodities to resell. Phương has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

This is Phương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Phương hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase household commodities to resell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a hardworking businesswoman who is 41 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. For the past nine years, she has been rearing pigs to make a living. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is able save her income.

Regina is requesting a 35,000 KES loan to buy more pigs. In the next five years, she wants to expand her farm and her dream is to have her own piece of land.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, 44, lives in the village of Andabuen. This area is characterized by agriculture and cattle raising.

For several years Edna has sold basic supplies (milk, rice, oil, sugar, coffee, tuna, etc.) and beverages. For the past three years, she has operated her business from her own home for her convenience and security. She tries, with the profits obtained from store sales, to meet all of her household expenses as well as raise her family’s standard of living.

In order to expand her business, she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more merchandise to stock her store. Her goal is to see her business grow and to have the necessary items to offer her customers. 

Edna is a responsible, dedicated and hardworking person who is dedicated to providing more advantages and future opportunities to her children.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, oil, sugar and coffee for her store

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with two children who go to school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. Lucy's house has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water for her family. 

She has operated a green-grocery business for the past three years. Her clients are her neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase vegetables for her business. She decided to join Yehu to gain easy access to loans when she needs help.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Jans Steven

texts.es:
Jans Steven, tiene 21 años, es soltero y reside en la zona de La Merced en el distrito de Comas.
Actualmente viene cursando el sexto ciclo de la cerrera de Chef en Gastronomía, motivado por sus padres y con el apoyo de ellos inició sus estudios, no ha sido fácil pues la carrera es un poco costosa no solamente en cuanto a las mensualidades si no también a los implementos que hay que adquirir para poder iniciar la práctica de la carrera.
Al culminar éste curso le gustaría perfeccionarse en una Institución de mas prestigio y mas adelante poder poner su propio negocio en donde pueda ofrecer lo aprendido.
texts.en: Jans Steven, 21, is single and lives in the La Merced zone in Comas District.  He’s in the 6th cycle of Chef de Cuisine training.  Motivated by his parents and with their support he started his studies.  It’s not been easy because this career is a bit expensive not just because of the monthly tuition costs but also because of the tools that must be purchased to put his skills to practice.  When he finishes this course he’d like to specialize in a more prestigious institute so that he can open a business of his own later on where he can put everything he’s learned to use.

loans.use: to pay his monthly tuition.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 44 years old, married and has three children.  To earn a living, he runs a general store.  He has three years of experience in the business and has employed one person.  He also practices farming to earn extra income for his family.  He has retained his customers in a very competitive environment because of his good customer care.

Geoffrey hopes to grow his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy 50 kilos of sugar, sodas, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy 50 kilos of sugar, soda, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en: Sabha is a 52 years old woman, she is married and has one son and four daughters, she is an employee in The Ministry of Social Affairs with decent salary, her husband is a doctor and has a medical clinic and he wants to improve his work by purchasing more new Medical equipment. Sabha wants to help her husband in getting more Medical equipment, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN. When Sabha gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband in purchasing more new Medical equipment, so her husband will be able to improve his work and compete well with other similar medical clinics, his customers will increase and he will work extra to increase his income and provide better living conditions to the family. Sabha is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in his medical clinic.

loans.use: To purchase more Medical equipment.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, cuenta con casa propia en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  ella se dedica al comercio de periódicos teniendo así un puesto de venta en una de  las avenidas mas concurridas, la señora es conocida por la institución como una persona  responsable ya que es cliente antigua, también es conocida en su barrio y lugar de trabajo por ser una persona amable y jovial con sus clientes, la Sra. Teresa con el dinero del crédito comprara revistas por mayor para vender en su puesto,  se siente agradecida con al institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Teresa has 4 children of school age and owns her own house in the San Pedro zone of the city of Cochabamba. Teresa sells periodicals from her stall in one of the most heavily trafficked avenues. She is well known to our institution as a responsible person as she is an old client. Teresa is also well known in her barrio and place of work for being a kind and jovial person with her customers.

With this loan, Teresa will buy magazines at wholesale to sell from her post.  She is very grateful to our institution for the help offered.

loans.use: to buy periodicals at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Yessie Mercedes

texts.es: Yessie está estudiando Contabilidad, está cursando el último año de su carrera y solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera. Su inspiración ha sido su madre, ya que ella siempre ha buscado la manera de sacar a Yessie adelante y a motivarla para que nunca dejara de estudiar. Después de finalizar su carrera, seguirá estudiando, sacará una especialización para ser Auditor. Le dedica mucho tiempo a sus estudios, diariamente después del trabajo pasa algunas horas reforzando sus estudios.
texts.en: Yessie is studying accounting and is in the final year of her career and is asking for a loan in order to pay for the last year of studies. Her inspiration has been her mother, because she always has searched for ways to motivate Yessie to get ahead and to never stop studying. After she attains her degree, she will continue to study, going for a specialization in order to be an auditor. She studies all the time, daily, and after work she keeps reinforcing her studies.

loans.use: to pay the costs of her last year of study to obtain her degree

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He is 25 years old, and he has been in the transport sector for one year and dreams of building a permanent home and educating his children. He faces a problem of high fuel prices, and his business dream is to have a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Habel

texts.en: Habel is a hardworking business man aged 32. He is married and blessed with three children, and two of them are in school. He does vehicle repairs to earn a living. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. Habel has been able to retain his business because of good reputation with his customers. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a welding machine. He express gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer service. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Pedro Jorge

texts.es:
Pedro Jorge  tiene 41 años casado, vive con la esposa  y dos  hijos, de 10 y 5 años. Vive en el Recinto América en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla UNIDOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto América, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra  de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
Pedro Parra  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  desde hace diez años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende a cualquier comerciante.

El crédito solicito para la compra insumos, semillas, fertilizantes y poder sembrar del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y el bienestar de la familia y para invertir. 
Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta hacer deporte con los vecinos del barrio.
texts.en:
Pedro Jorge is 41 years old.  He is married and lives together with his wife and two children who are 10 and 5 years old.  He lives in América, in Ventanas canton.

The 'Unidos Venceremos' community bank is located in América, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Pedro Jorge is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for ten years.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas and sells his produce to any trader.

Pedro Jorge requested this loan to buy supplies, seeds and fertilizers so that he can sow his corn.  The loan will help him to increase his income, improve his family's well-being, and invest.  His dream is to buy a farm.

Pedro Jorge enjoys taking part in sports alongside his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy supplies, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lourn

texts.en:
Lourn is 38 years old and is a widowed mother with four dependent children, three of whom work in a casino to earn a living. She is originally from a village located in the Ponhea Krek district. For the past five years, Lourn has been planting cassava on her farmland. She earns more than 10 USD each day and is able to save more than 5 USD daily. 

Lourn is requesting her first loan with VisionFund to buy a plot of land in her village to create a financial asset. Her loan will enable her to have another plot of land for her family, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land in her village

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis is married and has five children. She completed J.H.S. Mavis sells phones at Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a driver. Mavis uses her income to help her husband to pay their accommodation bills. Mavis will use the loan to buy more phones to sell. With the new profits from her business, Mavis plans to acquire a shop for the sale of her phones.

loans.use: to buy more phones to sell.

loans.name: Calderon Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras  una de ella es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 4 años . El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, carne de pollo etc., Sonia tiene una mini pulpería también en su domicilio y Jazmín vende productos lácteos.
texts.en: This group consists of three enterprising members, one of whom has owned a convenience store in her home for the past four years. She plans to use the loan to purchase basic grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, chicken and other items. Sonia also has a small convenience store in her home, and Jazmín sells dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase grains, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, beef, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
PRISCA, who is in her early 40's is single with two schooling children.  She has been a food vendor for six years now.  She works from 06 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be PRISCA's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep increasing on the food stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She is doing great with her loan.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, built a place for selling her food, paid rent for her resident place and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the food stock.  She dreams of building her own house.

PRISCA will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the food stock.

loans.name: Conforte

texts.en:
Born in Lomé in 1960, Conforte A. is married and the mother of five, and she also takes care of two other children. She sells chickens at the marketplace helping to support her family. Since her husband’s spare parts store was looted by thieves, Mrs. A. feels she must take on all household expenses, something that is not at all easy to do. But thanks to her devotion and dynamism, she manages somehow to provide the necessities for her family.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $650 as capital to be able to sell sheep in addition to her poultry. This will grow her business and augment her income. The loan will help her to raise the standard of living for her and her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1960 à Lomé, Madame A. Conforte est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants et à sa charge deux (02) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des poulets au marché et contribue aux besoins familiaux. Depuis que le magasin de pièces détachées de son mari a été pillé par les voleurs, Madame A. se voit dans l’obligation de prendre toutes les charges du ménage. Cela ne lui est pas du tout facile mais grâce à son dévouement et son dynamisme, elle arrive tant que mal à subvenir aux besoins vitaux de la famille.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour qu’en plus de l’achat et vente de volailles y associer la vente de moutons afin d’accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus. Ce crédit va l’aider à relever son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell poultry and sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peninah wants to wants to buy 6 medium size steers

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en: M. Zahid  is 43, married and has 3 children. He is a dislocated person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh. He has one cow but it is not enough to cover family needs and to improve his life he needs to borrow 1200 USD to purchase one more cow and calf .

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Ikromiddin

texts.en: Ikromiddin S. is 32 year old and is married with 4 children.  He got in first trading experience in Russia. He saved money and came back home to start his business in Yavan. Now he has had a storefront in the “Tijorat” market for the last 10 years, where he sells men's trousers and shirts.  As the summer season is ending, Ikromiddin would like to borrow $575 to buy autumn mens wear. He has a wholesale trade so the prices to his goods are lower than other sellers. That helps to local habitants obtain goods in a lower price.  Ikromiddin is going to pay off the loan amount in 10 months.

loans.use: to increase the range of goods (to buy seasonal menswear)

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sambo has a home business selling Chinese noodles, coffee, and beer since 2006. She has continued the family business. Her husband also assists her selling their products. Mrs. C. Sambo was married in 1983 and has 2 sons and 3 daughters.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase more beer and coffee to sell to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase more beer and coffee to sell to expand the business.

loans.name: Becky

texts.en: Becky E. is 42 years old, married mother of 6 children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a leader in one of LAPO union and has been in business since 2002. She sells wine and makes call for people in her area. She hopes to get a loan of $625 to enable her buy more wine and recharge cards for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cartoons of wine and cards for call

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Mrs. Graciela R. Ríos is 53 years old and the mother of four children, only one of which is still a dependent. She completed three years of elementary school education. Graciela lives in the country town Túpac Amaru which is in the Carabamba district of the Julcán province of the state of La Libertad.

Thirty years ago Graciela began selling sweaters which she knitted herself and selling bread in the nearby towns. This business maintained her and her family and allowed her to provide her children with an education. Previously, through the use of her savings and a loan from her communal bank, Graciela began new business activities. She purchased curds to make cheese and she sold door-to-door in Trujillo. She also opened a small grocery store in her home.

Graciela was the Community Liaison for Health and helped to negotiate the formation of the Communal Bank of Unity and Effort in her small town. From this bank she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00 ($100.00), which she used to purchase a scale for her grocery store and wool and thread for knitting. With this loan of S/. 2,300.00 ($775.00) Graciela will purchase small animals such as guinea pigs, sheep, and two hogs. She will resell the animals during the holiday season and repay the loan in four installments.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Graciela R. Ríos tiene 53 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer grado de primaria, tiene 4 hijos, pero sólo uno depende de ella. Vive en el caserío Túpac Amaru, distrito de Carabamba, provincia de Julcán, departamento de La Libertad.

Hace 30 años inició un negocio vendiendo chompas que ella misma tejía y también pan por los distintos caseríos de su distrito. Con este negocio ha mantenido y ha dado educación a sus hijos. Posteriormente, con lo que fue ahorrando y con los préstamos que recibió en su banco comunal ha ido realizando otras actividades como comprar cuajada para prepara quesos y venderlos casa por casa en la ciudad de Trujillo y también puso una pequeña bodega en su casa.

Fue Promotora Comunitaria de Salud y gestionó la formación del Banco Comunal “Unión y Esfuerzo” en su caserío en su banco comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00, que le sirvió para comprar lanas e hilos para tejer y una balanza para implementar su bodega. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,300.00, el cual pagará en cuatro cuotas, comprará animales menores como cuyes, carneros y dos chanchos, para venderlos en las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Purchase of small animals (hogs, sheep, and guinea pigs).

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en: Josephina, age 27, is married with a toddler. She started a tailoring business in 2004 where she works from 8am to 6pm daily. From this business, she can make a monthly profit of about $90. She now hopes for a loan to expand her services in order to increase her profit. She belongs to a loan group called Jitelyemee, which totals 34 members who ensure that they each pay back their loans.

loans.use: To expand tailoring services

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en: The Upendo Group is a group of female entrepreneurs in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam. Kimbaile A. is the leader of the group, and has a small business that sells firewood. The group is requesting a loan to help fund their businesses.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Mr Marvin Vaellecillo L. is a vey hardworking individial, dedicated to his business of selling clothes, which he does travelling on his bike through the street of Cinos Pinos in the Chinandega department.

His work started three years ago travelling to different places selling trousers and shirt in all sizes and styles. According to Marvin, his hard work is all to maintain his home, given that he has two children in primary education, who need their father's full support.

Mr V. currently needs to purchase more clothing whch he can then market and sell. This is why he is wisely asking for a locan from Ceprodel to acquire stock and then sell it through his travelling business in the streets of Cinco Pinos, as per usual on his bike.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El señor Marvin V. L. es una persona que se destaca por ser muy trabajador dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa vendiendo ambulante en su bicicleta en las calles del municipio de Cinco Pinos del departamento de Chinandega.

Su labor la inicia desde hace tres años movilizándose por todos los lugares ofreciendo pantalones y camisas de toda talla y de diferentes estilos. Según comenta, sus grandes esfuerzos se deben exclusivamente para la manutención de su hogar ya que tiene dos hijos que estudian en primaria y por tal razón merecen todo el respaldo de su padre.

La necesidad que actualmente atraviesa el señor V. es la adquisición de la ropa para comercializarla. Por esta razón muy sabiamente solicita crédito en Ceprodel para adquirir la mercadería y luego venderla ambulantemente en las calles de Cinco Pinos como acostumbra hacer en su bicicleta.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to market and sell

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en: Oussama is 31 years old. He has 2 children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. Oussama owns a falafel restaurant. This is the first time he has applied for a loan through kiva. He wants to buy cooking equipment for his business.

loans.use: to buy cooking equipment

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sodi

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Sodi, aged 38 years old, and her husband works in a private company. She possesses high spirits in life. Ni Ketue Sodi has 2 children, 1 already has his own family and the other in college. Ni Ketut Sodi is very grateful because her child receives scholarship from the regent because he excels in his studies. Ni Ketut Sodi had operated her stall for a long time. With the funding received from DIMARI Rp.5.000.000,- (about USD540) will be used for buying all essential for the stall. Included in the merchandise sold are several varieties light food and varieties of traditional Baliness cakes. Everyday Ni Ketut Sodi purchase at the state market leaving for the market at 4 am, distant between the market and her home is close by. Returning back by 5 am Ni Ketut Sodi immediately prepares and cooks all necessities of the stall and family. Ni Ketut Sodi starts selling at 6 am because since early many buy snacks, coffee, and tea. Everyday gross revenue earned Rp.400.000,- (USD43) and net income Rp.20.000,- (USD2) daily. Ni Ketut Sodi is grateful that receiving funding from DINARI thus enabling her stall to be busy.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Sodi berumur 38 tahun dan suaminya bekerja disebuah perusahaan swasta. Ni Ketut Sodi memiliki semangat hidup sangat tinggi. Ni Ketut Sodi memiliki 2 orang anak, 1 anaknya sudah berumah tangga dan 1 masih kuliah. Ni Ketut Sodi sangat bersyukur karena anaknya mendapat beasiswa dari bupati karena pintar. Ni Ketut Sodi menekuni usaha warungnya sudah lama.Dengan modal yang didapat dari Dinari Rp.5.000.000,- dipergunakan untuk membeli semua kebutuhan warungnya.Adapun dagangan yang dijual adalah berbagai macam makanan ringan dan aneka jenis kue tradisional Bali. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Sodi berbelanja di pasar Negara pukul 04.00 pagi sudah berangkat ke pasar, jarak pasar dengan tepat tinggalnya sangat dekat. Sampai dirumah pukul 5.00 pagi Ni Ketut Sodi langsung mempersiapkan dan memasak semua keperluan warung dan rumah tangganya. Ni Ketut Sodi mulai berjualan jam 6.00 pagi karena pagi-pagi banyak yang membeli jajan, kopi, dan teh. Setiap hari penghasilan kotor yang didapat Rp.400,000,-dan keuntungan bersih tiap hari Rp.50,000,-. Ni Ketut Sodi bersyukur mendapat pinjaman dana dari Dinari sehingga warungnya menjadi ramai.

loans.use: Add Funding for Business to equip her stall (Menambah modal usaha untuk melengkapi warungnya)

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
From a young age, Hermelinda has always worked in the agricultural field. Even today, alongside her husband, she works in agriculture with the aim of providing well-being for their beloved children. She grows potatoes, ollucos (a South American root crop), corn, and broad beans. She also raises bulls in order to sell them. Her desire for progress motivates her daily, which is why she has decided to improve her business activities with the help of a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hermelinda, desde muy joven se dedica a las labores agropecuarias y ahora en compañía de su esposo con el objetivo de procurarles bienestar a sus amados hijos. Siembra papa, olluco, maíz y habas, además de engordar toros para su posterior venta.Su deseo de progreso la motiva a diario y por esa razón a decidido mejorar cada una de sus actividades con la inyección de un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital for improvement of agricultural activities

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Mr. Rodolfo is 45 years old and has been working in transportation for many years. His wife, Keyla, supports him in his decisions and agrees with his goals. To Rodolfo, the most important thing is working hard so that he can provide everything necessary for his children who are students and the center of his life. Rodolfo owns a motorbike, but would like to purchase another and hire another person to drive it to increase his income. However, Rodolfo need to purchase replacement parts for his current motorbike that is in disrepair. With your help Rodolofo will be able to achieve his goal in a very short time. Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Rodolfo tiene 45 años y labora en el transporte de pasajeros desde hace muchos años, su esposa Keyla lo apoya en todas sus decisiones y está de acuerdo con sus metas trazadas. Para él lo más importante es trabajar duro, ya que de antemano quiere brindarle todo lo necesario a sus hijos que estudian y son su razón de ser. Rodolfo es propietario de un motocarro, pero desea comprar otro, para lo cual empleará a otra persona que lo maneje, y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Sin embargo, su moto requiere de una reparación urgente y la compra de repuestos. Con tu ayuda haremos cumplir el propósito de Rodolfo en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts for this motorbike.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti P. lives in a Bagdol, Lalitpur.  She lives with her husband and two sons.  Her husband, Mr. Nar Bahadur P., works in a hospital.  Her two sons are studying in grades 6 and 2.

One year ago, Mrs. P. started supplying decorative items in the local market.  She buys these goods from wholesale Chinese markets and supplies them in the local market.  She started this business to uplift the living standards of her family.  She also doesn't want to depend in her husband's income.

Now, Mrs. P. is requesting her second loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy varieties of gift and decorative items to increase her supply in the local market.

loans.use: To buy varieties of gift and decorative items

loans.name: Hamrohon

texts.ru: Назаров Хамрохон  проживает а районе Вахш. Занимается услугой такси. Необходимо получить кредит для того , чтобы отремонтировать машину. Автомобиль это единственный источник дохода его семьи. Поэтому ремонт машины сможет обеспечить его бесперебойной работой.Хамрохон женат и у него четверо детей. Живут они дружно и весело.
texts.en:
Hamrohon N. lives in the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan. He is a taxi driver and wants to take out this loan in order to repair his car. Hamrohon's taxi business is the sole source of income for his family and repairing his car will assure that he can continue working without interruptions. Hamrohon is married and has four children. He has a great family who are very close to each other.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taxi cab repair

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Suyapa E., me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo 5 años de tener mi negocio el cual tiene bastante demanda ya que estoy ubicada en una zona muy poblada, personas de escasos recursos son mis clientes y me prefieren ya que vendo a un precio accesible para todos mis clientes, en estos momentos necesito surtir mas mi negocio y necesito un credito para poder acondicionar mi pulperia con muchos productos ya que las exigencias de mis clientes son bastantes, gracias a este negocio he sacado adelante a mis hijos en estudio y alimentacion, tambien no los descuido ya que mi negocio queda en mi casa de habitacion, de esta forma paso al cuidado de mis hijos. deseo salir adelante para tener una mejor ganancia y poder mejorar mi calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Suyapa E.. I sell popular consumer products. I have had my business for 5 years. The business has a lot of demand because it is located in a very popular area. My clients are people with limited resources, and I prefer them because I sell at an accessible price for all of my clients. At this time, I need to supply my business more, and I need a loan to be able to stock my grocery store with many products, since my clients have many demands. Thanks to this business, I have taken my children forward in their education and nutrition. Also, I don’t neglect them because my business is located in my home. In this way, I take care of my children. I want to go forward to have a better income and to be able to improve the quality of my life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soups, wheat flour, corn, sugar, coffee, milk, soft drinks, juices, rice, salsas, churros, hams, oil, butter, pastas, white bread, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en: Zarrina S. is a very hardworking woman who knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has a beautiful daughter. She raises and feeds animals with the goal of later selling them. She guides them into the field each day for feeding. This activity gives her satisfaction because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional visits from the veterinarian has increased their population. She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her daughter. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750) for the term of 5 months to buy calves and feed for her animals. She is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To buy calves and expand her business

loans.name: Born

texts.en:
Mr. Born P., 61, and his wife, Mrs. Kimyun Ly, 55, who live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1974 and have nine children; two sons and seven daughters. Two sons are married and live outside the family house, two children are farmers,  two children sell clothes, two children stay at home, and the last child studies in the local school.

Mr. Born and his wife have been farming for twenty-eight years. They grow rice and cucumbers on their farmland near the village. Now Born is applying a loan of $ 1000 to use for growing rice and cucumbers.

loans.use: To use for growing rice and cucumbers.

loans.name: Omonzoda

texts.en:
Omonzoda is a very optimistic man in spite of the circumstances he has endured. He is 47 years old and married with a 14 year old son. Omonzoda raises cattle, and he uses his the income to support his family’s expenses. He has a great appreciation for animals and Omonzoda wishes to increase his cattle, and therefore increase his earnings. He hopes that you can help him by funding his loan. You could become an important part of his family's life. Omonzoda deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim T. is 50 years old and sells fruit in the Bati district, Takeo province, Cambodia. She has had her business for about 5 years and she makes $4 every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. Her husband is a rice farmer and typically earns less than $1 each day.

Sim T. is asking for a loan of $500 to invest in her own fruit business by increasing her stock of fruit to sell. She sees this investment as the opportunity that enable her to increase her daily income.

loans.use: Purchase more fruit to sell to increase business

loans.name: Idiale

texts.en: Idiale E. is 25 years old and single. She sells clothes and sarongs by hawking, carrying her goods on her head from street to street. Idiale believes that this is the best way to advertise her goods. Now Idiale has applied for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell. She says thank you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
She is a woman with courage and even at 60 year old she is willing to pursue her business. She is married and blessed with 6 children who will help her manage her business.

	Clarita is engaged in processing peanut brittle. She started the business in 1999 with an initial capital of only P500.00. The people living in the municipality serve as her customers. Today she is also consigning to other places in Hamtic and Dao, buying and selling bananas and does food vending to help with the family's daily needs and the education of her children.

	She aspires that someday she will be the producer/manufacturer of different types of food, alleviate poverty in her family, and send her children to school so they can find a stable job in the future.

loans.use: To purchase food processing ingredients

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 40 year old man who lives in Tyre, in Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Khalil has owned a fruit and vegetable shop since 2003. He sells all kinds of fruits and vegetables, depending on the season.

Khalil has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his shop. Khalil has been a microcredit client for four years and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him to diversify his merchandise and improve his financial situation. Khalil is special in his work because he has competitive prices and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Khalil decided to start his business because he needed to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Khalil will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen O. is a 26-year-old mother of a boy named Preet, age 2. Maureen is trained as a computer tutor but right now cannot find work so has been working as a tailor for income. She is asking for 10,000 Kenyan Shillings and intends to start her own cyber café.

Maureen recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Clothing material, maybe a computer

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru:
Холиков Джура-47 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Его жена работает учительницей в их сельской школе. Их дети тоже идут в эту школу. Она учитель начальных классов. Зарплата учителей совсем маленкая, но жена Джуры все равно ходит на работу, чтобы учить сельских детей. Холиков Джура, после 6-ти лет кредитования в нашей организации увеличил свой капитал  и купил себе машину.
Сейчас у него закончились наличные деньги, и он взял кредит, чтобы купить еще одну партию товара хорошего качества.
texts.en:
Jura H. is 47 years old, married and the father of three children. His wife is a teacher at the village school, which their children also attend. She teaches the youngest children. Although a teacher's salary is extremely low, Jura's wife still goes to work in order to instruct the village children. This is the sixth year Jura has been a loan client of MicroInvest and in that time he has increased his working capital and purchased himself an automobile. At present money is tight and Jura has taken out a loan to purchase a new selection of high-quality goods.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Ruqaiya Parveen M.iqbal Group

texts.en:
My name is Ruqaiya parveen and I have been a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the last 9 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. My husband's name is M. I.. He runs a grocery shop in the community. I help my husband by operating a sewing clothes business. Through this business, I am somehow able to share the financial burden with him. I am applying for a loan to buy groceries for his grocery shop.

I am a group leader of four other women from my locality. Zareena kosar baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell. Maqsoodan baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy animals (goats) for their animal-selling business. Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva I. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 41 years old. Eva is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a trading business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying cashew nuts and processing them for sale to her established buyer. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more cashew nuts to process and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and provide for her family's needs. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Babughirana B Munyampogha Peluce Group

texts.en:
M. Peluce is a hardworking, active business lady aged 34. She is the single mother of one child who is going to school. She is also taking care of one dependent.

She has been dealing with tomatoes so far for one year. She is using the loan to purchase tomatoes in bigger volume which will improve her business. She is a courageous lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes in bigger volume to improve her business

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is 36 years old and married with two children. She sells juice, drinks and pepper soup in her restaurant. She has been in this business for the past two years. Kehinde has numerous customers patronizing her restaurant because she has good customer relations and she knows how to prepare pepper soup very well. She lives in Ogun state and she is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more juice, drinks and pepper soup items to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 30-year-old, married mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 10, 8, 6, and 4. She buys grains from farms and hires a pick-up truck to take them to the market where she sells them on the side of the road. The grains include, maize, millet, beans, green grams (lentils), and also cassava.

Carolyne hopes to grow her business bigger. She will use the loan to buy more stock so that she can sell more each day. Right now she sells 2-4 bags in 3 days and she wants to purchase 10 bags so that she can sell more. She also wants to add rice and some other foods to her stock.

Carolyne didn’t finish school, but she wants her kids to finish school and to go abroad. She wants them to grow up “not like me if possible”.

Carolyne is also a community health worker. This means that she volunteers to visit the sick and vulnerable in her community. K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional micro-finance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. Many of the loan recipients from this organization are volunteer community healthcare workers like Carolyne. For more information about K-MET, see the partner link on the lower right side of this webpage.

loans.use: buying more stock for her little business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. sells clothes at Elmina. Elizabeth has received a senior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a ward assistant. Elizabeth has been selling clothes since 1999. She supports the upkeep of her family.

Her loan will increase her capital to buy more clothes for resale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale at the market.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a member of the Kidumu borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 31 year old woman, She is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 7 and 5 years old.

Hamida has owned a clothing business selling Fabric (Vitenge,kanga) for 6 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Hamida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitenge and kanga.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan , Hamida hopes to pay school fees, get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge and kanga(Fabric)

loans.name: Passy's Group

texts.en: N. Passy is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children with the eldest being 13 and in Primary seven. She is a strong business lady and a tailor for 4 years. At the moment, out of the clothes she makes, she is able to make 50,000/= as weekly profits and would like this to increase in future. She will be able to expand her business by including the sale of clothing materials and already made clothes so as to increase revenue by expanding her business. Passy also hopes to buy a plot of land where she will construct rental houses. She needs a loan to help buy more clothes for sewing as well as to complete the payment of her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Buying clothing materials for sewing.

loans.name: Liana

texts.es:
Liana tiene 28 años, es una mujer muy responsable, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a vender productos de belleza, para ello prepara los alimentos de la familia desde muy temprano para después ir a ofrecer de casa en casa sus productos. Sus principales clientes son sus amistades y vecinos, pero constantemente está a la búsqueda de incrementar su clientela, pues entre más pedidos tiene sus ganancias aumentan. La parte más difícil de su trabajo son las cobranzas, pues algunas veces sus clientes no están en sus casas o demoran en pagarle, por ello debe ser insistente para recuperar su inversión. Durante estos años ha congeniado mucho con sus clientes, ya que gracias a ellos y a sus ventas ha sido premiada por ser la mejor consultora de belleza y eso la motiva a seguir trabajando en ello. 
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y durante los créditos anteriores ha demostrado ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Asimismo, es una eficiente y muy querida secretaria de la junta directiva de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita le servirá para incrementar su stock de productos, especialmente en perfumes, pues menciona que con estos productos obtiene mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Liana, age 28, is a very responsible woman. She lives with her partner, the father of her 2 children. For four years, she has been involved in selling beauty products. She prepares her family’s meals very early so that afterwards she can leave and offer her products door-to-door. Her principal customers are her friends and neighbors, but she is constantly seeking to increase her clientele since with more orders her profits increase. The most difficult part of her work is the collection of money because sometimes her customers are not home or delay paying her. That’s why she has to be persistent in order to recover her investment.

Over the years, she has gotten along very well with her customers since thanks to them and to her sales she has been an award winning beauty consultant, and that has motivated her to continue working at the job.

This is her third loan with MFP and during previous loans she has been very punctual with her payments. Also, she is an efficient and very well regarded secretary of the board of directors of her communal bank. The money which she is now applying for will be used for increasing her stock of products, especially perfumes, because she says that with these products she obtains better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine U. is 30 years old, is married with one child, and he takes care of five dependents. He lives in Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda where he has had shop selling fabric and making/sewing clothes since 2002. His business is open from 8 AM to 8 PM every day and, in that business, he employs two people.

Antoine is now requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing some new types of clothes and fabrics which he believes his customers will appreciate. With this loan, he hopes to be able to attract more customers and strengthen his business which will help him to build a secure future for his family and dependents.  He is grateful to VFC and Kiva lenders for facilitating his credit needs.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fabrics and clothes

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en: Teresiah is a business lady who is married with two children. She runs a school in Kajiado, a busy market town near Nairobi. She has run the school for five years and has three employees. She previously had a retail shop. Her loan is for 50,000 KES, and she will use the funds from this loan to develop the school. In the future, she hopes to become a leading teacher and mentor, transforming the lives of many.

loans.use: To develop the school

loans.name: Soleil Plus Group

texts.fr:
Sylvain K. K. 43 ans, est président d’un groupe dénommé « Soleil Plus », composé de 28 micro entrepreneurs engagés à recevoir solidairement des prêts octroyés par les prêteurs du monde à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC, dans le but de renforcer leurs activités.
Sylvain gère un petit atelier de fabrication de petits panneaux solaires et vend de matériels électriques dans une zone la plus peuplée située au Nord-est de la ville de Kinshasa. Vu la demande qui croit, Sylvain compte beaucoup sur le prochain prêt pour lui permettre de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et aussi accroitre son revenu dans le but d’élargir son atelier en ouvrant un autre service la réparation de matériels électriques. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 2 et 10. Deux seulement sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Sylvain K. K., aged 43, is the president of a group named "Soleil Plus", composed of 28 micro-entrepreneurs committed in solidarity to obtaining loans granted by the lenders of the world via Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC. The goal of the members is to bolster their businesses. Sylvain manages a small workshop making solar panels, and he sells electrical equipment, in the most populous area northeast of the city of Kinshasa. Given the growing demand, he is counting a lot on the next loan to enable him to meet customer needs and also to grow his revenues. The goal is to expand his shop by opening another place for repairing electrical equipment. He is married and the father of three children, ranging from 2 to 10 years of age. Just two of them are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical equipment to sell with the goal of boosting his capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 25 years old and married with a four-year-old daughter named Linet. She runs a salon and beauty shop called Prestige, offering chemical treatments, hairpieces, braids, and weaves. She's been in this business for four years and has three employees. She was previously employed in another beauty shop. She says that her business is active and her clients are loyal. She successfully repaid a previous loan from Faulu for Kes. 35,000 and requested this loan for Kes. 80,000 to buy weaves, braids, a dryer, relaxers, and hair food. 

She describes herself as hardworking and honest and says that since she became a member of Faulu she has expanded her business and improved her living standard. In the future, he hopes to build her own home and start a beauty school.

loans.use: To buy products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Veronica is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Veronica owns and operates a business venture in retail sector operating a specialized retail store.While not the only means for generating revenue the means source of income comes primarily from selling food in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $50 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh has worked as a builder since 2007. Working on a freelance basis he manages a part of house projects in his village and its surroundings. He's married with three young children who still go to school.

Today, Saleh is requesting $1,200 to buy a wood support for his work.

loans.use: To buy a wood support

loans.name: Erasto

texts.en:
Erasto is 64 years old and is married with three children aged between 16 and 21. He lives with his family in Ruhengeli, Gakenke district, in the Northern Province of Rwanda. His region is called Gashenyi where his business is located.

Erasto sells leather. He was a farmer but he could not earn enough to supply all needs for his family, which is the reason why he prefers to be a businessman rather than a farmer. Since he started his business he is able to sort out some of the problems in his family.

Erasto has been an entrepreneur for many years and employs five people from his community who help him to collect the animal skins from the different villages. The hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Erasto is requesting his loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company so that he can expand his business through purchasing more animal skins. Once his plan is successful, he hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to save money for his children and to improve his family situation.

By the way, Erasto is quite an old man and hardworking. We don’t doubt that his target will be reached.

loans.use: To purchase more animal skins to sell

loans.name: Phanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Phanny C. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sokny Un, have been married since 1986. The have four children, a son who is attending school, and three daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives in separate home and two daughters weave silk at home. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Phanny C. has been a silk weaver for more than twenty years. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sokny Un has been a mason for more than seven years. 

Phanny has borrowed one previous Kiva loan. She now is requesting another loan of $250 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn F. is a 58-year-old farmer. She started tilling a small parcel of a rice farm in 1975, and has been in this line of business ever since. She explains that her rice farm is doing well. To illustrate, on average, she is able to produce 80 sacks of rice grains per harvest.

She is now applying for a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP ($275) from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan proceeds to buy farm supplies to improve her harvest.

loans.use: To improve her harvest by purchasing additional farm supplies

loans.name: Aminata Dauda

texts.en: Aminata K. is a trader who is 31 years old and owns a shop where she sells provision and drinks. Her shop is strategically located in one of the busy streets in town. She is married with one daughter and four dependants. Although an illiterate, Aminata has been in business for about 10 years and has been managing the business very well. She normally opens her shop from 7 am - 12 pm each day. She is, therefore, in search of a loan that will enable her to get more stock to meet her customers' needs. She will use the profit from the business to care for her family as her husband is currently studying and not working.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr: D. Geneviève est née en 1980 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique. Cela fait bientôt 12 ans que Geneviève vit à Sékou, à Allada. Mariée à D. Rigobert, un extracteur de vin de palme, Geneviève est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Geneviève a encore trois autres enfants à sa charge.  Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Geneviève seconde son mari pour assurer les charges de la famille. En effet, pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, Geneviève exerce comme activité principale la production et vente de l’huile de palme. De manière secondaire, Geneviève vend également du « Sodabi », une boisson locale. Geneviève commercialise et fabrique ses produits non loin de son domicile. N’ayant jamais fréquenté l’école, Geneviève exerce son activité depuis bientôt six ans. En tant que cliente fidèle de ALIDé, Geneviève a déjà obtenu deux prêts qu’elle a bien remboursés. Geneviève envisage obtenir un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour assurer un bon fonctionnement de son activité et par la même occasion augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
D. Genevieve was born in 1980 in Allada in the Atlantic district. It's almost 12 years since Genevieve has been living in Sekou, in Allada. Married to D. Rigobert, a palm wine tapper, Genevieve is the mother of 5 children who are all in school. Genevieve has 3 more other children at her care. The couple lives together with their children. Genevieve supports her husband to take care of family expenses. Infact, to contribute to family expenses, Genevieve engages in the production and in the sale of palm oil as her major trade. She sells equally Sodabi, a local drink, as a secondary business. She sells and makes her products not far from her home. Never ever attended school, Genevieve has been doing this trade for almost 6 years. Being a faithful customer of ALIDe, Genevieve already had two loans that she repaid. Genevieve intends to get a third loan from ALIDe in order to insure the smooth running of her business and also to increase her turn over.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 5 basins of palm nuts and 50 liters of Sodabi

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Natif de Djenné,  Monsieur Amadou T.  est âgée de 34 ans mariée et père de 4 enfants. Il est polygame et vit avec ses épouses et leurs enfants dans le quartier  Kôkô de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Comme tous les enfants de leur famille, Amadou a fréquenté l’école  coranique, mais il n’a pas pu continuer les études, ce qui explique son très vite intérêt pour les activités génératrices de revenus en l’occurrence la couture, apprise auprès de son père. Sa notoriété est bonne, car il est bien sollicité par ses clients pour la qualité de ses services.  
Pour augmenter  son fonds de roulement, la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, Amadou a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  premier prêt  individuel. 
Il compte acheter, des fournitures de couture   au Burkina Faso et à Bamako et effectue son activité dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle  constituée de femmes et d’ hommes au comptant. 
Amadou envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement de son échéance et satisfaire le besoin de sa   famille  avec le reste.
texts.en:
A native of Dienné, Mr. Amadou T. is 34 years old, married and father to four children. He is polygamous and lives with his wives and their children in the Kôkô district of the town of Koutiala (region of Sikasso). Like all the children in their family, Amadou went to Koranic school but was not able to continue with his studies. This explains his why he rapidly became interested in revenue generating activities, in his case tailoring, which he learned from his father. He has a good reputation, since he is in great demand from his customers for the quality of his services. In order to increase his working capital, his business volume and customer satisfaction, Amadou decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with which he is on his first individual loan. He is planning to buy sewing materials in Burkina Faso and in Bamako and he carries out his activity in the town of Koutiala for a customer base made up of women and men; he sells for cash. Amadou envisages making a monthly profit of 100,000FCFA which he will use for the repayments on his loan; the rest will be used to provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is happy that her hogs are healthy. She said that she owes it to her loans from CEVI because she was able to acquire feed that she needed. She hopes for her business to grow more. She also said that her loans helped her to earn and enabled her to send her children to school. Now a widow, she works hard so that she can provide for the increasing needs of her household. 

Margarita would like to request for a loan of PHP15,000. She told CEVI that she would use this loan to acquire additional piglets and feeds.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco V. M., tiene la edad de 33 años, está casado, y vive con la señora y sus 2 hijos, de 1 y 6 años.Ellos son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para preparar el terreno para posteriormente sembrar frijol y maíz, además para la compra de insumos. Desea darle una adecuada preparación al terreno para luego darle un buen mantenimiento a los cultivos y así lograr una mejor calidad y poder obtener un ingreso mayor cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han  brindado siempre. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Francisco V. M. is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children ages 1 and 6. They are his priority. He wants a loan to prepare earth to then plant beans and corn, and also to buy supplies. He wishes to prepare the earth adequately so then he can take good care of the crops and in this way achieve a better quality and be able to earn a greater income when it is harvest time. This is the first loan he is seeking from FUDECOSUR and he is happy with the opportunities provided to him. He hopes to provide his family a better quality of life in the future and a greater economic stability, and be able to continue growing as a person and businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and supplies to grow crops

loans.name: Santos Agustin

texts.es: Santos Agustín tiene 27 años, el se dedica a brindar el servicio musical. El tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues siempre ha buscado la forma de mejorar su negocio y lo ha logrado por medio de los financiamientos que han sido de gran ayuda para que su negocio avance. Sus inicios se dan desde hace 10 pues el siempre está buscando la forma de obtener ingresos como todo padre responsable le brinda a su hijo la educación que el necesita. Es así que el motivo del financiamiento es  para la compra de materia prima como instrumentos musicales, alambres, extensiones, parlantes entre otras cosas. Sueña con seguir manteniendo a su familia por medio de este negocio.
texts.en:
Santos Agustín is 27 years and provides musical services. He has been working with the Foundation for a long time. He has always looked for a way of improving his business and has achieved it through means of funding that have been of great help for the advancement of his business. He began ten years ago but is always looked for a way to obtain income as any responsible father would to provide his son with the education that he needs. This is why his motive for funding is for purchase of raw material such as musical instruments, wire, extensions, and speakers, among other items. He dreams of continuing to maintain his family through this business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina, tiene 45 años y es natural de Huambutio. Su actividad económica principal es llevar comida a la ladrillera. Ella también se dedica  a la elaboración de yeso. Su esposo Julio trabaja con la elaboración de tejas. Requiere el préstamo para comprar leña y rama que sirve para hacer secar las tejas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
        
Martina se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Martina is 45 years old and she is from Huambutio. Her primary business is taking food to the brick factory. She also makes chalk. Her husband, Julio, makes roof tiles. She needs the loan to buy firewood and branches to dry the tiles on. She belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Vírgen del Carmen de Huambutio” communal bank. Martina is grateful for the opportunity granted her through this program and she promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy branches and firewood

loans.name: Merlyn's Group

texts.en: Merlyn C. is from the village of Piao. She is 45 years old and married. Merlyn is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store business running a general store. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To have the capital to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Slivia

texts.en:
Slivia N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala eastern region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. Slivia has been running a business selling snacks such as sausages for one year. To help expand her business, Slivia is requesting a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda, which will be used to buy more meat. Slivia hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to expand her business. In the future, Slivia hopes to open up another business such as cosmetics.

Note to lenders:
BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva that funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan.

The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.

Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more meat

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon G. is from the village of Punit. She is 32 years old. Corazon is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised animals.

In 2009, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Corazon from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días, además junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería en su misma casa. 
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras hace 15 años y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro, Graciela es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Graciela solicita un crédito de 1400 para la compra de madera.
Graciela sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios e implementar una ferretería.
texts.en:
Graciela has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruits, and beverages. She manages her business every day. In addition, she manages with her husband a carpentry shop that is also in their house.
