Graciela has been a member of the Communal Bank “Obreras” (Workers) for 15 years and what she enjoys most is having the incentive to save. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Graciela is requesting a loan of 1400 PEN to buy wood. She dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and opening a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood for her carpentry business

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-at N., who is 37 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Dea, who is 30 years old (and pictured here), live along the National Road Number one, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have two children, one son and one daughter. One of them attends school and the other stays at home. 

Sam-at has been driving a Tuk Tuk taxi (a motorized rickshaw) in Phnom Penh for a year. His wife stays at home and does housework. The house where they live is small, so it’s difficult for family members to stay. Therefore, Sam-at is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to add to his own money to renovate the house.

loans.use: To add to his own money to renovate the house where he lives.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras De Ñanduti Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité  es del área Tavai-Pirayú. 

Son Señoras muy trabajadoras que se dedican de lleno a sus pequeños negocios, todas estas señoras anteriormente no tenían un capital para trabajar mejor y hoy en día gracias al programa Comité de mujeres Emprendedoras tienen una oportunidad de generar más ingresos a sus familias, gracias al pequeño capital que les brinda la Fundación Paraguaya.

Las Señoras están muy agradecidas con la Fundación por tan importante  apoyo que les brinda. 

Las integrantes ya culminaron hoy su ciclo número 6, poseen una antigüedad de  1 año y 7 meses.
Una de ella es la señora Norma quien se dedica a la venta de productos variados desde comestible, golosinas, bebidas, y productos para el consumo familiar como yerba, aceite, enlatados, panificados y otros.
Este negocio lo ha ayuda bastante con los gasto de su familia y por ello desea invertir en ella y aprovechar los ingresos para ir mejorando su actividad actual ampliando el negocio o comprando otros productos para vender.
Ella comenta que está muy satisfecha con el comité y la ayuda que recibe de su grupo es muy importante para ella ya ha progresado mucho no solo económicamente sino en también en el sentido de valores que se relacionan a la mujer y desea continuar en su grupo.

Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas, carne, aceite, panificada, enlatada y otros.
texts.en:
The women who form this group are from the Tavai de Pirayú area. They are very hard-working women who dedicate themselves fully to their small businesses. All of these women previously did not have enough capital to improve their businesses, but today thanks to the working businesswomen's group program and the little capital provided by Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya they have an opportunity to earn more income for their families. The woman are very grateful to the foundation for the support of such importance it provides. The members are now finishing their sixth loan cycle over the past year and seven months. One of the members is Norma, who makes a living selling varied food and beverage products such as maté, oil, canned goods, bread products and other items. This business has really helped her with family expenses, so she wishes to invest in herself and take advantage of the income by improving her business and expanding and buying more products to sell. She tells us she is very satisfied with the group and the help she receives from her fellow members has been been very important for her, since she has progressed so much not just economically but also in valuing the relationships with her fellow women, and she wishes to stay in the group. Norma is requesting the loan to purchase beverages, meat, oil, baked goods, canned goods and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages, baked goods, snacks, meat, oil and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new machine for her business

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a married man with three girls; one attends school while the other two are still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated his restaurant business for the past three years, selling to his neighbours and passersby. Katana faces the major challenge of inadequate kitchen utensils to serve many customers. He hopes to operate a big restaurant serving many customers in the future. 

Katana decided to join Yehu because it provides sustainable financial services to social economically marginalized entrepreneurs. With the Kshs 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase kitchen utensils, spoons, and plates for his restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils, spoons, and plates for his restaurant.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.fr: Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes  traditionnels et bazins . Elle compte dans cette activité 10 ans d’expérience. Elle contribue au menage et fait le commerce de pagnes et bazins.  Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina-Faso et revend à Lomé.Elle sollicile au près de WAGES un credit pour satisfaire plus de clients
texts.en: She is married and the mother of two. She resells traditional fabrics: colorful “pagnes” and damask-type “basins.” She has over 10 years of experience in this area. She contributes to the family budget by selling “pagnes” and “basins.” She stocks up in Burkina-Faso and resells in Lomé. She is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to be able to  have more customers.

loans.use: Purchasing and resale of traditional fabrics

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma N., a married woman who lives in Common, Brgy. Daan Banwa, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental, earns her living by conducting three ventures: a pig-fattening business, a therapy practice, and a general store. Her husband, Leonardo N., 53 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.

Thelma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Thelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase feed and vitamins for the pigs so that she can continue to save up for the future of their family's needs. Thelma N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a community member who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: Boris

texts.en: Boris S. has been trading in tires since 2000. He replaces and balances car tires. Boris loves his trade and has permanent customers. Although in Boris’ large family he is not the only person employed, his is the main income that sustains the family. Taking into consideration the increased seasonal demand, Boris has applied for a loan to stock up on tires.

loans.use: To stock up on tires

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan K., 58, is a village woman living in Kompong Cham Province. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and corn on her own farmland. Her husband is a local farmer, and he helps her in the farming business as well. This couple has eight children, four of whom are single. The other four are married. They have two children who work in a casino in Kompong Sam Province, and they have a salary about $80 per month. 

The coming rainfall will be good for her crop, however, Chan K. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, Chan K. is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, corn seed, and vegetables for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, corn seeds, and vegetables to plant

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: La Sra. Sabina llego a nuestra oficina por recomendación de un cliente de nuestra institución, La Sra. Sabina tiene su casita propia en la que vive con sus hijos, su actividad es venta de refrescos y cerveza los días viernes, sábados, domingo y lunes, también tiene una rockola mientras los clientes disfrutan de sus bebidas frías pueden escuchar una buena música, el dinero solicitado será para aumentar su capital, (compra de refrescos y bebidas), la Sra. Sabina esta agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo que le brindo cuando necesitaba.
texts.en: Sabina came to Emprender's office on the recommendation of another client. Sabina has her own home where she lives with her children, her activity is selling drinks and beer on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays. She also has a jukebox, so while her clients enjoy their cold drinks they can also listen to good music. The requested loan will be used to increase her working capital to buy drinks. Sabina is grateful to Emprender for the trust placed in her.

loans.use: To buy drinks by the case

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

He has operated a quarry business, selling building blocks for the last two years; his potential customers are house constructors and builders of houses. Samwel faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to open a hardware store to supply building materials in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase a site for selling building blocks. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase a site for selling building blocks.

loans.name: Mariela Giovanny

texts.es:
Mariela es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío San Francisco de Yaranche,el cual esta ubicado en el distrito agrícola  de Tambogrande de la Región Piura a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Mariela se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. Ella cría ganado ovino en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta con pastos naturales y, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona en donde ella reside. 

Ella desea adquirir más animales para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Mariela es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mariela is a 34-year-old mother who resides with her family in the San Francisco de Yaranche settlement, located in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, in the Piura region, some 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Mariela works as a laborer associated with agriculture. She raises sheep in corrals located near her domicile. She feeds them with natural feeds and, when they have reached a good stage of development, she offers them for sale to traders in the zone where she resides.

Mariela wants to acquire more animals in order to expand her business and earn more income. For this, she considers it convenient to request a loan of 500 new sols from Edpyme Alternativa to assist her in reaching her objective.

Mariela is a quite enterprising and hard working person whose major hope is to be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: TO BUY MORE SHEEP TO RAISE AND SELL

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis se dedica al transporte D. carga pesada, tiene dos camiones D. los cuales uno lo maneja el cliente y el otro su padre, ambos formaron este negocio que hasta la fecha le está dando buenos resultados. El solicitante vive en casa familiar conjuntamente con su esposa y sus hijos su casa es propia D. material noble. Requiere del crédito para realizarle mantenimiento a sus dos camiones ya que anteriormente realizó gastos comprando llantas. Cuenta con buena capacidad D. pago, por lo que se propone el siguiente crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. José Luis has a heavy load transport business.  He owns two trucks, one of which is used by customers and the other by his father, with whom he set up the business.  It has been going very well for them so far.  

José Luis lives in his own home with his wife and children.  He needs the loan for maintenance of his two trucks since he had to cover the cost of buying new tires.  He has enough income to cover payments and, therefore, is requesting the loan.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: María Tomasa

texts.es:
María Tomasa P. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras. Ella inicio hace 25 años vendiendo naranjas y unos cuantos limones ahora tiene mejor surtido su negocio y cuenta con una trabajadora.
Ella tiene cinco hijos de 28, 22, 14, 12 y 6 años de los cuales los menores están a su cargo.
texts.en:
María Tomasa P. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who works buying and selling fruits and vegetables.  She began her business 25 years ago, selling oranges and lemons.  Now she has a larger stock and has a worker.

She has five children who are 6, 12, 14, 22, and 28 years old.  The young ones are in her care.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en: Zeynab B. is 49, a brave married woman who works hard for the good of her five children, and she does so with the help of her husband and two sons of 20 and 22 years old. She has 21 years of experience in breeding and selling cattle. Her husband usually sells her cattle in the livestock bazaar. The strict discipline she uses with her children allows her to count on her household’s advice and support in working the fields.  Zeynab’s children’s grateful attitude continues to encourage her and they have gathered many lessons during this time that they can use when they form their own households. Zeynab needs a small loan to purchase one more calf.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina, de 41 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Iván de 43 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. El negocio de Alejandrina es la venta de Películas, canciones, documentales, dibujos animados, en formato DVD, ella aprovecha las ferias dominicales de la ciudad de Pichanaki para vender su producto, ya que sabe que existe una gran demanda por los DVD, resultándole muy rentable.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disponer de su tiempo para su trabajo sin descuidar su hogar, asimismo le hace independiente. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar DVD, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Con el tiempo, desea tener una tienda de videos más adelante, con la cual obtenga mejores ingresos económicos. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más DVD, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, age 41, is a cheerful and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Iván, age 43, and their two beloved children who are the main reason behind all of her efforts. Alejandrina has a business selling movies, music videos, documentaries, and cartoons on DVD format. She takes advantage of the Sunday fairs in the city of Pichanaki to sell her products because she knows there is great demand for DVDs. Her business has profitable results. What she enjoys most about her job is having time to work without neglecting her household duties, thereby allowing her to be independent. She has been in this business for three years and considers the most difficult part to be carrying her DVDs with her, but she knows that this is part of her job and is willing to do it. Later on, she wants to open a video store so that she can generate more income.

This is her third loan with MFP. Alejandrina is willing to complete her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. She is an active participant in her group. The loan of 600 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more DVDs so that she can offer her customers a wider variety.

loans.use: To purchase more DVDs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase casual clothing.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
MARIA TERESA P. L.
La señora María Teresa P. López  se dedica a la venta de perfumería , ropa  típica y joyería  desde hace 12 años ella tiene 5 hijos   dos de ellos  son menores de edad  y los otros  tres son mayores de edad   la señora a salido adelante  con la ayuda de sus  hijos   ya que desde hace  6 años  murió su esposo por ese motivo  necesita su nuevo refinanciamiento  en crédito para poder surtir mas sus ventas   en cosmeticos en perfumeria  es la que más vende  y otra parte para ropa típica   por ser en este mes abril que se tiene la semana santa  y  a tenido muchos pedidos de ropa   su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para poder sostener su negocio y a sus hijos y así mismo poder contratar a alguna persona  para poder  vender mas.
texts.en:
María Teresa P. López has been selling perfume, typical clothing, and jewelry for 12 years.  She has five children.  Two of them are minors, and the other three are adults.   Since her husband died six years ago, she has gotten ahead with the help of her children

That is why she needs a new loan to be able to be better stocked for her cosmetic and perfume sales.  That is what she sells the most.  She will use part of the loan for typical clothing because Holy Week is in April, and she has had many clothing orders.

Her greatest wish is to continue working to be able to sustain her business and support her children.  Also, she would like to be able to hire someone in order to be able to sell more.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and typical clothing

loans.name: Araley

texts.es:
La señora Araley, vive en unión libre con el señor Leonardo, ella tiene veinticuatro años de edad y  a su responsabilidad están dos hijos: Pablo Leonardo de siete año, Carlos Alberto de seis años de edad.

    El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes como son: azúcar, huevo, aceite, harina,  para  la elaboración de dulces de nuégados, como también  elabora tamales  para venderlo en la misma localidad, en  esta actividad diez meses y cometa que le va viene ya  que con ello sosteniendo ingresos en su hogar.

   Comenta que se dedica a esta actividad para  por su propia idea ya que  también quiere aportar con los ingresos y su marido no se sienta sola con que solo el trabaje, así los dos trabajaran y  saldrán adelante.

   Su  grande  deseo es que con esta actividad  logre tener ingresos y con ello   sacar adelante a sus familia que es lomas  importante para ella.
texts.en:
Araley lives in a common-law marriage with her husband Leonardo.  She is twenty-four years old and responsible for two children:  Pablo Leonardo, seven years of age, and Carlos Alberto who is six.

The loan requested is to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as: sugar, eggs, cooking oil, and flour for making nougat candies.  She also makes tamales to sell in the same locality.  She has been in the business for ten months, and comments that things are going well and the income has helped her support the household.

She states that starting a business was her own idea, because she also wants to contribute with an income so her husband won’t feel that he alone must work.  This way, they can both work and get ahead.

Her greatest wish is that she will manage to generate some income through this activity to help the family get ahead, which is an important goal for her.

loans.use: buy ingredients for making candies and tamales.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with four sons, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Florence has been operating a street food business for the past 10 years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also sells charcoal to add to her income.  Florence faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult for her to operate her business. She dreams of becoming self-sufficient in the future.

With this loan for 20,000 Kshs, Mwanamisi wants to purchase 40 sacks charcoal to resell. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy 40 sacks charcoal

loans.name: Fuerza 2008 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se denomina “Fuerza 2008” y está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la Unidad de Microfinazas de la Asociación Arariwa Cusco, Perú.  
   
En esta reunión conocimos a la Sra. María Belén que nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad de Cusco y donde actualmente también vive, ella tiene 46 años y es madre y padre para sus dos hijos. Maria Belén es ama de casa que después de hacer sus actividades D. hogar tiene que trabajar, ella trabaja como secretaria en una agencia de viajes. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Maria Belén también tiene una pequeña pizzería que tiene de nombre “La Gran Pizza” y donde ya tiene trabajando casi cerca de 6 meses. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo jamón y queso. El sueño de Maria Belén es abrir una cadena de restaurantes. 

* La Sra. Maria Belén es la persona que está levantando la mano  en la fotografía.
texts.en: The "Fuerza 2008" group consists of responsible and hard-working people who get together every 30 days at the offices of Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Peru. At the latest meeting, we got to know María Belén, who tells us she was born and still lives in Cusco. She is 46 years old and is both mother and father to her two children. After taking care of her household responsibilities, María works as a secretary at a travel agency. She has made a living in this activity for the past 15 years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. María also has a small pizzeria called "La Gran Pizza," where she has been working for nearly six months already. At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients like ham and cheese. Her dream is to open a restaurant chain. *María is the woman raising her hand in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients (ham, cheese, etc.)

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer and a resident of Litein Town in South Rift, Kenya. He has been in farming for 14 years.  His farm produces milk which is sold to the local Kabianga Dairies and tea which goes to the local James Finlay tea factory. 

David has requested a loan of 41,867 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This is his first loan request with Juhudi Kilimo and he hopes he will generate enough income to repay the loan and improve his family's living standards.

He says the challenge in his business is the dry spell experienced from December to March. He appreciates Juhudi’s consistent assistance to farmers.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eighteen years. He is 41 years old and married to Elizabeth.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 16,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use this new loan to buy potato seeds for planting.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy more potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Janet Cristina

texts.es:
Janet  es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad, tiene 1 hija menor de edad, actualmente vive con su abuelo y su hija en la comunidad de Chapen, en el departamento de La Libertad departamento conocido por su sus costumbres y por el realce a la Marinera danza típica del Perú.

Janet se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas (carnes de res, de chancho, de cabrito, etc.) labor que desempeña en el mercado de su localidad en el cual tiene dos puestos propios,  Janet tiene ya más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y cuenta con buena clientela fidelizada en su negocio.

Janet esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para que con este dinero  pueda comprar más animales vivos, posteriormente los sacrificará para vender sus carnes.

Janet es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, que anteriormente demostró su puntualidad y responsabilidad, ya que su objetivo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y de esta manera poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida asu hija y a su abuelo
texts.en:
Janet is a 28-year-old mother. She has one young daughter and currently lives with her grandmother and daughter in the Chapen community, in the La Libertad department. La Libertad is known for its customs and for what it has added to the traditional Peruvian Marinera dance.

Janet sells red meat (meat from cows, pigs, etc) in the local market where she has her own two stalls. Janet now has over 8 years' experience in this business and has a good, loyal customer base.

Janet is requesting a loan of 3000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, with which she will purchase more live animals which she will slaughter to sell their meat.

Janet is a hard-working and enthusiastic woman, who has already demonstrated her punctuality and responsibility. Her goal is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to be able to offer a better quality of life to her daughter and grandmother.

loans.use: to purchase animals to later sell as meat.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a la venta de comida, es madre soltera de un joven de 30 años, ella se dedica desde hace 14 años a la venta de alimentos, trabaja todos los días de la semana de 5:00am a 3:00pm, aprendió por su madre y hoy en día es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta.
Quiere comprar de un préstamo la mercadería que se utiliza a diario para elaborar los platillos, como arroz, pollo, carne, aceite, gas propano, con la inversión garantizara sus ventas para un buen periodo, sirviéndole para fortalecer y abastecer la demanda.
El propósito de ella es que su negocio tenga vida por un largo plazo, por eso recurre a los préstamos para poder cubrir el gasto en mercadería y tener mayor disponibilidad.
texts.en:
Rosa sells food.  She’s a single mother of a 30-year-old young man.  She’s been selling food for the last 14 years.  She works every day of the week from 5am until 3pm.  She learned from her mother and today this is her only source of income.

She wants to use the loan to buy merchandise she uses every day to prepare her dishes like: rice, chicken, meat, oil and propane gas.  This investment will guarantee sales for a good period of time helping her strengthen and meet demand.

Her goal is that her business stays alive for a long time and this is why she calls on loans to cover costs of merchandise to have more available.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, meat, oil and propane gas.
